Una D. las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropas, comenta que hace tiempo que se dedica a esto, por lo que le trae muy buenos ingresos, además D. eso dice que tiene muchos pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir, es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra D. ropas, con las cuales podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The commission was formed thanks to the intervention of a member of another commission, which spoke to its members about this program of women entrepreneurs.  The commission is called "Mujeres Vencedoras" and it is in its second loan cycle with 13 members.  It is a group consisting of unified, socially conscious and responsible people, whose members possess a great enterprising spirit, and so they have pledged to fully satisfy their commitments.  

One of the members is Maria, who makes a living selling clothes.  She indicated that she has been making a living in this way for quite some time, and that it has brought her very good earnings.  She also says that she has many requests that she would like to be able to satisfy, and therefore she is asking for a loan to buy clothes, with which she will be able to take on those new customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in order to resell.

loans.name: Reina Luisa

texts.es: Fuimos a casa de Reina y nos atendió muy sonriente, porque ya había vendido todos sus pescado, queso y bollo (Amasijos de maíz con queso, o anís y otros ingredientes)  bien temprano, para que sus clientes se desayunaran. Su vida siempre se ha movida en el comercio, pues desde hace  15 años, cuando se unió a su cónyuge, este le dio el primer capital para que iniciara  con la fabricación y venta de bollos y con  sus ya conocidos  pasteles y/o hayacas, especialmente preparados en las épocas navideñas entre vecinos y amigos y posteriormente extendida en un mercado mayor. Su cónyuge siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de pescado y por eso ella también adicionó este producto y así mismo, el queso que consiguió con distribuidores a un buen precio. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y por eso trabaja diariamente con mucho esfuerzo, para algún día lograrlo y ofrecerle un futuro mejor a su hijo de 12 años de edad. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer credikiva, también primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen y de contado,  pescado y queso que son los productos de más auge en esta época. Su inversión será exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos y aprovecha la oportunidad de comprar de contado y ganar descuentos importantes, que le generen un poco más de utilidad.
texts.en:
We went to Reina's house where she attended to us very smilingly, because she already had sold all her fish, cheese, and "bollos" (corn cakes with cheese, anise, or other ingredients) very early, so her customers could eat breakfast.

Her life always has been moved by business.  Fifteen years ago when she married her husband, he gave her her first capital so she could start making and selling bollos along with her already well-known "hallacas" (cornmeal, meat, and vegetables in banana leaves), specially prepared in the Christmas season between neighbors and friends, and later expanded into a larger market.

Her husband has always worked selling fish, so she also added this product as well as the cheese that she got from distributors at a good price. 

Her dream is to have her own house.  This is why she works so hard every day, to one day achieve that and to give her 12-year-old son a better future.

Currently she is requesting her first Kiva loan, which is also the first loan she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will pay in cash for greater quantities of fish and cheese, products that are at their peak season.  Her investment will be successful because she takes orders  and takes advantage of the opportunity to pay cash and earn important discounts, which generate a bit more profit for her.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of fish and cheese with cash.

loans.name: Loryo

texts.es: Loryo es natural de la comunidad de Santa Fe, tiene 32 años, es un hombre trabajador y se esmera por sobresalir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Isabel de 28 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Carmen y David a quienes desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Loryo, es el cultivo de cacao y café, pues las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona y es es gracias a los constantes cuidados que le dio a sus cultivos. Sus productos más rentables son los granos de cacao por tener mayor demanda en el mercado nacional. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace permanentemente, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los puntos de venta situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesto a cumplir sus cuotas puntualmente como lo venía haciendo en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es un socio participe y  puntual en toda las reuniones acordadas. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 soles podrá fertilizar sus plantas para ello comprará fertilizantes.
texts.en: Loryo is from the community of Santa Fe. He is 32 years old. He is a hard-working man, and he makes a great effort to excel and move forward. He lives in his own house with his wife Isabel, 28 years old, and his 2 beloved children, Carmen and David, whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. Loryo grows cacao and coffee, and he has converted the extensive lands he owns into one of the main producers of the area, thanks to the constant care he gives his crops. His most profitable products are the coffee beans, because there is greater demand for them in the national market. What he likes most about his work is harvesting, and he does it permanently. He has been doing this work for 25 years, and he considers transporting his products from the  farm to the points of sale located in the city of San Francisco to be the most difficult thing about his work. This will be his seventh loan with MFP, and he is prepared to make his payments on schedule, as he did with his previous loans. He is a participating member of his communal bank, and he is punctual in attending all of the agreed-upon meetings. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, he will buy fertilizer in order to be able to fertilize his plants.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Walter Danilo Miguel

texts.es:
Walter, se dedica a la venta de CD Y DVD, también papas fritas, él vive con su esposa y demás familia, juntos realizan las ventas, Walter aprendió de su madre a manejar los negocios, ya que desde joven ayudaba en las ventas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de CD y DVD, además de aceite y papas, para la producción de la venta de papitas fritas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y poder atender la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es aprender cada día para mejorar sus ventas, adquirir nuevas experiencias y que pueda crecer en los negocios.
texts.en:
Walter works selling CDs and DVDs, and also french fries.  He lives with his wife and other family, and they all participate in the selling.  Walter learned how to manage his businesses from his mother, as he has helped her out with sales since he was a young man.

He is currently requesting a loan to purchase CDs and DVDs, and also oil and potatoes for making french fries for sale.  This purchase will help him to improve his business and be able to meet customer demand.

His goal is to learn more on a daily business to improve his sales, acquire new experiences, and be able to grow his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, DVDs, oil and potatoes for his businesses.

loans.name: Puchucollo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUCHUCOLLO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Concepción. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de leche, venta de ganado, cría de ganado, venta de flores, venta de ovejas.
 
La señora Concepción,  indica que es la primera ves integra  Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la asesora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganado que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra vaca lechera) que comprará la feria y posteriormente lo criará en su casa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Puchucollo” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Concepción.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: milk sales, livestock sales, raising livestock, flower sales and sheep sales.

Concepción indicates that this is the first time she joins Pro Mujer; she was invited to do so by the credit advisor.  She currently raises livestock, a business she’s had for many years having learned it from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase her working capital (to buy a dairy cow).  She will buy it at the livestock exchange and then raise it at home.  This way of working allows her to generate income to provide for her family since she’s married and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 36ans. Elle est mariée å un infirmier avec 02 enfants en charge. 01 enfant est scolarisé. Le premier a 08 ans et le dernier a 02ans.  
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1998. Elle vend de façon ambulante à ses clients dans la ville de Lomé après avoir acheté au marché.
Akouavi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait élargir son activité en ajoutant d’autres choses. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi, age 36, is married to a male nurse and has two children to support. One of them attends school. The oldest is 8, and the youngest is 2. She has been working as a pagnes (colorful African cloth) reseller since 1998. She gets her supplies at the market, and resells as a street peddler.

Akouavi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pagnes. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to bolster her business by selling other items. She says that she intends to use her profits to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, porque quiere surtir el negocio, ya que no tiene el dinero necesario para realizar una nueva inversión en el negocio, la compra será en llantas nuevas y usadas, este nuevo pedido es para mantener siempre disponibilidad ante la demanda.
Estos préstamos le han servido para que su negocio sea más rentable y pueda satisfacer a los clientes en las necesidades.
texts.en: Ana is again requesting a loan because she wants to stock her business.  Since she doesn't have the necessary funds to make a new investment in the business, she will use the loan to purchase new and used tires.  This new request is being made so that she can steadily keep up availability in the face of demand.  These loans have worked towards her business becoming more profitable and becoming more able to satisfy customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase an allotment of new and used tires.

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 52 años de edad Ernesto de Jesús es un emprendedor que sueña con tener su propio negocio, un puesto de comidas rápidas donde pueda explotar su talento en la cocina. Es conciente que para cumplir su sueño necesitará un préstamo con el cual comprar insumos para preparar las comidas y herramientas de trabajo para exhibir y almacenar los insumos, pues actualmente no cuenta con el capital necesario para iniciar su microempresa.

Ernesto es un luchador incansable que se propuso mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo que trabaja cada día con la motivación de cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: At the age of 52, Ernesto de Jesús is an entrepreneur who dreams with having his own business, a fast food stand where he can exploit his culinary talent.  He is cognizant that in order to reach his dream he will need a loan with which to buy ingredients to prepare the meals and work tools to display and store the ingredients because he currently lacks the necessary capital to start his micro business.  Ernesto is a tireless fighter who is determined to improve his and his family’s quality of life so he works daily motivated to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals and a stand to sell them in.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For buying clothes, floor polish, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger amounts of ingredients like oil, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Leandro Isabel

texts.es:
Leandro, se dedica a la producción  de granos básicos, vive con su esposa y familia, su dedicación a las labores agrícolas lo inicio joven, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio y ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante con sus cosechas.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas,  estos materiales le ayudaran para tener una buena cosecha, con producción abundante para poder vender una parte y generar ingresos para su hogar.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando la agricultura, invertir bien el crédito y poder recibir buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Leandro grows staple grains for a living.  He lives with his wife and family.  He began doing agricultural work when he was young; his parents taught him the trade and he has been able to get his family ahead with his harvests.

At the moment he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides.  These materials will help him have a good, plentiful harvest so he will be able to sell part of it and generate income for his home.

His goal is to keep working in agriculture, invest his loan well, and be able to get good results.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Living Waters Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50-year-old Orppa from Gweru. Orppa is single and has three children. Orppa runs a poultry business. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges she faces is the death of chicks. 

Orppa has requested a loan of $400 to buy chickens and chicken feeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to sustain the family in providing daily needs. In the future, Orppa plans to diversify into egg selling.

loans.use: To buy chicks and stock feeds.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años, es una mujer sincera y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Cesar de 38 años y sus 06 queridos hijos, a quienes desea cederles sus tierras posteriormente. Trabajando arduamente Vilma, ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos y enviarlos a la escuela. A Vilma le gusta su trabajo ya que con la venta de sus productos tiene  una bodega de abarrotes en donde vende: arroz, galletas, detergentes, conservas, entre otros productos, en la que tranquilamente atiende a sus clientes. Mientras que su esposo la ayuda en la chacra, pero en tiempo de cosecha ayuda a su esposo al igual que sus hijos y algunos jornaleros que contratar para así extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos dejando por un tiempo su negocio. Tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y espera mas adelante sembrar café así como  incrementar más productos para abastecer su tienda. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará en el progreso de su trabajo, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, comprará semillas de café para así aumentar sus sembrios y obtener mayores ingresos, con el resto comprará productos para implementar su tienda como: sacos de azúcar, arroz, conservas, galletas.
texts.en:
Vilma, 42, is a sincere, hardworking woman living in her own house with her husband, César, 38, and their six beloved children that she wants to leave her fields to eventually.  Working hard, Vilma has managed to raise her crops.  She rises early every day to tend to her children and send them off to school.  Vilma enjoys her work because with the sale of her products she was able to open a grocery store where she sells rice, cookies, detergent and canned goods, among others, and where she can take care of her customers in peace.

Her husband helps her with the field work but during harvest season in addition to her husband her children also help and even some day laborers who are hired help to reap the fruit more quickly and she leaves her store unattended for that time.  She’s been in this line of work for 20 years and hopes later on to plant coffee as well as increase the stock merchandise in her store.

This is her sixth MFP loan.  She knows that this loan will help her work make progress so is willing to make all her installment payments punctually.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very well liked.

She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy coffee seeds to increase her plantings and obtain higher income and the rest will be used to buy merchandise to stock her store like sacks of sugar, rice, canned goods and cookies.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and sacks of sugar, rice, cookies and canned goods.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est une jeune mariée de 31 ans qui habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle est spécialisée  dans le commerce de couscous et  de tissus voile. Elle capitalise une expérience de 12 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi cette activité pour se faire un métier .Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2010. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des céréales afin de lutter contre l’inflation et la raréfaction  des produits au niveau local. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce de couscous.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou is a young married woman, 31 years of age, who lives in a town in Senegal. She specializes in the sale of couscous and fabric for headscarves. She makes the most of her 12 years of experience in her business. She chose this business in order to establish a profession for herself.

Mrs. Fatou has been a member of one of the UIMCEC offices since April 2010 and has already repaid a previous loan. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs with the goal of purchasing grains in order to combat local inflation and reduction in availability of these products. This loan will allow her to make a better profit in her business selling couscous.

loans.use: to purchase grains.

loans.name: Aracely De Fátima

texts.es:
Aracely es una mujer emprendedora que desde pequeña fue criada en el campo, se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos como negocio familiar y así ha podido sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante. 

Sueña con tener un criadero de cerdos más grande y mas reconocido en el sector, pues así cada vez serían más los clientes y sus ingresos se incrementarían notablemente. Actualmente espera poder comprar un cerdo para la temporada de fin de año que es cuando las ventas aumenta, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprarlo por lo que solicita un préstamo, puesto que las ventas se incrementan en diciembre y ella debe estar preparada para generar mas utilidades en esa época. Aracely trabaja con gran esmero para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, y asegura seguirlo haciendo para lograr una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Aracely is an enterprising woman.  Since she was little she was brought up in the countryside.  She raises pigs as a family business and that’s how she’s been able to raise her two children.

She dreams with having a larger, better known pig farm because that way each time the number of her customers will be larger and income will increase notably.  She currently hopes to buy a pig to have ready for the end of year season which is when sales increase but she lacks the needed capital to buy it so is asking for a loan because sales rise in December and she wants to be ready to earn more profits during that season.   Aracely works with much dedication to improve her quality of life and that of her family and makes sure to continue to do so to attain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a pig to fatten up for end of year season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy grocery stock such as flour, milk, salt, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer to store meat.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida tiene 39 años,  es una mujer responsable. Su  vida se centra en el apoyo a sus padres: Epifania y Isidoro, que son ancianos y a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el barrio del Tambo. Su rostro calmado y algo serio son producto de su lucha por salir adelante. Terminó la carrera técnica de Veterinaria, con mucho esfuerzo, pues tenía limitaciones económicas, pero eso no la detuvo, pues trabajó mucho para lograr su objetivo. Ahora cura a todo animal enfermo, hace este servicio a los pobladores de su zona, también a clientes de otros lugares que conocen de la capacidad de Nelida, por lo que obtiene ganancias extras. Pero como ella es una mujer emprendedora, también abrió una tienda de comestibles en su casa, aquí vende productos de primera necesidad, en especial menestras y verduras, que son los alimentos que más vende. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en su negocio y espera ampliar su tienda y convertirla en grande y surtida. Asimismo quiere seguir estudiando, “nunca se deja de aprender”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San martín de porras” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe durante todo estos años. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Nelida de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda y medicinas para la curación de los animales que atiende.
texts.en:
Nélida, 39, is a responsible woman.  Her life centers around helping her parents, Epifania and Isidoro, who are aged and she cares for in her own house located in the Tambo neighborhood.  Her calm and rather serious expression is the result of her struggle to get ahead.  

She completed a technical veterinary career with much effort because she had economic limitations.  That didn’t stop her, though; she worked hard to attain her goal.  Now, she treats any sick animal, a service she provides to her zone’s residents as well as to customers in other areas who know about Nélida’s skill thereby earning extra income.

However, since she’s an enterprising woman, she also opened a home-based grocery store where she sells basic need items, especially vegetables and foodstuffs, which are the food items she sells the most.  She’s had the store for three years and she hopes to enlarge it and turn it into a large, well-stocked store.  She also wants to continue to study.  “One never stops learning,” she affirms.

She belongs to the “San Martín de Porres” communal bank and this is the 10th MFP loan where she feels very grateful for all the support through the years.  She also promises to be very punctual with her installment payments.  If Nélida were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy basic need items for her store and medicine to heal the animals she treats.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and medicine for the animals she heals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty wants a loan to buy milk for resale. She is a 34-year-old widow with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling milk and other milk products. She has owned this business for seven years. Betty’s dream is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Amah est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée à un imprimeur. Elle a 03 enfants, dont  02 à l’école. Le premier à 15 ans et le dernier a 09 ans.  
Amah travaille comme revendeuse de gravier depuis 2006. Elle sert ses clients au bord de la plage. Elle travaille avec 01 personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque d’argent pour satisfaire la demande. 
 Amah a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du gravier. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Amah voudrait satisfaire toutes les demandes. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit le bien etre de sa famille et impliquer certains dans le domaine.
texts.en:
Amah is a 41-year-old woman who is married to a printer.  She has three children, two of whom attend school.  Her eldest child is 15 years old and her youngest is 9.  

Amah has been working as a gravel retailer since 2006.  She serves her customers on the beachfront.  She works with the help of one other person.  Right now, her main difficulty is a lack of money with which to satisfy demand.

Amah has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy gravel.  She would like to re-invest in her business.  In the coming years, Amah would like to satisfy all the demand she has.  She says that she plans to use her profits to provide for her family's well-being and to get some involved in the field.

loans.use: to buy gravel

loans.name: Yeovil Group

texts.en:
Ennie is a 28-year-old single woman. She has one child who is one year old. She lives in Mvuma near Gweru. She has been operating a boutique in Mvuma for the past two years. She sells clothes and wedding attire. Ennie is also a hairdresser.

Her business is greatly affected by low sales. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy an overlock sewing machine. With additional income obtained from her business, Ennie looks forward to a better standard of life for her family. She plans to save for the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas and to pay school fees

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de ciudad del Este, está integrado por 16 mujeres, las cuales se encuentran trabajando en el cuarto ciclo. Todas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos para sus familias y de esa forma poder darles un mejor futuro.
Una de las miembros es la señora  Lilian, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella, es decir, ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Dice que por medio de su trabajo logra ayudar a su familia y a la manutención de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, con lo cual podrá aumentar su variedad y cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This is committee is from Ciudad del Este.  It is made up of 16 women who are now working on their fourth loan cycle.  They are all friends and neighbors from this city.  They got together with the goal of earning more income for their families and thereby being able to give them a better future.

One of the members is Lilian.  She sells vegetables for a living.  She says she has many customers who always buy from her.  In other words, she already has a solid clientele.  She says that her work allows her to help her family and to keep up her house.  

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables, which will allow her to increase the variety of what she sells and satisfy her customers.  She thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunities they have given her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Burkina Group

texts.fr:
Mme PEGDWENDE SOPHIE est la représentante du groupe BURKINA. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 08ans.02 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des chaussures et de la bouillie depuis 02ans. Elle vend la bouillie tôt le matin et se rend au marché après pour vendre ses chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et au marché de secteur 10 à Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont ses voisins et ceux qui fréquente le marché.

Elle veut s’acheter 10plats de petit mil pour la préparation de la bouillie et 30 paires de chaussures.

Mme utilise ses économies pour améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un moyen de déplacement. Elle veut aussi aider son mari pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. PEGDWENDE SOPHIE is the representative of the group BURKINA. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 8. Two of the children attend school. She has one person to support. 

SOPHIE has been selling footwear and porridge for two years. Early in the morning, she sells porridge and then goes to the market to sell shoes. She gets her supplies at the big market and at the Sector 10 market in Ouagadougou. Her customers are her neighbors and those who come to the market. 

SOPHIE wants to buy 10 platters of pearl millet to make porridge and 30 pairs of shoes. She uses her savings to improve her business. Her ambition is to buy a means of transport. She also wants to help out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: 10 platters of pearl millet for making porridge and 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a 52-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him. His desire is to educate his children up to university level. He has been in the car tire business for ten years. His hardship is limited funds to buy enough supplies. His dream is a wholesale business. Clovis needs money to buy car tires for resale.

loans.use: to buy car tires for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Filiberto

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Filiberto esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior credito,  el cual pudo invertir en su negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía y  reabrir su negocio ya que por enfermedad no pudo atender su negocio, ya no tiene mercancía para la venta, desea invertir en comprar productos de lata, refrescos, dulces, fruta, productos de lácteos y todo lo de abarrotes. 
Don Miguel Filiberto planea pagar al crédito con la pensión que recibe, ya que sus hijos le ayudaran con los gastos familiares. 
Desea abrir nuevamente su negocio ya que sus vecinos le están solicitando y también tendrá un ingreso a su familia.
texts.en: Miguel Filiberto is grateful for your cooperation in his previous loan which he invested in his business.  He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to reopen his store which he was unable to attend to due to illness.   He doesn’t have any merchandise to sell and wants to buy canned goods, soft-drinks, candy, fruit, dairy products and all types of groceries.  Miguel Filiberto plans to repay the loan with his retirement pay since his children will help him cover the family expenses.  He wants to reopen his store since his neighbors are asking him to and he’ll also earn family income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to reopen his grocery store.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 55 ans. Elle est veuve avec 02 enfants en charge qui vont tous à l’école. 
Le premier à 22 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.  
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de céréales, tubercules et des charbons de bois depuis 2010. Elle vend dans une boutique.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, des tubercules et des charbons de bois. Elle veut réinvestir plus dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie da sa famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 55-year-old woman. She is a widow with two children to support. Both children go to school. The first-born is 22 years old, and the last is 15. Ablavi has been working as a retailer of grains, tubers, and charcoal since 2010. She makes her sales in a shop. At the moment, her main difficulty is a drop in sales. 

Ablavi has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy grain, tubers, and charcoal. She wants to reinvest more into her business. In the next few years, she would like to add complementary businesses. Ablavi says that, with the profits, she plans on improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grains, tubers, and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Maryuri Jackeline

texts.es:
Maryuri de 38 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”, es una mujer que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio.
Su negocio es un Salón de belleza, lo inicio aproximadamente hace 10 años.
Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda, pero hay cliente que prefiere que ella vaya a su domicilio para brindarle su servicio.
Su horario inicia a las 10:00am hasta las 22:00pm, de lunes a viernes.
Su dificultad es la ubicación de su negocio, ya que es un poco complicado al acceso de vivienda, por eso ella prefiere salir a brindar su servicio a domicilio.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos como: tinté, extensiones de cabellos, shampo, etc.
Su sueño es poder obtener otro local en donde se encuentre en buen acceso para llegar.
texts.en: Maryuri, 38, lives in a suburban zone called “Durán.”  She’s a woman who aspires toward her business’ growth.  She has a beauty salon that she started about 10 years ago.  It’s located at home although some of her customers prefer that she come to their homes to provide the service.  She works from 10am until 10pm, Monday through Friday.  Her difficulty is her salon’s location because getting to her house is a little complicated that’s why she prefers to provide her services in her customers’ homes.  She is asking for the loan to buy products like: hair color, hair extensions, shampoo, etc.  Her dream is to obtain another locale that’s more easily accessible.

loans.use: to buy hair color, hair extensions, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es: Manuela Del Socorro tiene 61 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Manuela es una señora muy responsable ella disfruta de realizar esta actividad. Ella tiene más de 33 años con este negocio, el arduo trabajo constante tiene 2 hijos menores de edad bajo su cargo. Trabaja para sus gastos personales y también ayuda con los gastos del hogar, con el objetivo de comprar granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jugos entre otros productos. Este es su sexto crédito que realiza para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Manuela Del Socorro, 61, has a grocery store.  Manuela is a very responsible woman who enjoys doing her work.  She’s had the store for over 33 years.  It is constant hard work.  She has two minors in her care.  She works for her personal expenses and also to help cover household expenses.  Her goal is to buy basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, bread, detergent and fruit juice, among other products.  This is the sixth loan that she’s used to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for he store.

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es:
A sus 66 años Antonio es un apasionado por las flores, hace 13 años cuando caminaba por el parque del municipio de Caucasia junto a su esposa compro una mata de flores la cual cultivo en el patio de su casa, al poco tiempo comenzó a vender las flores que fueron naciendo gracias a su cultivo y así es como comienza con su negocio, actualmente Antonio comercializa flores en municipios aledaños, labor a la que se dedica con gran esmero y amor, pues a parte de su pasión por las flores hoy en día es el sustento para su familia.

Con la ilusión de que el progreso sea constante Antonio debe comprar mas flores para cultivar como: palmas, rudas, romeros, pinos, rosas y otros que sus clientes solicitan, pero Antonio no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar dichas compras, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar estas plantas, cultivarlas, comercializarlas y generar mas ingresos para el hogar. Sueña con llegar a tener un vivero propio que se posicione en el mercado y poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 66, Antonio is passionate about flowers.  Thirteen years ago while walking in the town of Caucasia’s park with his wife he bought a flower plant that he grew in his yard at home.  In a short time he started selling the flowers that started to grow thanks to his care and this is how his business started.  Currently, Antonio sells flowers in adjacent towns, work which he devotes himself to with love and dedication because besides his passion for the flowers today it’s his means to support his family.

Hoping that progress will be constant, Antonio must buy more flowers to grow like: palms, rue, rosemary, pine, roses and others that his customers request.  But, Antonio does not have the necessary capital to make these purchases so is asking for a loan to buy the plants, cultivate them and sell them to generate more household income.  He dreams with having his own nursery that will position him in the market place to little by little improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy plants to grow and sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for five years.  She started with 600,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings. Her hardship is theft at the boarder of the Republic of Congo. Her vision is a wholesale business plus educating her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Glenis Esther

texts.es: Glenis Compró productos para surtir su negocio de miscelánea e hizo adecuaciones a su local. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará toda la gama de artículos navideños pues desde ya se prepara para responder a sus clientes en esta época, así es que comprará multiusos, adornos navideños etc. “Gracias al apoyo recibido pude mejorar mi vivienda y en el negocio se aumentaron los clientes, debido a la variedad de surtidos que ofrecí”
texts.en: Glenis bought merchandise to stock her variety store and make improvements to it.  Currently, she’s applying for her second Kiva loan to buy the entire range of Christmas-themed items because she’s getting ready to respond to customer demand for that season.  She will buy multi-use outfits, Christmas decorations, etc.  “Thanks to the support I received I was able to do some home improvements and the number of customers in my store increased thanks to the variety of stock I offered.”

loans.use: to buy a whole range of Christmas-themed merchandise.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a forty-five-year-old hardworking woman with four children and rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the clothing business for nine years. She started with 400,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the different tastes of her customers. Her vision is a wholesale business plus educating her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La señora Elsa de 35 años tiene un hijo es madre soltera y vive en un casa de interés social con su hermana desde hace 3 años,  para Elsa lo más importante en su vida es su hijo y de ello el prepararlo con una carrera le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida, ella trabaja como empleada comisionista independiente en una  Joyeria de la localidad en la cual se dedica a la venta de joyas como los son aretes, esclavas, cadenas, anillos, prendedores y mas, tiene que andar ofreciendo de casa en casa estos productos para asi poder obtener una comisión la cual le permite cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y de su hijo; La señora Elsa es una mujer emprendedora quiere tener su propio negocio el cual seria una papelería donde ella venderia, lápices, plumas, cuadernos, borradores, colores, sacapuntas, regalos y una gran variedad de productos que le permitan a ella tener su propio negocio y al mismo tiempo educar a su hijo con valores que le sirvan para toda la vida.
texts.en:
Elsa, 35, has a son; she’s a single mother living in a government subsidized house with her sister for the last three years.  For Elsa, her son is the most important thing in life and to provide him with a career that will lead to improved quality of life for him is her main goal.  She works as an independent, on commission saleswoman for a local jewelry store.  She sells earrings, bracelets, chains, rings, brooches and more.  She has to go door-to-door to sell these items in order to earn a commission that will allow her to cover her and her son’s basic needs.

Elsa is a very enterprising woman who wants to have her own business which would be a stationery shop where she’d sell pencils, pens, notebooks, erasers, colored pencils, pencil sharpeners, gifts and a wide variety of products that would make it possible for her to have her own business while educating her son with values that will serve him his entire life.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to start a stationery store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja hace 12 años, en todo este tiempo ambos vieron nacer 4 hijos. Ahora el mayor tiene 11 años y el menor, 9 meses. Ella y su familia viven en casa de su madre. Verónica se dedica  a la compra y venta de ganados pero en poca cantidad. Ella tiene, 7 vacas, 3 chanchos, pero antes contaba con varias ovejas a las que vendía y sacaba buenas ganancias. Por problemas de mala administración y sobre-gastos, no pudieron comprar más de estos animales para continuar con el negocio. Así empezaron a sembrar papa, en las pequeñas parcelas que posee, de esa manera pudo pagar sus deudas. Considera que su negocio es rentable, “por cabeza ganaba  de 15 a 20 soles”, comenta. En el futuro, ella espera volver al ritmo anterior, y seguir con la venta de los carneros, administrar bien sus negocios y mandar a sus pequeños hijos a estudiar a la ciudad de Tarma y más adelante facilitarles una educación superior y profesional. Es la octava vez que ella trabaja con MFP. Está entusiasmada con las visiones que tiene, y que espera alcanzar gracias a su trabajo coordinado. Verónica comprará con su préstamo por lo menos 7 carneros pequeños, estima que cada uno de ellos costará 170 soles, los que al criarlos y engordarlos venderá a 190 ó 200 soles.
texts.en:
Verónica, 30, has lived with her spouse for 12 years.  In that time they’ve witnessed the birth of their four children.  Today, the oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 9 months old.  She and her family live in her mother’s house.

Verónica is a small quantity livestock merchant.  She has 7 cows and 3 pigs.  She used to have several sheep that she’d sell and make good profits.  Because of poor administration and cost overruns she was unable to buy more of these animals to continue in business.  They started to grow potatoes on the small plots of land she has and was able to repay her debts that way.

She considers her business to be profitable.  “For each head I’d earn 15 to 20 soles,” she comments.  In the future she hopes to recover her previous rhythm and continue to sell sheep, to run her business well and to send her children to school in the city of Tarma and later on provide them with higher and professional education.

This is the 8th time she’s worked with MFP.  She’s excited with the vision she has and that she hopes to reach thanks to coordinated work.  Verónica will use her loan to buy at least 7 small lambs.  She estimates that each one will cost 170 soles which once grown and fattened up she will sell for 190 to 200 soles.

loans.use: to buy seven small calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on food supplement and natural products.

loans.name: Twanzane Traders Group

texts.en: Richard is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with five children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in  mining salt for ten years. He started with one panel and now has three panels. His hardship is rain which disrupts salt formation. His vision is to have at least ten panels plus educating his children. Richard needs the loan to buy salt panels for salt mining.

loans.use: to buy salt panels for salt mining.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante 3, 4, & 5 (Forward with God). She is mother of four children and they live together in a modest home with her husband. She says that her most important challenge is to work hard to get what she wants and to give her children what they need. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy resting after her work day.

Susana is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around seven years, starting with some capital she and her husband saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to increase her inventory by buying clothes, shoes, women's accessories and cosmetics, etc. 

Susana wishes to have a successful business. Since she started taking loans in this program she  learned how to save and re-invest the profits in her business. Now she is getting new products and good prices, because closer to December everything is more expensive. She dreams of having her own house.

This group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. They all live in a "Batey" outside the city, surrounded by sugarcane fields. They are Haitian citizens working in the Dominican Republic.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité denominado Mujeres luchadoras es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está integrado por 18 mujeres, las cuales se encuentran actualmente en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de buscar un mejor porvenir para sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Silvina, ella tiene una despensa, la cual explota desde hace ya un buen tiempo, este es el medio principal por el cual ella sustenta a su familia y cubre los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Comenta que tiene buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, por lo que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita su crédito, para la compra de bebidas como ser vinos, whiskys, cervezas, comestibles como ser cárnicos, embutidos pollos, hortalizas, lácteos y otros, para el abastecimiento de su negocio, con lo que podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee, called Mujeres Luchadoras, is from the city of Caaguazú.  It is made up of 18 women who are currently in their sixth loan cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's entrepreneurial women's program.  They got together with the goal of seeking a better future for their families.

One of the members is Silvina.  She has a small grocery store that she has been running for a while now.  It is the main means by which she supports her family and covers her daily household expenses.  She says she has good customers who generate a very good income for her.  For that reason, she wants to keep investing in her business, which is why she is asking for this loan to buy drinks, food products, and other things to stock her store.  This will allow her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase herbs, chickens, cold cuts, meat, dairy products, and drinks

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: El sr. Mario de 34 años es casado tiene 3 hijos y trabaja como oficial de policía de la localidad desde hace 10 años, su trabajo consiste en velar por el bienestar de la comunidad y la función que desempeña con mayor frecuencia es verificar que los vehículos no comentan infracciones como pasarse un semaforon en rojo, que no vayan a exceso de velocidad, que no se pasen un alto esto con la finalidad de prevenir un accidente, el vive desde hace 10 años en un terrero que el compro.  El enganche lo dio con ahorros propios y posteriormente fue pagándolo en comodas mensualidades su terreno ya hasta totalmente liquidarlo,  poco a poco le ha hido haciendo mejoras a su vivenda algunas han sido con ahorros propios otras con ayuda de créditos.  El Sr. Mario hoy tiene la necesidad de colocar el vitropiso a un cuarto que construyo en su vivienda para el lo mas importante es tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia el sabe que su empleo es de alto riesgo y por eso cuando el adquirio el terreno lo hizo pensando en que algún día el podría construirle a su esposa e hijos la casa de sus sueños. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el vitropiso, pegamento y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario, age 34, is married and has three children. He has worked as a police officer in the area for ten years. He watches out for the community's well-being, and his most frequent role is to help prevent accidents by ensuring that drivers do not commit infractions such as speeding or running red lights or stop signs. 
For ten years, he has lived on a plot of land that he purchased. He made the down payment with his own savings and then paid easy monthly installments. He now has it completely paid off. He has made improvements to his home bit by bit, some with his own savings and some with the help of loans. Mr. Mario now needs to install floor tiles in a room which he built in his home. For Mario, the most important thing is to have a secure heritage for his family. He knows that he has a high-risk job. It was with this knowledge that he acquired the land, with the goal of being able to later build a dream home for his wife and children. In order to complete his project, he needs to buy the floor tiles and adhesive, and to pay for the labour.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es: Su anterior credikiva Claudia lo invirtió en accesorios con los que surtió la vitrina que tambien con su crédito compró. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará calzado de cuero y al pormayor que traerá de la ciudad de Bucaramanga. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Gracias por los recursos obtenidos, con ellos he podido incrementar mi negocio y las ganancias que he ganado con todo esto".
texts.en: Claudia invested her previous Kiva loan in accessories to put in her display case, which she also purchased with the loan. She is now applying for a new Kiva loan. She will use it to buy leather footwear wholesale in Bucaramanga city. She says "thank you for these loans. With this, I have been able to expand my business and increase my earnings".

loans.use: to purchase wholesale footwear

loans.name: Wilson Manuel

texts.es:
A sus 54 años de edad Wilson es un luchador que trabaja diariamente vendiendo legumbres por las calles del municipio de Caucasia en el departamento de Antioquia. Es padre de 5 hijos y su mayor sueño ha sido brindarles un mejor futuro.

Actualmente Wilson quiere comprar legumbres, frutas y verduras al por mayor para surtir el negocio y generar mas ingresos, pero no cuenta con el capital de inversión necesario para hacer dichas compras, por lo que solicita un préstamo como capital de trabajo, así mejorarán las ventas gracias a la variedad y las utilidades serán mejores gracias a la cantidad. Posteriormente Wilson pretende generar un empleo, buscando una ayuda para que su negocio progrese y brindarle apoyo otra persona que se encuentren en una difícil situación económica.
texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working 54-year-old man who works every day selling vegetables on the streets of the Caucasia municipality, Antioquia department. He has five children and his greatest dream is to offer them a better future.

Now, Wilson wants to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale in order to stock his business and generate more income. However, he does not have the necessary capital to make this purchase. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for working capital. This way he will improve his sales, thanks to the greater variety and quantities he will offer. Wilson plans to create a position in his business by hiring someone to help him. This will help his business to grow and help another person out of a difficult economic situation.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale in order to stock his business.

loans.name: Zephanous

texts.en: Zephanous intends to use this loan to buy second-hand clothes. He has always gotten money for the same purpose and is happy with the progress of his business as his stock and turnover have greatly increased. His challenge is price fluctuation and his dream is to buy and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy shoes, skirts, suits, blankets and jeans.

loans.name: Polina

texts.en: Polina is a 23-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a drugstore and bar business for five years. She started with 1,000,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as working capital. Her vision is to have a pharmacy and educate her children. Polina needs the loan to buy drugs and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs and beer to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 57 años, está casado con Dominga, hace 35 años aproximadamente, ambos tienen 6 hijos mayores. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el Distrito de San Antonio. Él desde niño se dedica a la agricultura, es así que en sus parcelas de terreno siembra 3 variedades de papa, así como habas, cebadas y arvejas. Él y su esposa trabajan la tierra, siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos, así mantuvieron y educaron a sus hijos que ahora ya tienen familia. Pedro cuenta que para sembrar las semillas de papa, tiene que contratar 3 peones como mínimo a los que paga 25 soles al día, mientras que su esposa prepara los alimentos y los sirve. “Esa es la rutina en los días de trabajo”, comenta. La venta de los productos que cosecha no es tan rentable como quisiera, por lo que necesita sembrar en más parcelas, y más aún con las dificultades que ha pasado en todo sus años de agricultor, uno de ellos son los gusanos que se comen sus productos, así también el exceso de lluvias y la escasez hacen de que la papa no crezcan. Le gusta el trabajo del campo, pero la edad y las fuerzas no son las mismas. Desea, más adelante criar vacas, ovejas y cuyes, así asegurará su vejez, junto a su inseparable esposa. Además de arreglar un poco su humilde casita. Su banco comunal se llama “Santa Rosa”, se siente cómodo tratando con vecinos y amigos que lo conforman, por intereses comunes. Es la octava vez que Pedro trabaja con MFP. Con una sonrisa menciona que con el dinero, podrá comprar semillas de papa, sacos de abono y guano de ave de corral para enriquecer sus tierras.”Seguiré sembrando hasta que las fuerzas se me acaben”, añade entre risas.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 57, has been married to Dominga for about 35 years. They have 6 grown children. They live together in their own home in the San Antonio District. Pedro has worked in agriculture since he was a child. On his land, he sows three varieties of potato, as well as broad beans, barley, and peas. He and his wife work the land; it is their main source of income. This is how they raised and educated their children, who now have children of their own.
Pedro tells us that he has to hire at least three labourers to sow his potato seeds. He pays them 25 soles per day, and his wife prepares meals and serves them. "This is the routine, on work days", he says. The sale of his products is not as profitable as he would like, so he needs to sow more plots of land. Of all the difficulties he has experienced in his years as a farmer, a main one has been the worms that eat his produce. Excess rains and droughts also prevent his potatoes from growing. He likes working in the fields, but strength decreases with age. In the future, he wants to raise cows, sheep, and guinea pigs in order to secure his and his beloved wife's finances in their old age. He also wants to fix up their small home a little. His communal bank is called "Santa Rosa". He feels comfortable working with his friends and neighbours who make up the group; they have common interests. This is the eighth time that Pedro has worked with MFP. With a smile, he tells us that he will be able to use this loan to buy potato seeds, bags of fertilizer, and barnyard bird guano to enrich his lands. "I will keep farming until I run out of strength", he adds with a chuckle.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, bags of fertilizer and barnyard bird guano [fertilizer].

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy produce for her market stall.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, a humorous and charismatic entrepreneur, saw an opportunity to serve his community with a laundry business nine years ago. He now owns a busy and successful Laundromat in New York City. In this tough economy, he has created jobs for six people and this loan will help him offer one more position. This business is supporting Richard’s family, including his three children. Over the years, he has been able to expand the business with additional washers and dryers, but is running out of space for additional equipment.

With this loan from Accion USA, Richard will expand his Laundromat into his current office in the building to add 11 washers and 5 dryers. The loan will pay for the construction and labor as well as installation of the new equipment.

loans.use: To pay for construction and labor for expansion of his laundromat.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida, tiene un hijo de 11 meses con su pareja, ella se dedica a las labores del hogar, su negocio es un taller de ebanistería donde hace muebles finos de madera, como:  Roperos, mesas, divisiones, closet, puertas, muebles de cocina, etc.
Desde hace 7 años estableció este  negocio al que le dedica tiempo completo. 
Este negocio a crecido con la ayuda de ODEF, quien le ha financiado  2 prestamos anteriormente, uno de L.50,000.00 y L.20,000.00, los que a pagado muy bien, ya que sus  ventas han incrementado  e igual que sus ingresos  lo que le ha permitido  mejorar  su  nivel de vida de su familia.
Su tercer prestamos actualmente es de L.20,000.00, lo solicitó para compra de materia prima (madera), con el fin de expandir su negocio en la comunidad y obtener mayor venta.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, age 37, lives in the village of San Juan Pueblo in Atlántida.  He has an 11 month old son with his life partner.  She devotes herself to the household chores.

His business is a cabinet making shop.  He makes fine wooden furniture like wardrobes, tables, dividers, closets, doors, and kitchen furniture, etc.  He established his business seven years ago, and he works there full time.

This business has grown with the help of ODEF.  They have given him two previous loans.  One was for 50,000 lempira and the other was for 20,000 lempira, which he has paid back very well. His increase in sales as well as income have allowed him to improve his family’s standard of living.

His third loan is currently for 20,000 lempiras.  He requested it to buy raw material (wood) in order expand his business in the community and to get greater sales.

loans.use: to buy raw material (wood).

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 23-year-old married man with one child and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second hand clothes for six years. He started with UGX 3,000,000 and now has UGX 6,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is a lack of enough capital to meet the different tastes of his customers and his vision is a wholesale shop plus educating children. Richard intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 40 años, se casó hace 10 años con Alberto. Ambos tienen 6 hijos pero viven con 5 de ellos. Esta familia habita en una casa propia, donde viven regidos por leyes internas de trabajo y buen comportamiento. La agricultura ha sido y será la actividad que los sustenta, lo que aprendió de sus padres y ahora enseña a sus hijos, quienes a sus cortas edades cooperan en labores del campo.  Además tiene 4 vacas, las que cría para luego venderlas o sacrificarlas y ofrecer la carne. Su última cosecha le dio 30 sacos de papas, las que vendió satisfactoriamente. “Si hay suerte se obtiene buen dinero, pero hay ocasiones en que los gusanos y las heladas malogran los cultivos”, menciona como principales problemas.  Agrega que, por falta de capital muchas veces sembró en poco, pues la inversión abarca semillas, abonos y mano de obra de terceros. Alejandrina se ve en el futuro sembrando en más parcelas y comprando más animales. Piensa que, si no dejará a sus hijos cantidades de dinero a sus hijos como herencia, por lo menos les designará animales y terrenos para su cultivo. Es la octava vez que trabaja con su banco comunal y MFP, cree que poco a poco logrará sus objetivos si siguen con la misma actitud.
Alejandrina destinará el préstamo en la compra de sacos de abono para  varias parcelas de terreno agrícola que posee, tanto para sus sembríos de papa y arveja.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 40. She has been married to Alberto for 10 years. Together they have 6 children, 5 of whom live with them. This family lives in their own home and are committed to hard work and caring for one another. Agriculture has provided, and always will provide, their sustenance. Alejandrina learned this work from her parents and is now teaching her children. Even at their young ages, they help work in the fields. They have four cows, which they raise for sale or for butchering. She harvested thirty bags of potatoes in the last harvest, and was able to sell them at a satisfactory price. "With luck we make good money, but there are times when the worms or the frost ruin the crop", Alejandrina says, identifying their main problems. She adds that they are often only able to sow a little due to lack of funds. So, with this investment she will stock up on seeds and fertilizers, and pay for labour. Alejandrina plans to sow more plots of land and buy more animals in the future. She hopes that, even if she can't leave her children money, she will at least be able to leave her children animals and land to cultivate. This is the eighth time that she has worked with her communal bank and MFP. She thinks that she will achieve her goals bit by bit if she keeps her attitude.

Alejandrina will use this loan to purchase bags of fertilizer for some of her plots of land, for both potato and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en: Yokonia is a 42-year-old married man with six children and owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He has been selling shoes for three years. He started with UGX 100,000 and now has UGX 2,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet demand and his vision is business expansion, a happy family, plus educating his children. Yokania needs the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 31-year-old married man with three children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in buying and selling coffee for five years. He started with UGX 500,000 and now has UGX 8,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is unpredictable coffee price changes and his vision is to have a capital of UGX 50,000,000, and to educate his children. Julius needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Oñondivepá”, se conformó en el año 2010, mediante la promoción hecha a la Sra. Delis, actualmente se encuentran en su tercer ciclo. Las señoras se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Una de las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, comenta que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, es allí cuando se levanta a prepara sus comidas. Dice que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre acuden a ella, pues tiene riza sazón.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes esenciales para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende, como ser carnes, condimentos y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepá women's communal bank was formed in 2010 thanks to Delis' promotion.  They are currently in their third loan cycle.  The women are very comfortable working as a team and do so with great effort and care as a supportive and close-knit unit in the Comité de Mujeres program.

One of the members is María, who sells all kinds of food for a living.  She tells us the that she starts work very early in the morning, which is when she gets up to prepare her dishes.  She says she has many customers who always come to her because her food has great flavor.  

She is asking for this loan to buy essential ingredients to make the foods she sells, such as meats, condiments, and other things.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, and other things

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 54-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electronics for twelve years. He started with UGX 200,000 and now has UGX 3,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is to have an electrical and mechanical workshop, buying land and educating his children. Samuel needs the loan to buy electrical materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria de 62 años es divorciada y tiene una hija que depende económicamente de ella  y que actualmente cursa la educación básica.  Ana cuenta con un  pequeño negocio que en el cual los productos que vende son:  Botanas,  productos enlatados, refrescos, dulces, pan, detergentes y mas, este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos para Ana y su hija tanto para cubrir sus necesidades básicas de alimentación, vestido, techo, educación como para tener una mejor calidad de vida. La hija de la Sra. Ana ya requiere su propio espacio en su hogar ya que el negocio se encuentra dentro de la casa ella quiere que su mamá le construya un cuarto para ella sola pensando en el cual pueda tener su privacidad y Ana quiere hacerle realidad su sueño y es por ello que solicita este préstamo para iniciar la construcción del cuarto de su hija, para ello necesita comprar cemento, arena, varillas y pagar al albañil.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 62 years old and divorced.  She has a daughter that is financially dependent on her and is currently finishing her education.  Ana has a small business where she sells snacks, canned goods, soft drinks, sweets, bread, detergent, etc.  This business is her only source of income for her and her daughter.  It covers their basic necessities such as food, clothing, a roof over their heads, and education so they can have a better quality of life.  

Señora Ana's daughter needs her own space since the business is located in their house.  She wants her mother to build a room for her so she can have privacy.  Ana wants to make her dream a reality and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to start the construction of her daughter's bedroom.  For this she needs to buy cement, sand, and rods, and to pay a mason.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es: La señora Barbara de  37 años es madre soltera de 3 hijos, la casa en la que ellos viven es del papa de sus hijos que le ayuda económicamente con los gastos de alimentación y educación de los niños pero aun asi Barbara tiene que trabajar porque  con lo que su ex-esposo le da no es suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades básicas de alimentación, educación, calzado y vestido, ella trabaja 10 horas díarias en una maquiladora de la localidad en el área de costura y asi poder solventar los gastos de su hogar. La casa en la que Barbara y sus hijos viven no es lo suficientemente amplia, para los cuatro por eso ella con ahorros propios construyo un cuarto para asi poder tener un poco mas de espacio pero ha este cuarto le hacen falta acabados exteriores e interiores como los son enjarre y pintura y nos solicita un préstamo para poder hacerle estas mejoras a su vivienda y necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar mano e obra.
texts.en: Señora Barbara is 37 years old and a single mother of 3 children.  They live in her children's father's house as he helps her financially with the children's food and education expenses.  Barbara still has to work however, because her ex-husband doesn't give her enough to cover the basic food, education, shoe, and clothing expenses.  She works 10 hours a day in a maquiladora [assembly plant near the border] that makes clothing so she can cover the household expenses.  The house that Barbara and her children live in is not big enough for the four of them so she saved her money and had a bedroom added to the house.  This gives them a little more space, but the interior and exterior are not yet finished.  It still needs plaster and paint and she is requesting a loan to finish these improvements to her home.  She needs to buy cement and sand and to pay for labor.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows to rear.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1, 2 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante 1, 2 & 6 (Forward with God). This group is made up of fifteen micro-entrepreneur women and it is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugar cane, in a batey founded for sugar cane workers, especially for Haitians.

Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and her three children. She says that her most important challenges are to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family. By having the loans and investing them, she is expanding her business and getting more clients. She enjoys working and cooking for her family.

She is running a miscellaneous sales business where she sells cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her business’ inventory. She is excited to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost 3 years and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she has been able to save and reinvest in her business when she needs to buy bigger orders. Xiomara thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy footwear and clothing for sale.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 55 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Hioma, Uganda. He has been a farmer for 16 years. He started as a samba boy and after saving enough money, he started his own farm. William faces a challenge of weather changes, which affect his production. His dream is to venture into modern farming practices. William needs a loan to pay for labor to clear his garden.

loans.use: to pay for labour to clear his garden.

loans.name: Muzafari

texts.en: Muzafari is married with 6 children living in his house in Hoima in Western Uganda. For seven years he has been fishing and this has enabled him to provide for the basic needs of his family. His challenge is poor transport means that cause fish to go bad and his dream is to buy a refrigerated car. Muzafari wants a loan to buy a car to help him in transporting his fish from the lake to the markets.

loans.use: to buy a car for transport of his fish from the lake to the markets

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 34-year-old married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for three years. He started with 300,000 UGX and now has 2,000,000 UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuation. His vision is a big general merchandise shop, as well as educating his children. Moses needs the loan to buy iron sheets and coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and coffee for resale

loans.name: Gleiny Luz

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Gliny compró ropa, cosméticos, perfumes, calzado, fantasia y productos naturales, con los que le fue muy bien y ganó dinero. En la actualidad planea su segundo credikiva para comprar mercancia variada en mayor volumen, pues se prepara para la alta temporada de Diciembre y planea complacer a sus clintes y vender mucho para aumentar sus utilidades. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Es un gran apoyo financiero, estoy muy agradecida y espero seguir contando con Kiva y con la Fundación, para continuar incrmentando mis ventas y utilidades. "
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Gleiny bought clothes, cosmetics, perfume, footwear, novelty items, and natural products, which went well for her and she earned money.  Currently, with her second Kiva loan, she is planning to buy large quantities of a variety of merchandise, since she is preparing for the high December season and she plans to please her customers and sell a lot to increase her profits.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "It's a great financial help.  I'm very grateful and I hope to continue counting on Kiva and the Fundación to continue increasing my sales and profits."

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: The Third Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old widow.  She has five children, four of whom have left home.  She is now left with one dependent, aged 15, who is going to school and Jane is the one who has the sole responsibility for the school fees and the upkeep of the child.

Jane is a cross-border retailer who specializes in buying blankets, shoes, and clothing, and she wants to boost her business. She wants to use some of the funds to pay for high import duty fees which were recently imposed.  The loan will enable her to improve their standard of living and to have more disposable income.  In the future, she is intending to have her own shop and take on some staff.

loans.use: to buy blankets, shoes, and clothing

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
Luciernagas es un grupo solidario que esta conformado por 7 mujeres muy trabajadoras e inteligentes las cuales se peocupan por el bienestar de sus familias. Ellas le pusieron así al grupo porque les gusto ese nombre; se encuentran en su primer ciclo y sus reuniones son en Garcia, N.L. Una de las integrantes del equipo es la señora Yolanda tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada, tiene hijos pero todos son mayores de edad y ya estan casados, ella solo cuida a un nieto de 4 años; habita en el municipio de Garcia, N.L.

Yolanda se dedica a la venta de tacos de guisos entre semana en obras (a los albañiles y trabajadores a quienes le fía y los fines de semana les cobra lo que consumieron) y los fines de semana vende barbacoa y menudo en General Escobedo, N.L., su esposo le ayuda a hacer la comida y es quien la translada en una camioneta. Ella escogio este negocio ya que además de que le gusta cocinar, le agrada que la gente disfrute de una buena comida en sus ratos libres, además de querer buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo e hijos con los gastos del hogar y para lo que se necesite. Con el dinero del credito que resivio surtirá mas alimentos y comprará un juego de vaporeras mas grande, ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Uno de los sueños mas grandes de Yolanda en tener un puesto fijo con estructura mas grande, varia sillas y mesas para que la gente que le compra también tenga la opción de comer ahí, así como los trabajadores y albañiles de la obra.
texts.en:
"Luciernagas" (Fireflies) is a solidarity group made up of seven very hard-working and intelligent women, who are concerned about the well-being of their families. They called the group this, because they liked the name. They are in their first loan cycle, and their meetings are in the municipality of Garcia, in the state of Nuevo Leon. 

One of the members of the team is Yolanda. She is 47, married, and has children; but all are adults and already married.  She is only looking after a four year-old grandson. She lives in the municipality of Garcia, in the state of Nuevo Leon. 

On weekdays, Yolanda sells tacos de guisos (tortillas filled with prepared meats, vegetables and sauces) at construction sites.  She sells to the construction workers to whom she extends credit, and then collects from at the end of the week for what they have eaten. On weekends she sells barbecue and menudo (tripe) in General Escobedo, Nuevo Leon.  Her husband helps her make the food, and transports it in a truck.

She chose this business, since besides the fact that she likes to cook, it pleases her that people enjoy a good meal in their free time. In addition, she wanted to find a way of helping her husband and children with the household expenses and other needs.  She will use the loan to stock up on food and to buy a set of larger steamers, as she has a lot of customers. 

One of Yolanda's greatest dreams is to have a fixed stand, with a larger  structure, and a few tables and chairs, so that her patrons also have the option of eating right there, including the workers from the construction site.

loans.use: To buy more food, and a set of larger steamers for her food stand.

loans.name: Maltar Group

texts.en:
Bevi is a 31 years old married mother of three aged 14,12 and 8. She is lives in Gweru with her children and four other relatives. She has been in the Upholstery, Tailoring and a Saloon business for the past two years in the same area.

She is applying for a loan of $400.00 to buy materials for her projects. Bevi also wants to build a bigger workshop with this money such that her activies are done at a large scale to widen her revenue base.
