She also believes that her standard of living can improve if she is granted this loan through an increase of income.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and extend her workshop

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz  de 50 años, vive en el centro de la ciudad  y se dedica a vender dulces y mecatos. Ella tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 18 a 30 años y desde hace 19 años se dedicó a la actividad comercial,  vendiendo mercancía variada y una vez se separó de su cónyuge, se dedicó plenamente a vender dulces en su pequeña chasa y también gaseosas.  Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar la educación de sus hijos especialmente la de los dos menores, ya que los dos mayores se dedicaron a trabajar en las tiendas y graneros,  para contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Beatriz se ubica diariamente en un parque cementerio y allí trascurre todo su días vendiéndole a una concurrente clientela. En la actualidad quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo y para ello está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará en mayor volumen dulcería y refrescos y adicionará jugos naturales  de frutas tropicales, los que tienen buena demanda en el inclemente calor del Caribe Colombiano.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 50, lives downtown and sells candy and snacks.  She has five children whose ages range from 18 to 30.  She started working in commerce 19 years ago selling assorted merchandise and when she separated from her spouse decided to go into candy and soft-drink sales full-time at home.  She’s managed to educate her children thanks to the business, especially her two youngest ones, since the two oldest decided to go work in stores and granaries to contribute to household expenses.

Beatriz sets herself up daily at a cemetery and spends the day there selling to the large clientele.  She currently would like to increase working capital and that’s why she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy larger amounts of candy and soft-drinks and also to add natural tropical fruit juices which are in high demand in the inclement heat of the Colombian Caribbean.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of candy and soft-drinks and to add natural juices.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
A sus 22 años de edad Vanesa es una joven muy trabajadora que después de capacitarse como mercaderista comenzó a trabajar como vendedora de una distribuidora de dulces nacionales y americanos, su labor es vender mercancía por catalogo y comisionar con buenas ventas. Es emprendedora y su meta es llegara a tener un punto de venta propio donde pueda generar un empleo y aumentar los ingresos para ayudarle a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

Actualmente, con la ilusión de ir progresando día a día quiere comprar un surtido grande que le deje más utilidades, y adicional a esto una impresora  que le facilite la entrega de informes a la empresa, y le permita tener más orden en sus finanzas con la contabilidad y las facturas. Sin embargo Vanesa no cuenta con este capital para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cumplir sus sueños de progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a 22 year hardworking young woman. After training as a sales representative she began to work selling sweets from a national and American distributor. Her work is selling merchandise from a catalog and she earns a good commission for her sales. Her entrepreneurial goal is to have her own location where she can hire an employee and increase her earnings in order to help her family with the household expenses.

Right now her dream is to progress day by day and she wants to buy in quantity in order to earn more profit, and in addition to that, to buy a printer that she can use to prepare reports for the distributor as well as allow her to be more organized with her bookkeeping and invoices. However Vanesa does not have the capital to invest in her business, and that is why she is asking for a loan to help her fulfill her dreams of progress and to better her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a printer for her business

loans.name: Dhau-Dhau Group

texts.en:
James is a 58 year old man who leaves with his 5 children aged 36, 31, 30, 27 and 15 years old with one child still in school. He is living in Gweru where he is running his General Dealer business.

He is applying for a loan of 400.00 to beef-up his stock levels to meet the local demand. James also want to use the money to expand his business into butchery if the loan is granted. He is also expecting to have a bigger supermarket in Zvishavane Mabasa Area.

loans.use: to stock his retail business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades D. 10 a 22 años en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL.. El para generar ingresos y sostener su hogar tiene su propio negocio D. reciclaje,  actividad que conoce desD. sus 8 años D. edad, cuando ayudaba a su padre quien murió y Luis abandonó sus estudios para dedicarse totalmente a este oficio. El  negocio D. Luis  funciona en un local propio ubicado en uno D. los mercados populares  D. L. ciudad. Gradualmente   ha ido creciendo, pues primero reciclaba plásticos, cartón y vidrios; en L. actualidad solo recicL. empaques plásticos y comercializa productos industriales como papel aluminio que utiliza para empacar al vacío y también rollos D. pitas, aunque planea invertir en envases pláticas industriales. Luis actualmente aplica a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará pita en rollos,  bolsas plásticas y papel aluminio, su experiencia garantiza su éxito, porque sabe lo que necesita su mercado D. clientes y justamente es en eso que va a invertir.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his spouse and three children whose ages range from 10 to 22 years in the city of BarranquilL..  To generate income and support his home he has his own recycling business, an activity he’s known since he was 8 years old when he’d help his father.  When his father died, Luis dropped out of school to go into this business full-time. 

Luis’ business functions in a locale he owns located in one of the city’s popular markets.  Gradually it’s been growing because at the beginning he only recycled plastics, cardboard and glass; currently he only recycles plastic containers and he sells industrial products like aluminum foil used for vacuum packaging and also rolls of twine, although he plans to invest in industrial plastic containers.

Luis is applying for his first Kiva loan which is also his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy rolls of twine, plastic bags and aluminum foil.  His experience guarantees success because he knows what his market needs and that’s precisely what he’ll invest in.

loans.use: to buy rolls of twine, plastic bags and aluminum foil.

loans.name: Light Group

texts.en:
Patricia is 51 years old and lives in Zvishavane. She is a widow and has 7 children aged between 17 and 34. Two of her children are attending school.

Patricia owns a general dealer store in Zvishavane and has 2 employees. She buys her stock twice every month and her challenges are shortages from her employees which reduce her profitability.

She is applying for US$400 to replenish her stocks. With more income, Patricia will be in a position to send her children to universities.

In the future, she plans to have a butchery and bottlestore in Zvishavane.

loans.use: To buy groceries and clothes for sale

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesús

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años Albeiro decidió independizarse y comenzó a trabajar como obrero, actualmente son muchos los que reconocen su trabajo y prefieren sus servicios por la calidad y efectividad de su trabajo.

Albeiro es padre de 2 hijos y su mayor sueño es brindarles un mejor futuro por lo que día a día trabaja con la ilusión de generar mas ingresos y lograr una estabilidad económica. Su propósito es comprar un taladro de energía que le facilite y agilice su trabajo, pero él no cuenta con el capital para comprar tan necesaria herramienta de trabajo, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar el taladro y ofrecerle a sus clientes un servicio mas efectivo y de muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
Albeiro decided to become independent and start working as a laborer 15 years ago.  Currently, many people recognize his work and prefer his services because of the quality and efficiency of his work.

Albeiro is the father of two children and his greatest wish is to provide them with a better future which is why he works hard every day in hopes of generating higher income to reach economic stability.  His goal is to buy a power drill that will quicken and make his work easier but he does not have the capital needed to buy such a necessary work tool so is asking for a loan with which to buy the drill to provide a more efficient, higher quality work to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a power drill.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MERCEDES” iniciará su primer quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mary. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos de chompas, venta de filtros, venta de frutas y verduras, encuadernación, venta de corderos, costura de mantas, hilado de lana, venta de ganado.

La señora Mary,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de artesanias que aprendio hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de máquina y telas), que comprara la 16 de Julio y posteriormente lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la puntualidad.
texts.en:
The “Mercedes” communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Mary.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: sweater knitting, filter sales, fruit and vegetable sales, book binding, lamb sales, blanket weaving, wool spinning and cattle sales.

Mary indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for two cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from an advisor.  She currently has a crafts making business that she learned years ago.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (to buy a machine and fabric).  She will buy them at 16 de Julio and then sell to order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can since she lives with a spouse and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Hamilton Nicolás

texts.es:
A sus 23 años de edad Hamilton es un joven emprendedor, que trabaja medio tiempo en un taller automotriz y como trabajo alterno se dedica a la cría y engorde de pollos para generar ingresos y ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Actualmente Hamilton quiere hacer algunas mejoras locativas en su casa para el bienestar de los pollos y adicional a esto comprar algunas aves de postura para la venta, pero no cuenta con el capital para realizar dichas compras, por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual ir progresando poco a poco, generando mas ingresos para en un futuro poder cumplir su sueño de tener su propio taller de mecánica y proporcionalmente mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 23 Hamilton is a young entrepreneur who works half time at an auto shop and as an additional job raises chickens to generate income and help with household expenses.

Hamilton wants to make some structural improvements to his house for his chickens’ wellbeing and also to buy additional laying hens to sell but he does not have the capital to make these expenditures so is asking for a loan to gradually make progress generating more income so that in the future he will be able to reach his dream of having his own car repair shop and therefore improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and to make structural improvements.

loans.name: El Futuro 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Mari is one of the members in the group called El Futuro 6 & 7 (The Future). She has two children and they live together with her long term partner in a simple structure home. Her group is located in a rural zone in the outskirts of the touristy city of La Romana. Her community is a sugar cane growing area where the main activity is growing and cutting sugar cane. These 10 women carry out a variety of activities like the sale of clothes, cosmetics and shoes; beauty salon, grocery store among others.

Mari is very excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional having paid her previous loans and invested her loans and profits in her business. Mari started her business 15 years ago, with a help she received from her mother, now she has a little grocery store called in Dominican Republic “colmado” which is a small grocery store where her neighbors come by to purchase basic need items for their families daily meals. She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, and other goods. 

Her most difficult challenge is to have her own house, this is also her most important dream, when she has her own house, she will be very happy and proud of her work.

loans.use: to buy rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira tiene ya más de cinco años con su negocio de venta de perfumes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar productos de perfumes y pintura de belleza para dama y productos de caballera, ya que le esta haciendo falta mercancía y sus clientes le están solicitando para regalar ahora en las fiestas de navidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Eriban se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en un taller mecánico (automotriz)
Desea mejorar los ingresos de su familia y que tengan lo necesario y con esta inversión en su negocio lo lograr.
texts.en: Elvira has been selling perfume for over five years.  She’s asking for a loan to buy perfume, women’s makeup and hair products because she’s low on this merchandise and her customers are asking for it to give as Christmas gifts.  She plans to repay the loan with profits she gets from her business since her husband, Eriban, will take care of family and school expenses of their two children with the salary he earns working as an auto mechanic.  She wishes to improve family income so that they will have what they need and she will attain this with this investment in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Cotton Group

texts.en:
Judith is a hard working 39 year old woman who lives in a local township called Nembudziya in the city of Gokwe. She lives with her husband and four children aged 17,13,5 and 1 year of which three are still attending school. Judith also bears the responsibility of carrying for her five orphaned children left behind by her deceased relatives, she does not let the pressure weigh her down but instead she works even harder to sustain her whole family.
Judith is in the tailoring business, she buys material and sews uniforms for sale. The major problem she faces is that her business is seasonal which means when the schools are closed for holidays income will be low. She will purchase material with the loan she has received and in the future she hopes to extend her business into a workshop which will supply uniforms on a larger scale

loans.use: to purchase cloth and other materials

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, es casada y socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años.
Margarita es feriante de carne, desde muy pequeña trabaja en la ferias junto con sus padres antes tenía poco capital, ahora trabaja sola y tiene su propio capital, le encanta Finca por las capacitaciones que recibe, las que le ayudaron a poder aumentar su negocio, el ahorro es muy importante para ella, el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de carnero, chancho y un poco de ropa, su meta es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Arco Iris (Rainbow) Communal Bank. She is a 38-year-old married mother of 2, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

Margarita is a meat vendor. Ever since she was young, she has been working in the open-air markets with her parents. Before, she had very little capital. Now that she works for herself, she has her own capital. She loves Finca because of the training she receives, which has helped her expand her business. Saving money is very important for her. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing mutton, pork, and some apparel. Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of meat, such as mutton and pork.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: A sus 43 años, Emilio tiene 5 hijos a los que todavía mantiene. Son casi 24 años los que convive con su pareja, con quien educa y cría a sus hijos en el calor de un hogar humilde pero propio. Emilio aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura de sus padres. En su comunidad la mayoría se dedica a eso, él no se queda atrás y siembra papa, arvejas, habas y cebada. Además posee 50 ovejas, 2 vacas y 2 caballos, en cuanto a animales menores: cuyes y gallinas. Mediante la compra y venta de animales también genera otros ingresos. En cuanto a los problemas en sus sembríos comenta que las heladas destruyeron gran parte en el mes de agosto, “es ganar o arriesgar, así es el trabajo”, agrega. Pero por la constancia que lo caracteriza, él seguirá con los cultivos, a los que quiere como una parte de él. En el futuro, y con las ganancias que genere, adquirirá más toros pequeños, los hará crecer y venderá; además de ampliar sus sembríos, con el fin de brindarles a sus hijos una educación en mejores colegios de la ciudad. Ya son 8 veces, que Emilio obtiene créditos con MFP, le gusta el trabajo con su banco comunal, por ser unidos y por que muchos de ellos son familiares suyos. Con el dinero piensa comprar sacos de abono, guano de ave de corral, el pago del flete que llevará su cosecha hacia la ciudad y el pago de sus peones.
texts.en: At 43 years of age, Emilio has 5 children whom he still supports. He has been with his partner for almost 24 years, and together they educate and raise their children in the warmth of their humble home. Emilio learned farming from his parents. Most of the people in his community are in agriculture, and he does not fall behind. He grows potatoes, peas, beans, and barley. Additionally, he has 50 sheep, 2 cows, and 2 horses. He also has small animals like chickens and guinea pigs. Besides buying and selling animals, he also makes an extra income. Regarding problems with his crops, he states that freezing temperatures did much damage during the month of August. "Winning or risking, that's what this job is about," he adds. However, because of the perseverance that he is characterized by, he will continue with his crops, which he loves as if they were a part of him. With the profits that he generates in the future, he will obtain more young bulls, which he will raise then sell. Also, he will expand his crops with the aim of providing his children with an education from the best schools in the city. This is the eighth time that Emilio obtains a loan from MFP. He likes working with his communal bank because its members are very united, and because many of them are his relatives. With this money, he plans to purchase sacks of fertilizer (bird guano), to pay the fee to transport his produce to the city, and to pay his farm workers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and to pay for crop transportation costs.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas e socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, tiene 59 años y 5 hijos, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 15 años.
Felicitas venD. carne D. chancho, queso y reparte en las casas, siempre se dedicó a la venta D. carne, tiene una chacra donD. tiene algunas reses, le encanta estar en su Banco Comunal porque aprenD. muchas cosas que le ayudan a poder ser mejor madre, comerciante, las capacitaciones le ayudan a administrar mejor su negocio. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando comprará carne D. chancho.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Arco Iris (Rainbow) Communal Bank. She is 59 years old, has 5 children, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years.

Felicitas sells pork and cheese door to door. She has always been in meat sales, and she owns a small farm with some cattle. She loves her communal bank because she learns a lot of things that can help her be a better mother and businesswoman. The training sessions help her better manage her business. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase pork.

loans.use: to purchase pork.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa e socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 2 años. Rosa vende jugo en le mercado y tiene una combi, el primer préstamo que tuvo lo invertió en la compra de una licuadora y extractora, le encanta Finca porque les enseña el ahorro, la responsabilidad, y le inculca las ganas de trabajar, le ayuda a fijarse metas y poder cumplirlas, da gracias por los préstamos recibidos porque le ayudo a tener un negocio bien cimentado.
Con este nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su combi.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of FINCA Peru for the last 2 years.  She sells juice in the market and she has a van.  She used the first loan to buy a blender and juice extractor.  She loves Finca because it teaches her how to save, how to be responsible, gives her enthusiasm for working, helps her set goals and how to achieve them.  She is thankful for the financing that she has received because it has helped her establish a solid business.

She will use the new loan to buy tires and to do maintenance on her van.

loans.use: to buy tires and to do maintenance on her van

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Enrique Hernan

texts.es:
Enrique Hernán tiene 37 años de edad es divorciado tiene dos hijos vive en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar semillas, abonos,fertilizantes, líquidos para plagas, insumos e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. 

El sueño es seguir trabajando junto a la familia para lograr prosperar  en la familia y en el negocio.
Le gusta las festividades del carnaval y las del sector

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Enrique Hernán is 37 years old.  He is divorced and lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. He has two children.  

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton. This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Enrique plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He carries out purchases and sales in Echeandia

With his previous loan he was able to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, mate monte (pesticide), fertilizers, and insecticides to maintain his crops in good condition. 

This loan will be a big help because he will be able to plant and harvest corn and rice and make a profit. He succeeded with the help of his prior loan and had no problem making the payments established by the cooperative.  With the money from the prior loan he was able to buy seeds and agricultural resources such as urea, pesticides, fertilizer, and herbicides in order to maintain good conditions for his crops.

Within his family, relationships have improved because now he can contribute a little more towards his family’s wellbeing.  His work is going much better because of increases in production.  His income has improved a lot because of increased sales.  His dream is to continue working with his family in order to succeed with the business.  He is very grateful for the help he has been offered.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, liquids to combat plagues, and other materials

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es:
Rosa Angela, es una mujer de 51 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos, desde hace 20 años vende frutas en el parque del municipio de Santa fe de Antioquia, negocio que ha sido tradición familiar. 

Debido a las fuertes lluvias y las dificultades económicas del país, el turismo en este municipio se vio afectado, hecho que disminuyó sus ventas. Sin embargo se acerca la temporada de vacaciones y Rosa Angela, solicita un crédito que utilizará en la compra de frutas y verduras para surtir su negocio, logrando así aumentar sus ventas, generando más ingresos para sacar su familia adelante, brindar estudio a sus hijos y disminuir las necesidades económicas actuales.
texts.en:
Rosa Angela, is 51 years old, married and the mother of 4 children.  She has been selling fruit in the city park of Santa fe de Antioquia for twenty years, and this business has been a family tradition.

Due to the heavy rains and the economical difficulties of the country, tourism in this town has been affected, causing a decline in her sales.

However, the holiday season is approaching and Rosa Angela is asking for a loan that she will use to buy fruits and vegetables in order to supply her business, enabling her in this way to increase her sales, earning more income in order to move her family forward, permitting her children to study and to help with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in order to supply her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Suni,tiene 55 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años.
Teresa tiene una tienda de abarrotes y vende frutas en el mercado, agradece la facilidad de los préstamos gracias a eso pudo terminar de construir su casa, aumentar su negocio, recuerda que antes vendía fruta y verdura en una esquina del mercado, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar y fruta.
texts.en: Teresa, 55, is a member of the “Suni” communal bank.  She has two children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 15 years.  Teresa has a grocery store and sells fruit in the market.  She appreciates the ease of the loans. Thanks to them she was able to finish building her house and increase business.  She remembers that she used to sell fruit and vegetables in one of the corners of the market.  The training helped her improve the business and her personal life.  With this loan she’s requesting she will buy sugar and fruit.

loans.use: to buy sugar and fruit.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El sr. Jesús nacido en la localidad de la  Florida de Santa Cruz el es soltero vive con su padre hace mas de 8 años, a quien ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Puerto Rico, su actividad económica es un  taller de bujes de goma, que se encuentra ubicado en un avenida muy concurrida de la localidad de el Torno, el a pesar se su corta edad en la tiene experiencia de cinco años en rubro, el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para hacer terminar el techado y construcción de un cuarto, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza que le han brindado.
texts.en: Jesús was born in La Florida de Santa Cruz.  He’s single and has been living with his father for over 8 years and helps him with household expenses.  His home is located in the Puerto Rico neighborhood.  His economic activity is a rubber bushing shop located on one of Torno’s busiest avenues.  Despite his young age he has five years’ experience in this line of work.  The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies to finish roofing and building a room.  He is very grateful to the institution for the trust it’s placed in him.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to install a roof.

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es:
Hipólita es socia del Banco Comunal Suni, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, es separada, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 10 años. 
Hipólita es feriante, vende golosinas, queso y carne en las ferias, y antes solo vendía golosina, no tiene mucho capital porque su mayor prioridad es la educación de sus hijos. A Hipólita le encantan las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a poder ser mejor madre y tener mas ganas de trabajar, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ganados y queso.
texts.en: Hipólita is a member of the “Suni” communal bank.  She’s 39 years old, separated and has been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years.  Hipólita is a vendor in the market.  He sells snacks, cheese and meat in the markets.  She used to only sell snacks.  She does not have much capital because her main priority is her children’s education.  Hipólita loves the training because they help her be a better mother and to want to work more.  She will use this loan to buy cattle and cheese.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cheese.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, es soltero, no tiene hijos, él es empleado, trabaja como promotor municipal en comunidades solidarias rurales, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, lo cual necesita cemento, arena, ladrillo, porque se encuentra construyendo un cuarto en la vivienda, el préstamo será una gran ayuda para realizar la construcción y de su trabajo poco a poco pagar la deuda.
La aspiración de José es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo, pueda mejorar la vivienda, ofreciendo a sus padres mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
José lives with his family. He is single and has no children. José is a municipal employee and works as a promoter in the unified rural communities. His work schedule is from 8am to 4pm.

José is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. He needs cement, sand, and bricks because he is building a room in his home. This loan will be a great help so that he can complete the construction. With his job, he can gradually pay off this debt.

Through work and effort, José aspires to continue making improvements to his home so that his parents will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks for building a room.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Suni, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, es viuda, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 10 años.
Nancy tiene un negocio donde vende bebidas, antes ella tenía un taller de pintado de carrocería pero ahora se dedica solo a su tienda, da gracias a Finca por las capacitaciones porque le ayuda a administrar mejor su negocio, con el préstamo que va a recibir invertirá en la compra de  bebidas variadas como gaseosa, jugos y  así poder hacer crecer su negocio, su meta es poder construir su casa.
texts.en: Nancy is a member of the “Suni” communal bank.  She’s 40 years old, widowed and has been a member of FINCA Perú for ten years.  Nancy has a business selling beverages.  She used to have a body shop and car painting business but now only has the store.  She thanks Finca for the training because it helps her run her business better.  She will use the loan she’ll get to buy assorted beverages like soft-drinks and juice to increase business.  Her goal is to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy assorted beverages.

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en:
Filiga is 43 years of age and married with five children. Filiga owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Filiga needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Filiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Filiga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón vive en el municipio de el Torno localidad de Puerto Rico, es casado  su esposa con la cual tiene un hijo, es de ocupación ama de casa, la  actividad del Sr. Ramón es prestar el servicio de albañilería, lleva ya 3 años con esta actividad donde va hasta lugares lejanos para realizar su trabajo,  el destino del crédito es para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse a las obra en construcción, esto le ayuda al Sr. ya que minimizara los gasto de transporte, es un apersona bien solicitada en las obras de construcción por el buen conocimiento que tiene en el rubro, es muy trabajador y  se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Ramón lives in the Puerto Rico neighborhood in El Torno.  He’s married to his wife and they have a son.  She’s a housewife.  Ramón is a bricklayer; he’s been in this occupation for three years and travels to distant locations offering his services.  The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to transport himself to construction sites.  This will help him save on transportation costs. He is a well sought-after person on construction jobs because of the good knowledge he has in this line of work.  He’s very hardworking ad feels grateful to the institution for the support it’s provided him.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more milk for making cheese, curds, and cream.

loans.name: Mariano Antonio

texts.es:
Mariano, vive con su esposa y un nieto, es casado, agricultor y ganadero, su esposa se dedica a la elaboracion de pan, el negocio surgió gracias a su propia iniciativa y siempre con la ayuda de los dos, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
El,está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como harina, manteca, huevos, levadura, entre otros, dicha compra le ayudara a incrementar la producción de pan ya que es demandada por sus clientes.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio agricola, tambien la panaderia para poder satisfacer las necesidades del hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariano is married and lives with his wife and grandson. He works as a farmer and rancher, while his wife prepares bread. Mariano started his business through his own initiative and has always had the help of his family. They do not work on a set schedule when attending to their customers.

Mariano is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, butter, eggs, yeast, and other supplies. He says this will help increase his wife’s production of bread so that she can meet the demands of her customers.

His dream is to improve his farming business and to also open a bakery so that that he and his wife can satisfy the household needs and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs, yeast, and other supplies for his wife's bread business.

loans.name: Los Microempresarios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Microempresarios” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes  se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, corte de leña y venta de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Diana quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo y centro del grupo, usa una bufanda rayada con colores lilas y rosas.
Ella se dedica a la confección de vestuario y desde la fecha del último crédito su negocio ha funcionado positivamente, ya que pudo invertir en su negocio.
Con el crédito de ésta oportunidad comprará  ropa, telas y moldes para confeccionar novedosos diseños. Sin embargo comenta que ella también se dedica a diseñar exclusivos modelos de ropa. 
Sus metas continúan siendo establecerse en su negocio para abrir una boutique de ropa.
Respecto a su vida personal y específicamente sus sueños de tener su casa propia, Diana se encuentra ahorrando dinero para postular al subsidio habitacional y de ésta manera obtener su casa propia.
Diana presidenta del Banco comunal se encuentra muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y con esto generar mayores ganancias. Además comenta que con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank called Los Microempresarios has twenty entrepreneurs who work in different fields some of which are hairdressing, cutting firewood, and clothing sales, among others, with all of them located in the city of Temuco.

Diana, who in the photo is at the bottom and middle of the group, is wearing a purple and pink striped scarf. She is a seamstress and her business has done well during her last loan period and now she can invest in her business.

This loan will give her the opportunity to buy clothes, fabrics and patterns in order to make new designs. She also comments that she also works designing an exclusive line of clothing.

Her goal continues to be that of establishing herself in her business in order to open a clothing boutique. Regarding her personal life and especially her dreams to have her own home, Diana is saving money in order to apply for a housing subsidy in order to buy her own house.

Diana is president of the communal bank and is very grateful for the loans granted through Fondo Esperanza, which have allowed her to invest in her business and which has increased her earnings. Furthermore, she says that with the training she has learned how to manage her income better.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). In the surrounding area are a string of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and stunning native flora and fauna, flourishing in the nearby parks. It should be mentioned that 50 percent of the indigenous people known as the Mapuche that exist in the country live in this area.

loans.use: to buy clothes, and fabrics and patterns in order to make new designs

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Asunción, de 33 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 y 08 años. Juntos habitam en el terreno de su madre, ahí construyó una casa para su él y su familia. Ella junto a su pareja trabajan mucho, ya que quieren progresar y dar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos. El trabajo de Asunción consiste en la venta de ropa, negocio que ofrece a amigos, familia y vecinos, además de nuevos clientes que siempre llegan a su casa cada vez que viene la mercadería traída de la ciudad de Lima. Por lo general vende prendas que están a la moda y de la mejor calidad, lleva ya trabajando con esto por dos años y seis meses, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer muchas cosas diferentes, además tiene independencia. Por otro lados sus fieles clientes le traen nueva clientela y eso le da ventaja a su negocio. Este será el préstamo número tres con MFP, esta muy contenta de trabajar con el grupo con el que esta y espera poder seguir trabajando por más tiempo. Además esta muy agradecida por la confianza brindada en su persona y espera poder seguir siendo puntual y no fallar con ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa al por mayor, ya que así le sale a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Asunción, 33, is a happy and very dynamic woman.  She lives with her partner with whom she has two children, ages 16 and 8.  Together they live on his mother's property, where they built a house for him and his family.  She and her partner work a lot, since they want to get ahead and give their children a good education and nourishment.

Asunción's work consists of selling clothing, a business she offers to friends, family, and neighbors, in addition to new customers who always come to her house every time the merchandise arrives from the city of Lima.  In general she sells articles that are in style and of the best quality.

She has been working with this for two years and six months now, and up to now she has done it alone.  What she likes about her job is that she has time to do many different things.  Besides, she has independence.  On the other hand, her loyal customers bring her new customers and this gives an advantage to her business.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to work with the group she's with and she hopes to be able to continue working longer.  In addition, she is very grateful for the confidence offered her personally and she hopes to be able to continue being punctual and not let you down.

With the requested total, she will buy more clothing wholesale, since that way she gets it at a better price.

loans.use: to buy more articles of clothing.

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
A sus 33 años de edad Luz Eliana es madre de 5 hijos, una mujer emprendedora que trabaja día a día con la ilusión de sacar a su familia adelante, por lo que decidió comenzar su propio negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Luz Eliana tiene una caseta ambulante en las afueras de un colegio del municipio de Bello, y adicional a esto tiene mercancía a la venta en su casa para las noches y los fines de semana.

Con el propósito de sacar su negocio adelante Luz quiere comprar un surtido de mayor cantidad  y variedad, como mekato, snaks, chicles, obleas y otros productos que sus clientes requieren, pero no cuenta con el capital para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual hacer dichas compras, generar más ingresos, y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 33 years of age, Luz Eliana is the mother of 5 children.  She is an enterprising woman who works day by day with the hope of getting ahead with her family, so she decided to start her own business to help her husband with the household expenses.  Luz Eliana has a moveable stand that she operates outside of a school in the municipality of Bello, and she also has merchandise for sale in her house in the evenings and on the weekends.

With the goal of making progress with her business, Luz wants to buy inventory in a greater quantity and variety, including sweet and salty snacks, gum, wafer cookies and other products that her customers want.  However, she lacks the capital to invest in her business.  For this reason, she requests a loan to make these purchases so that she can generate more income and correspondingly improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: La señora Dolores es socia integrante del banco de emprendimiento "añoranza" tiene como actividad una tienda de barrio, donde tiene a la venta de refrescos, regalos, golosinas, arroz, fideo, conservas y artículos de librería por la zona de tembladerani cerca al domicilio  ella ofrece variedad de productos ya que tiene mucha clientela por ser tu tienda la mas surtida de la zona, ella es casada vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en un taller eléctrico de movilidades el crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería por mayor como ser víveres, regalos, frazadas, edredones dulces,  golosinas y una heladera para la venta de halados, ella es un apersona emprendedora con ganas de superación su deseo es tener un almacén mas grande y ofrecer productos al por mayor, se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the communal bank Añoranza. She has a neighborhood grocery store, where she sells drinks, gifts, candy, rice, noodles, canned food and stationery goods in the area of Tembladerani close to her home. She offers a variety of products and she has many customers because her store is the best stocked in the area. She is married and lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband works in an electrical mobility workshop.

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale merchandise such as groceries, gifts, blankets, comforters, sweets, candy and a refrigerator so she can sell ice cream. She is an entrepreneur with the desire to succeed. Her dream is to have a bigger store and to offer wholesale products. She is grateful to the communal bank for its support.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as food supplies, gifts, and blankets

loans.name: Reyna Lizzette

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es casada y dueña D. una venta D. ropa, dicho negocio surgió gracias a su propia iniciativa, este negocio lo atienD. D. 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. todos los días.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para su negocio como ropa para damas blusas, vestidos, licras,para caballeros camisetas y camisas formales y para niños niños ya que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a surtir su negocio y a mejorara ingresos económicos.
Su mayor sueño es crecer en el negocio y sus ganancias para pagar sus deudas y trabajar con dinero propio.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her husband and three children. She is married and the owner of a clothing shop. This business was established through her own initiative. She operates her business from 7am to 5pm, every day.

Reyna is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business such as women’s blouses, dresses, spandex, men’s t-shirts, formal shirts, and children’s clothes. There is already demand from her customers, so this purchase will help restock her business and improve her financial earnings.

Her greatest wish is to grow her business, use her profits to pay her debts, and work with her own money.

loans.use: to buy women’s blouses, dresses, spandex, men’s t-shirts, formal shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal Suni, tiene 57 años, es casada y madre de 7 hijos.
Máxima tiene un taller de confección de pantalones, antes trabajaba en una Cooperativa y no le gustó, gracias a una amiga ingresó a Finca, se siente contenta de pertencer a su Banco Comunal y disfruta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan a ahorrar. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de materiales.
texts.en:
Máxima is a member of the Communal Bank “Suni”. She is married and the mother of seven children.

Máxima has a workshop where she makes trousers. She previously worked with a cooperative, but she did not like it. Thanks to a friend, she joined FINCA. Máxima is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank and enjoys the training classes because they have taught her how to save. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is 41 years of age and she is married with five children. Easter is starting a business venture, selling dairy products in the local community.  Easter needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Easter joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Easter's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tiene una hija D. 6 años, administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, este negocio surgió con la colaboración D. su esposo, decidieron juntos empezar para generar ingresos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. gaseosas, boquitas, galletas y dulces, con este préstamo realizara la compra que requiere para mejorar el negocio, con esta inversión espera mejorar el negocio, y poder proveer a su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter. She manages a store where she offers basic necessities. María and her husband worked together to establish this business because they decided to start generating income.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy sodas, snack food, cookies, and candy. This loan will enable her to purchase what she needs to improve her business. With this investment, María hopes to improve her business and proviD. her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snack food, cookies, and candy.

loans.name: Kory Tawaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY TAWACO” iniciará su decimo septimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ibone. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de láminas educativas, cotillon e internet, comercio de mantas, comercio de productos YAMBAL, venta de clinex y cosméticos, tienda, venta de comida, pasteleria, distribuidora de láminas. 

La señora Ibone  indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de sus vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de láminas educativas que viene trabajando hace cinco años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de laminas), que adquirirá de la Ceja y lo comercializa en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones, la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Kory Tawaco” is starting its 17th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group consists of 11 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Ibone. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling cosmetics, selling laminated educational posters, selling party supplies, providing Internet services, selling blankets, selling Yanbal products, selling tissue paper and toiletries, selling food, managing a pastry shop, and distributing laminated posters.

Sra. Ibone says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago after being invited by her neighbors. She currently has a business of selling laminated educational posters that she has managed for five years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory of laminated posters that she will acquire in La Ceja and then sell from her home. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Ibone is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ibone said that she enjoys the meetings, the training classes, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy laminated educational posters for resale.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 40 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 12 años.
Clementina tiene una panadería, recuerda que antes vendía golosinas en una carretilla, después se compró un triciclo, a medida que fue creciendo su negocio llegó a vender sus golosinas al por mayor gracias a ello construyó su casa, ahora ella tiene una panadería en el cual le va bien gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal, Clementina ha podido educar a sus hijos. El préstamo que esta solicitnado lo invertirá en la compra de harina y azúcar. Su meta es poder sembrar cacao.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vida” (New Life). She is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Clementina has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years.

She manages a bakery. Clementina recalls previously selling candy from a cart. Afterwards, she bought a tricycle so that she could grow her business and sell candy in bulk. Thanks to this business, she was able to build her house. Now she has a bakery that is doing well thanks to the training she received from her Communal Bank. Clementina has been able to provide for her children’s education.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Her goal is to grow cacao.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Maria  Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. María  ya es una cliente distinguida por nuestra institución y ella renovó su crédito, por que uno de sus hijos necesita una cirugía de  emergencia, y van a pagar parte de los gastos del hospital, ella y su distinguido esposo decidieron acudir con nosotros para ver una pronta solución a la enfermedad de sus hijo, ya que  por  el  momento  no  cuentan con  el  capital  necesario  para   hacerle  frente  a  este  gasto, agradece  el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a distinguished client of Credituyo. She is requesting another loan because one of her children is in need of emergency surgery and the money will be used to pay part of the hospital expenses. María and her husband decided to approach Credituyo because they needed a quick solution for their child’s illness.

At the moment, they do not have the necessary capital to deal with this expense. María is grateful for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to pay for her child's hospital expenses.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Juan se dedica al parchado de llantas, desde hace más de 8 años y es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, y de esta manera colabora con su familia con los gastos del hogar, le va muy bien tiene mucha clientela, ya que su taller se  encuentra en un lugar estratégico,  Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de una maquina para el desarmado de llantas y poder  ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, el Sr. Juan Carlos agradece por la atención prestada por la  entidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan has been patching tires for more than eight years. He is a person who is very dedicated to his work since this is his only source of income by which he and his family can pay for the household expenses. Juan has done very well and has attracted many customers because his workshop is located in a strategic place.

He is requesting a loan for buying a machine for dismantling tires. This will help him to offer better service to his customers. Sr. Juan Carlos is grateful for the service he has received from Emprender.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for dismantling and patching tires.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 35 años, es una mujer amable y muy carismática, le gusta mucho trabajar, es madre de tres niños quienes son fruto del amor que tiene con su conviviente. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, en compañía además de sus hermanos. Por ello trabaja día a día, para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Doris consiste en la venta de ropa traída de la ciudad de Lima para así venderlos a crédito en la ciuda de Pucallpa. Ella consigue la mejor ropa y de la mejor calidad a bajo precio en el gran emporio comercial de Lima y del que luego es ofrecido a amigos, familiares, vecinos, quienes siempre le cumplen con el pago. Tiene cinco años trabajando en esta actividad, asimismo su pareja es quien más la apoya. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede contar con un ingreso extra y así apoya a la economía de su hogar, pues considera rentable su negocio por que tiene demanda sus productos por su bajo precio y buena calidad, por lo que espera seguir creciendo con este trabajo que le esta ayudando a mejorar muchos aspectos de su vida. Este será el préstamo número cinco con MFP, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a este grupo tan responsable que siempre cumplen y están ahí para apoyarse entre ellos. Agradece mucho a la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le sirve para tener mayor capital y asi traer en mayor cantidad. Con el monto solicitado, comprará perfumes en cantidad para poder venderlos, además invertirá en algunas prendas que le pidieron y que tiene cumplir con esos pedidos.
texts.en:
Doris, 35, is a charming, kind woman.  She likes to work very much.  She’s the mother of three children who are the fruit of the love she has for her spouse.  They all live together in their own house together with the rest of her siblings.  Because of this she works day to day to have a better quality of life.

Doris’ work consists in bringing clothes from the city of Lima to sell on credit in the city of Pucallpa.  She gets the best quality clothes at the lowest price at a large commercial emporium in the city of Lima which she then sells to friends, neighbors and family members who are always responsible about paying her.

She’s been working at this for five years.  Her spouse is her greatest support.  What she likes about the work is being able to have extra income to help support her home.  She considers her business to be profitable because her products are in demand due to their low price and good quality so she hopes to continue growing in her business that has been helping her improve many aspects of her life.

This will be her 5th MFP loan.  She is very happy to belong to such a responsible group that always fulfill their obligations and are there to support each other.  She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided because it helps her have larger capital so that she can bring larger amounts.  She will use the requested amount to buy perfumes in quantity to sell and will also buy some articles of clothing that she has pending orders for and must fill.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and toys.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y bebidas, ella vive con su esposo y su madre, ella administra su negocio desde hace un año, los productos que vende son frutas de temporada, este negocio lo tiene instalado en un puesto en el mercado, lo atiende de 8:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas sandia, papaya, en bebidas, gaseosas, jugos, gatorade, agua en bolsa, este crédito le ayudara para mantener todo lo necesario para que continúe bien el negocio, esperando que las ventas mejoren y pueda tener la capacidad para pagar el préstamo.
El objetivo de Domitila es que poco a poco crecer en el negocio y proveer para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Domitila sells fruits, vegetables, and beverages. She lives with her husband and her mother. Domitila has managed this business for one year. The products she sells include seasonal fruits. Her business consists of a stand at the market that she manages from 8am to 3pm.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy fruits such as watermelon, papaya, as well as beverages such as sodas, juices, sports drinks, and bottled water. This loan will help maintain everything she needs so that she can continue to do well in her business. Domitila expects her sales will improve and that she will have the capacity to repay this loan.

Her goal is to gradually grow her business and provide everything her family needs.

loans.use: to buy assorted beverages and seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. carne D. res, cerdo y medicina natural, ella vive con dos hijos D. 23 y 19 años, ambos son independientes, el negocio surgió D. la necesidad D. proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario, lo aprendió hace 20 años y atienD. D. 7:00am a 12:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar dos novillas y cerdo, la compra le ayudara para tener disponibilidad D. producto, ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es trabajar D. manera ordenada, administrar bien los fondos del préstamo, y continuar con las ventas para proveer ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
María sells beef, pork, and natural medicines. She lives with her two children, ages 23 and 19. Both of them are independent. Her business was started out of necessity so that she could proviD. everything her children needed. María learned this traD. 20 years ago and operates her business from 7am to 12pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy two heifers and a pig. This purchase will ensure that she has available products to offer to her customers. Her goals are to work in an orderly manner, properly manage the funds from this loan, and to continue her sales so that she can proviD. household income.

loans.use: to buy two heifers and a pig for butchering.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator for the group “Mujeres de Sueños y Metas 5, 6 & 7” (Women with Dreams and Goals). Her family consists of her four children and her long term partner who is the father of her children. They live in Santo Domingo in one of the poorest communities located north of the city. This community is in a rural area.

Dominga is excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. She run a fast food business from a stand in front of her house. Her specialty is salted and fried meat. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of meat (beef and pork) and also fruit to prepare natural juices. She started her business because her grandmother uses to sell meat and she talked to her. She has been selling meat for 13 years.  Her profits will be saved and to buy different things her children need. 

Dominga's most difficult challenge has been to raise her children, and she is dreaming to finish building her house into a concrete block structure, to live tranquil and safe.

loans.use: to buy meat and fruit

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 27 años, es una mujer joven, trabajadora y muy responsable, es madre soltera y enfrenta el mundo con valor y fuerza por el bienestar de su único hijo de ocho años. Ella vive en casa de su madre junto a su hermana y su menor hijo. Trabaja día a día para poder brindar lo mejor a su niño. EL trabajo de Edith consiste en la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, verduras y más, este negocio lo tiene en su casa, además ella trabaja en su propio kiosco en una colegio muy grande de la ciudad de donde vende golosinas, gaseosas, frutas, bebidas y otros más. Tiene trabajando por diez años, y al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su madre, pero ahora el negocio es solo de ella y su hermana es quien más la ayuda, mientras ella se encuentra en vendiendo en el kiosko del colegio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para darse entre los dos establecimientos, por tanto debe alternar bien su tiempo para no descuidar ambos negocios. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le va bien trabajando con su grupo y espera poder seguir yendo como hasta ahora ya que se mostró como una socia muy responsable. Además tiene en mente seguir trabajando a lado de la institución por mucho más tiempo ya que le es de mucha ayuda los prestamos otorgados para mejorar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para abastecer su bodega, asimismo comprará golosinas y bebidas gasificadas para surtir su kiosco que se encuentra dentro del colegio.
texts.en:
Edith, 27, is a young, hardworking and very responsible woman.  She’s a single mother who faces life with strength and valor for her 8-year-old only son’s wellbeing.  She lives in her mother’s house with her sister and younger brother.  She works day to day to provide the best for her little boy.

Edith’s work consists in selling staples like rice, sugar, milk, bread, vegetables and more.  This store is located at home.  She also has a kiosk in a big school in the city where she sells snacks, soft-drinks, fruit, beverages and others.  She’s been working for ten years.  At the beginning she had help from her mother but now the store belongs only to her and her sister is her best helper when she’s selling at the kiosk at school.  What she enjoys about her work is having time to dedicate to each establishment so she has to divide her time up between them in order not to neglect either one.

This will be the 3rd MFP loan.  She does well working with her group and hopes that she will continue to do as well as she’s done to date since she’s been a very responsible group member.  Besides, she’s thinking about continuing to work hand in hand with the institution for much more time because the loans are very helpful for her business’ improvement.  She will use the requested amount to buy stock merchandise for her store as well as snacks and soft-drinks to stock her kiosk located inside the school.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store as well as soft-drinks and snacks for her kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Sega

texts.en:
Sega is 27 years of age and married with two children. Sega owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro (root vegetables) for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Sega needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Sega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sega's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 65 años, es madre D. 4 hijos.
Paulina tiene una carpintería y empezó con muy poco capital, a medida que fue creciendo su negocio pudo comprar sus maquinarias, con Finca pudo ahorrar mas dinero y logró comprar mas maquinarias, se siente muy orgullosa D. pertenecer a la familia D. Finca y cada vez que tiene oportunidad comparte sus éxitos e invita a otras mujeres a ser socias D. Finca, con el préstamo que solicita comprará madera y triplay.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vida” (New Life). She is 65 years old and the mother of four children.

Paulina has a carpentry business and started out with very little capital. By growing her business, she was able to buy machines. FINCA helped her to save more money so that she could buy more machines. She is proud to be part of the FINCA family and takes every opportunity to share her successes and invite other women to become members of FINCA. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wood and particle board.

loans.use: to buy wood and particle board.

loans.name: David Oswaldo

texts.es:
David Oswaldo  tiene treintaiun años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá sembrar y cosechar  para tener utilidades ya que con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. Con el dinero  pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos.

El sueño es seguir trabajando junto a la familia para lograr prosperar  en la familia y en el negocio.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
David Oswaldo is 31 years old and married without children. He lives with his wife in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN is located in the area of Guamayacu, which belongs to the canton of Echeandía. This settlement grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and green pigeon peas.

David works growing corn, rice and green pigeon peas, the buying and selling of which take place in Echeandia.

The loan will be very helpful because he could plant and harvest for income. The previous loan helped him to get ahead and he had no problem making timely payments to the communal bank. With this loan he could buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to maintain the crops in good condition.

His family relationship has improved because now he can contribute a little more to the well being of his family. His work is going along better because he has expanded the production and increased his earnings because now with the sale of his crops he is making more profit. 

His dream is to continue working together with his family in order for his family and his business to prosper. 

He is very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant and harvest for profit

loans.name: Senara

texts.en:
Senara is 19 years old, married, and has no children. Senara owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Senara needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Senara joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Senara's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 50 años.
Genoveva trabaja como cocinera en un recreo, ella todos los prestamos que saca lo invierte en la educación de sus hijos, tiene 5 hijos y gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de Finca pudieron terminar sus estudios superiores, su hija es profesora, dos hijos contadores y dos hijos policías, su meta es poder abrir su propio recreo, agradece a Finca por las buenas enseñanzas que le brindaron y todo lo que aprendía pudo inculcar a sus hijos. El préstamo que esta solicitando lo utilizará para la graduación de su hijo en paracaidismo. 
Genoveva manifiesta que Finca es una Institución que confía en la mujer emprendedora y luchadora, que ayuda a las mujeres a poder salir de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Nueva Vida communal bank. She is 50 years old.

Genoveva works as a cook in a café. She invests all the loans that she has taken in the education of her children. She has five children. Thanks to her effort and the assistance of Finca, they were all able to finish their higher education. Her daughter is a teacher, two sons are accountants, and two sons are police officers. Her goal is to be able to open her own café. She is grateful to Finca for the good education that they have given her. Everything she learned she was able to instill in her children.  The loan that she is requesting will be used for her son’s parachuting graduation.

Genoveva expresses that Finca is an institution that trusts in entrepreneurial, hardworking women and helps women be able to get out of poverty.

loans.use: to fund her son's graduation.

loans.name: Jaime Ernesto

texts.es:
Jaime, vive con sus padres, es empleado de la policía nacional civil, está soltero,  después de finalizar el estudio de bachiller, aplico para entrar a la policía, pues este trabajo le gustaba mucho, hoy en día se encuentra trabajando en esta organización. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cohetes, pues en los siguientes meses la demanda por los jóvenes y niños aumenta, este préstamo le servirá para tener la disponibilidad de productos para la venta, adelantándose para tener más clientela.
El objetivo de Jaime es surtir el negocio, además de que la venta de pólvora es buena, por lo que está animado con la esperanza que sus ingresos mejoren.
texts.en:
Jaime is single and lives with his parents. He is employed by the national civil police. After completing his undergraduate studies, he applied to enter the police force because he likes this type of work. Today he is working for the organization.

Jaime is currently requesting a loan to buy rockets since the demand among young people and children will increase in the following months. This loan will ensure that he has available products to sell. He looks forward to having more customers.

Jaime’s goal is to stock his business. The sale of fireworks has been good, so he is excited about the prospects of improving his income.

loans.use: to buy rockets (fireworks).

loans.name: Seluia

texts.en:
Seluia is 28 years of age and married with one child. She has owned and operated a business selling baked goods in the local community for 1 year. Seluia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase baking powder, sacks of flour and sugar and an oven.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2011, Seluia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Seluia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking powder, flour, sugar and an oven

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer consagrada a su familia, por lo que trabaja con gran dedicación, vende mercancía como ropa, perfumería y adicional a esto elabora accesorios para mujer, se siente afortunada por tener y un trabajo en el cual puede estar al frente de su hogar y manejar sus propios horarios.

Con la ilusión de tener un progreso continuo Cristina quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para generar mas utilidades e insumos para la elaboración de los accesorios, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar dichas compras por lo que solicita un crédito para invertirle a su microempresa, generar mas ventas e insumos y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina is a woman devoted to her family, which is why she works with such dedication selling products like clothing and perfume, as well as women's accessories that she makes herself. She feels lucky to have a job that allows her to be at the front of her home and to manage her own hours. 

With the idea of continuing to move forward, Cristina wants to buy merchandise in bulk to generate more income, as well as parts for making the accessories, but she doesn't have the capital that she needs to make the purchases. For that reason, she has asked for a loan to invest in her small business so that she can sell more and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products and materials to stock her business.

loans.name: Ruth Guissella

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 27 años, es madre de 1 hijo y socia de Finca desde hace 3 años.
Ruth es dueña de una Cebicheria, todo este tiempo que es socia aprendió a madurar sus ideas y metas, opina que Finca es una Institución que ayuda a mujeres de toda clase social con préstamos rápidos, capacitaciones y el ahorro, le va bien en su negocio y tiene la meta de seguir adelante en sus propósitos, el préstamo que sacó lo invertirá en la compra de pescado y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the village bank Nueva Vida. She is 27 and the mother of one son, and has been been working with Finca for 3 years. Throughout this time she has learned to bring her ideas and goals to fruition, and she thinks that Finca is an institution that helps women of all social classes with quick loans, trainings and savings.

Ruth is the owner of a ceviche restaurant. Her business is going well and she has the goal of moving forward with her proposals. The loan that she took out will be invested in the purchase of fish and sodas.

loans.use: to buy fish and sodas.

loans.name: Mirando El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Mirando el Futuro” conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran almacenes, preparación y venta de comida rápida, además de peluquería. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago.
María integrante del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer puesto de derecha a izquierda, su cabello es color rubio y largo. Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 12 años.
Este oficio lo aprendió en un instituto, por lo que también se dedica a servicios de pedicura, manicura y depilación.
Su horario de trabajo es durante las tardes de 6ºº a 10ºº de la noche, todos los días de la semana. Atiende en su propio salón de belleza. Comenta que debe distribuir su horario de esta manera, ya que también estudia en la Universidad, la carrera de derecho. 
Su negocio cuenta con un gran número de clientes, ya que se conservan desde que comenzó en el rubro por lo tanto es clientela fija. Sus insumos los compra en una distribuidora especialista en comercializar materiales de trabajo para salones de belleza, además cuenta con descuentos al comprar, ya que es cliente frecuente. 
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su salón de belleza, entre los cuales se encuentran, agua decolorante, cremas oxidantes, cremas capilares y un navajín. 
Sus metas en su negocio son instalarse con un centro integral de belleza, ya que quiere incorporar el servicio de masajes. 
María vive junto a sus dos hijos de 22 y 17 años de edad, ambos estudian, el mayor de ellos en la Universidad y su hijo menor en la educación media.
