Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene  hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizo en la compra de quesos.  Nos cuenta que también vende quinua y artesanía en miniaturas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles comprará quesos, diez arrobas de quinua y lanas para sus tejidos, la señora nos cuenta que la quinua la compra en Tiquillaca a S/. 40 a 45 nuevo soles y ella lo vende a S/. 60.00 a 65.00 nuevo soles.  En el negocio trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja como transportista (taxi).
Desea tener un carro para dar servicio de transportes y tener un terreno.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el plazo.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the communal bank “Bellavista” located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 35 years old, lives with a partner and has no children. She studied through high school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last two years. Her first loan was for the sum of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she used to buy cheeses. She tells us that she also sells quinoa and handcrafted miniatures.

With this new loan for S/.500.00 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy cheeses,10 pounds of quinoa and wool for her weaving. She tells us that she buys the quinoa in Tiquillaca at S/.40 to 45 nuevos soles (PEN) and she sells it for S/.60.00 to 65.00 nuevos soles (PEN). She works her business alone, her partner works as a taxi driver . 

She wants to have a car in order to offer transportation services and have a piece of land. What she likes about the communal bank is the loan facility and the terms.

loans.use: to buy cheeses, 10 pounds of quinoa and wool.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, cuenta con estudios universitarios.
La señorita se dedica a la producción de pan, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.  Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en este negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 nuevo soles, comprará harina, manteca y una parte del dinero lo utilizará para la reparación del horno ya que se acerca la fiesta de todos los santos y tendrá más pedidos.
En el negocio le ayuda su mamá y tiene maestros panaderos que trabajan para ella.
La señorita desea tener su propia panadería bien establecida y ser profesional.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión, la responsabilidad y la puntualidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the communal bank "Bellavista" which is located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 19 years old, single and has no children. She has a college education.

The young lady makes bread. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last year. Her first loan was for S/.500.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she invested in this business.

With this new loan of S/.1,400.00 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy flour, butter and also use part of the loan to repair her oven as the feast of All Saints is fast approaching and she will have more orders.
.
Her mother helps her with the business and she also has master bakers working for her.

The young lady wants her own well-established bakery and to be professional.

What she likes about the communal bank is the togetherness, the responsibility and timeliness of the members.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and repair the oven.

loans.name: Ma Aurelia

texts.es: María Aurelia es separada y que se  que ha demostrado así misma ser una mujer fuerte y tenaz  que a pesar de la situación económica de cómo esta en este mundo ha sabido salir adelante con sus tres hijos. Desde hace cuatro años inicio un negocio de la venta de gorditas, comenta la señora María Aurelia que empezó con dos kilos de harina y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio en el que ahora es llamado por los clientes “Gorditas de la Quince” que en realidad no es el nombre oficial, por que se encuentra en una calle de nuestra ciudad con ese nombre. La señora ha ido prosperando tanto que hasta construyo su vivienda y un lugar para usarlo de restaurante, pero en este momento el préstamo lo quiere para comenzar a construir la cocina cerca del negocio ya que la comida la sigue preparando en la cocina de su casa donde prepara los guisos y las gorditas de harina lo cual se dificulta por que tiene que caminar para la carrucha donde su hija es quien las prepara. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, varilla, y pagar el albañil.
texts.en:
María Aurelia is separated and has shown herself to be a strong and tenacious woman who despite the world economic situation has known how to get ahead with her 3 children. She started her business selling gorditas (stuffed corn cakes) 4 years ago. Señora María Aurelia tells us that she started out with 2 kilos of flour and little by little grew the business into what is now called by customers "Gorditas de la Quince" ("The Fat Ones of Number 15")which in reality is not its offical name, as the business is located on a street of that name. 

She has prospered so much that she has even been able to build her own house and a place to use as a restaurant. However, currently she wants the loan to start building the kitchen close to the restaurant as she is till making the food, stews and the gorditas, in her own kitchen at home which hampers her as she has to walk to the cart where her daughter prepares the food. To realize her project, she needs to buy cement, sand, rods and pay the builder.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Patricia Julia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene tres  hijos a su cargo.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (comida típica de la región).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres sacos de papa, y carne para la preparación de los anticuchos, la señora cuenta que los vende los días jueves, viernes y sábados  por las noches.  En el negocio le ayuda su hija.
La señora desea tener su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank "Bellavista" which is located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 31  years old, separated from her husband and has 3 children in her care. She has higher education. 

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last year. Her last loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she invested in her business which is selling anticuchos (a traditional food of the region) (a type of kebab).

With this new loan of S/. 800.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy 3 sacks of potatoes and meat to make the anticuchos. The lady tells us that she sells them on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at night time. Her daughter helps her with the business. 

The lady wants to have a house and her children to grow up to be professionals.

What she likes about the communal bank is their responsibility and timeliness.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of potatoes and meat.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
María, se dedica al comercio de ropa y productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, la tienda está instalada en su vivienda, la venta de ropa la realiza tres veces por semana, solamente los días que hay comercio en la localidad, este negocio surgió por necesidad y lo aprendió de sus padres.
Actualmente comprara mercadería, ropa en general como blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior para ambos sexos, esta inversión será un gran apoyo, por el cual crecerá en las ventas y clientela.
La aspiración de María es fortalecer el negocio, que este sea rentable y poder cancelar este préstamo responsablemente para continuar siendo beneficiada.
texts.en:
María sells clothing and basic necessities. She lives with her husband and three children. María has a store in her home where she sells clothing three times a week, which are the only days when trade is conducted in her town. This business started out of necessity and she learned this trade from her parents.

María currently needs a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, skirts, trousers, and undergarments for both sexes. This investment will be a great help because it will enable her to increase her sales and attract customers. Her aspiration is to strengthen her business, which is profitable, so that she can repay this loan responsibly and continue reaping the benefits.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, and undergarments.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está formado por 7 mujeres quienes son responsables, trabajadoras, carismáticas y alegres, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, tiene un hermoso centro histórico el cual revela la historia de la ciudad, la cultura y tradiciones. Su gente es muy cálida y amable, como nuestras socias quienes luchan día a día para mejorar su situación económica para salir adelante con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Ana, vive por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia de Baños (Cuenca). Tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido un bebé de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios para recorridos turísticos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Ana se dedica a la cría y venta de animales  como cerdos y cuyes, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 3 años, trabaja solo los días de feria y el resto de su tiempo lo dedica a su hijo y a su hogar.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 5 años y sus créditos los ha invertido en el incremento de su negocio, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y cuyes para seguir creciendo en esta labor.
 
Su meta es criar pollos para comenzar con este negocio.

Las fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevas Amigas consists of 7 women who are responsible, hardworking, charismatic and happy women. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city has been a cultural heritage site since 1999. It has a beautiful historical city centre which tells of the city's history, culture and traditions. The people are very warm and friendly, as are our members who struggle daily to improve their economic situation and take care of their families.

One of the members of this group is Señora Ana. She lives in a community that belongs to the parish of Baños (Cuenca). She is 25 years old, married and has an 8 month old baby. Her husband is a driver by profession and works offering his services for sightseeing tours. They do not own their own house and so rent.

Doña Ana breeds and sells animals such as pigs and guinea pigs. She has been doing this work for the last 3 years. She works only on weekdays and spends the rest of the time taking care of her child and home.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and has invested her loans in growing her business. She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of pigs and guinea pigs to continue growing the business.

Her goal is to raise chickens to start in this business.

The small photos are of 3 members who for work reasons could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mirlith

texts.es: Mirlith, de 37 años, es madre soltera, vive en una casa propia a lado de siete personas entre alguno de sus hermanos y sus hijos, ella trabaja duro todos los días para mejorar su ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mirlith consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas, pues compra a las distribuidoras en cantidades y se encarga de venderlos al menudeo pero heladas. Esto hace que sus clientes vayan a su casa muy seguido, ya que en su casa se venden las bebidas más heladas de la cuadra y teniendo en cuenta el calor que hay en la zona donde vive. Su negocio es muy bueno, lleva aproximadamente cuatro años trabajando en esto y lo hace sola. Le gusta que en su trabajo pueda cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, además que le gusta interrelacionarse con ellos. Lo que más anhela es instalar una bodega, pues no hay negocio de este rubro en la calle por donde vive. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido anteriormente y desea ahora que peudan apoyarlo para invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará bebidas al por mayor en los carros distribuidores.
texts.en:
Mirlith is 37 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own home beside 7 people, among whom are her siblings and their children. She works very hard every day to improve her income and have a better quality of life. Mirlith’s work consists of selling soft drinks which she buys in bulk from wholesalers and she then sells them on when they are freezing cold.

The heat in the area in which she lives makes her customers come to her house very often as she sells the coldest drinks on her block. Her business is very good and she has spent approximately four years working at it by herself. She likes that she can meet the demands of her customers and she also enjoys interacting with them. 

She longs to set up a store since there are no other businesses of this kind on her street. This will be her sixth loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the support that she has received previously and she now hopes that they can help her by investing in her business. With the amount requested, she will buy drinks in bulk from the wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks in bulk.

loans.name: Katyan

texts.es:
Katyan es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Cuenta con estudios universitarios.
Trabaja desde hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la comprar de ropa de policía y para asensos y grados (bazar de uniformes para policías).
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cinco pares de borceguíes (botas).  Trabaja en el negocio junto con su mamá.
La señorita desea tener su propio bazar e incrementar la mercadería para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el apoyo de las socias y las ganancias de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Katyan is a member of the 'Bellavista' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 24 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She has a university education.

Katyan has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 soles and she invested that money in buying clothing for police, and for promotions and graduations (she runs a police uniform store).

Katyan is currently requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles to buy five pairs of 'borceguíes' (combat boots).  She works with her mom in this business.

This young lady would like to own her own store and increase her quantity of merchandise in order to improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank is the support she receives from her fellow members and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy five pairs of combat boots

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres  hijos.  La señora cuenta con educación superior.
Es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de servicio de orquesta y alquiler de equipos, con este dinero comprará  parlantes. 
La señora trabaja junto con su esposo en la orquesta.  Paralelamente y en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.
 La señora desea tener más equipos y ampliar el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the 'Bellavista' community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She completed her higher education.

Yaneth is a new client who recently started working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting a loan for 500 soles to invest in her business which is providing a band service and hiring equipment.  She will use this money to buy speakers.

Yaneth works alongside her husband in the band.  In parallel with this, and in her free time, she sells beauty products through a catalog.  She would like to have more equipment and expand her business.

What Yaneth likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy speakers

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 59 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, esta casada y fruto D. su matrimonio tuvo tres hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Vive en su casa propia a lado D. su esposo y uno D. sus hijos con quien comparte los gastos del hogar y trabajan mucho para tener mejores condiciones D. vida. El trabajo D. Norma consiste en la venta D. plátano, ella sale temprano al mercado D. Bellavista o al puerto del reloj publico (embarcadero fluvial principal D. las comunidades) en donD. espera la llegada D. los agricultores, quienes venden el plátano a un menor precio, D. ahí los enD. al por menor en la vereda D. su casa, en donD. acondicionó un pequeño espacio para así ofrecer los productos que son muy solicitados. Lleva realizando este trabajo ya por cinco años y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder realizar algunas labores domésticas, además le agrada mucho poder estar en contacto con sus clientes ya que le gusta mucho conversar con ellos. Considera que su trabajo es rentable ya que tiene mucha acogida y demanda en la zona en donD. esta ubicado su negocio. Quiere más adelante poder crecer en este trabajo y comprar sus productos en mayor cantidad. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, se siente muy bien trabajando con el grupo al que pertenece. Asimismo menciona que le gustaría poder seguir trabajando con ustedes, ya que siente que es D. mucha ayuda el dinero que recibe por que le permite aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará plátano por mayor cantidad, ya que cuando compra en el mismo puerto lo tiene que hacer en cantidad para que le salga más cómodo.
texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old.  She is a cheerful and very hard-working woman who is married and has three children who are all grown up and live independently.  Norma lives in her own home together with her husband and one of her children with whom she shares the household expenses.  They work hard in order to enjoy better living conditions.

Norma's business is selling bananas.  She goes out early in the morning to the market in Bellavista or Puerto del Reloj Público (the local communities' main river wharf) where she awaits the arrival of the farmers who sell their bananas at a lower price.  She then sells them retail on the sidewalk outsiD. her home where she set up a small space where she could sell the products which are in most demand.  Norma has been in this line of work for five years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  What she enjoys about her work is that it affords her time to carry out some of her housework as well.  She also really likes the contact with her customers as she very much enjoys chatting to them.  Norma considers her work to be profitable as her business is popular and there is a lot of demand in the area where she has her business.  In the future, she would like to be able to grow her business and buy her products in larger quantities.

This will be Norma's sixth loan from MFP.  She feels very happy working with her group.  She also mentions that she would like to be able to continue working with you as she feels that the money she receives is very helpful because it allows her to increase her working capital.  Norma will use the sum that she has requested to buy bananas in larger quantities because when she buys at the wharf she has to do so in bulk for the purchase to work out more convenient.

loans.use: to buy more bananas wholesale

loans.name: Kelvin David

texts.es:
El Señor. Kelvin es socio del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

El Señor. Kelvin tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de un año y seis meses. Su esposa se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Él se dedica al comercio, vende variedad de productos como ollas, cucharas, jarros, etc., se dedica a esta actividad desde que tenía 12 años y aprendió este oficio que era de su padre, trabaja ambulantemente todos los días sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cucharas, jarros, ollas, etc. para incrementar su mercadería.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Kelvin is a member of the 'El Ahorro' community bank and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate area which has great natural and cultural beauty.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine which delights visitors' palates.  The people are kind, friendly and charismatic.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Kelvin is 21 years old, lives with his partner, and has an 18-month-old child.  His wife is a saleswoman.  They do not own their own home but live in his in-laws' house, sharing the household expenses.

Kelvin is a salesman.  He sells a variety of products such as pans, spoons, pitchers, etc.  He has been in this business since he was 12 years old and learned the trade from his father.  He works as an itinerant vendor every day and does not work regular hours.

Kelvin has been a member of his community bank for four years and he will invest his new loan in buying spoons, pitchers, pans, etc. to increase his stock of merchandise.  His goal is to buy a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: to buy spoons, pitchers, pans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Carmen Amparo

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Carmen tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo de 8 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Carmen es oriunda de la provincia de Portoviejo, vino a esta ciudad a visitar a sus parientes pero le gusto la ciudad y se quedo a trabajar en ella. Ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta varios productos como plásticos, ollas, cucharas, etc. lleva en el negocio hace un año y medio, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como ollas, artículos de plástico, cucharas, etc.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios secundarios.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “El Ahorro” (The Saving) communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  The city has a cold climate and great natural and cultural beauty. Cuenca offers a diverse cuisine which entices its visitors.   Its people are kind, cordial, and charismatic.   They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  

Carmen, age 26, is in a common-law marriage.  She has an eight year old son who attends a city school.  Her husband is a merchant.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Carmen is from the Portoviejo province.  She came to this city to visit her relatives.  However, she liked the city, and she stayed to work.  She is a merchant.  She sells various products like plastics, pots, and spoons, etc.  She has been in the business for a year and a half.  She works every day; she does not have a fixed schedule.

This is her first loan in her communal bank, which her sister-in-law invited her to join.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like pots, plastic products, and spoons, etc.

Her goal is to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy pots, plastic products, and spoons, etc.

loans.name: Azaf Merary

texts.es: La  Sra. Azaf es  una mujer muy  trabajadora la  cual se  dedica  desde  ya  hace   cinco  años   a la  venta  de  ropa usada y  aparatos  electrodomésticos, este  ingreso le permite  sacar  adelante a  su  familia   brindándole  la posibilidad  de  ofrecer a  sus  hijos  una  buena estabilidad  económica, es  por ello  que  esta  muy  feliz  de habernos  encontrado  para  apoyarla  a realizar   su  proyecto.
texts.en: Azaf is a very hard-working woman.  She has been selling used clothes and electrical domestic appliances for five years.  This income allows her to get her family ahead and to give her children financial stability.  That is why she is happy to have found us to support her carrying out her project.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Alejandro es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, productos que se comercializan diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia.  También comercializa aves de corral, permitiéndole obtener otro ingreso económico para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida.  Alejandro es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 48, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  The house only has electrical service.  It is located in the rural zone of the Tambogrande district, Piura department.  The zone is known for its farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Alejandro is a farmer.  He has his own fields where he grows lemons.  This product is sold every day.  Once they are harvested he sells his product at the different markets in Piura.  That way he is able to get income to cover his family’s daily expenses.  He also sells poultry, which allows him to get another income for his household.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy fertilizers in order to improve his crops and to buy balanced feed for his animals.  Once they are fattened, he sells them at the different markets in his area.  His objective is to get a better price for them in order to have more income to improve his quality of life.

Alejandro is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that he wants is for his family to get ahead and do well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers in order to improve his crops and to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
La Señora. Gerardina es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Gerardina tiene 50 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 26 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Con ella también vive una sobrina a la cual la crio desde que tenía 12 años y hoy tiene 20 años de edad. Su esposo labora como portero de un colegio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Gerardina se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa usada y calzado, lleva 9 años en este negocio y labora solo días de ferias.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para surtir más su mercadería.

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gerardina is a member of “El Ahorro” (The Savings) communal bank, and she lives in the region surrounding the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and it can count on great natural and cultural beauty. Its ample gastronomy captures the palate of visitors, and its people are kind, cordial and charismatic. It still maintains the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Gerardina is 50 years old, married, and the fruit of her conjugal union is 2 sons, aged 26 and 12. Her 1st son is married and independent; her 2nd son is studying in a school in the city. Also living with her is a niece she has raised since the age of 12; she is now 20. Gerardina's husband works as a porter at a school. They do not have their own house and are forced to rent.

Gerardina is a merchant who sells used clothing and shoes. She has done this for 9 years and works on the days of local fairs.

Her communal bank is in its 2nd loan cycle. Gerardina plans to invest her loan funds in purchasing used clothing to resupply her merchandise. 

Gerardina's dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 60 años, es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja, con quien tuvo un hijo que ya es mayor de edad e independiente con familia propia. Ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja, al cosatado donde vive su hijo. EL trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de pescado en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad, ella se levanta temprano para ir al puerto del reloj público y así conseguir al por mayor a los pescadores que llegan con los alimentos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por casi 40 años y menciona que con este trabajo dio educación y alimento a su hijo, ahora ella trabaja sola y lo sigue haciendo por que es único medio de generar ingresos para su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar en su casa y descansar ya que a su edad no es igual que cuando era joven, además siempre fue independiente y se acostumbró a depender de ella misma. Espera poder mantenerse y seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo más. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho el grupo al que pertenece ya que son muy responsables, además esta muy agradecida de trabajar con la institución ya que le dan créditos fácil y con bajos intereses. Con el monto solicitado, comprará pescado en mayor cantidad, además desea aprovechar en vender en la carretera para lograr vender todo la mercadería.
texts.en:
Olga, a sixty-year-old woman, is responsible and hardworking. She lives with her partner, with whom she had a son who is already grown and independent with his own family. She has her own house where she lives by her partner's side, and next door to her son's home. Olga sells fish in a very busy market in the city. She gets up early to go to the Port of the Public Clock to buy wholesale from the fishermen. She's been doing this work for almost forty years and says that through this job she was able to feed and educate her son. Now she works alone and she keeps doing it because it's the only way to generate income for her home.

What she likes about her job is that she has time in the afternoons to be at home and rest because at her age it's not the same as when she was young. Furthermore she's always been independent and got used to depending on herself. She hopes to be able to support herself and keep working for a long time.

This will be her second loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She likes the group that she belongs to very much because they are very responsible. She's also very grateful to work with the institution since they grant her loans easily and with low interest. With the amount requested she'll buy fish in greater quantity. She also wants to take advantage of selling by the highway in order to sell all the merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: El señor Octavio tiene 3 hijos y es un padre muy responsable con los gastos del hogar el cual también decidió comprar una casa de interés social en el que podría vivir cómodamente en su propio patrimonio. Para Octavio es muy importante darle un techo estable a su familia para que no sufran las inclemencias de tiempo, por tal motivo ha realizado algunas mejoras a la casa para que este acondicionada tal cual son sus necesidades de cada integrante de la familia. En este momento su proyecto es terminar los acabados de la casa por dentro para darle otra vista y pintarla, para eso necesita comprar yeso, pintura y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Octavio has three children and he is a father who is very responsible in covering his household expenses.  He decided to buy a house through a government-subsidized housing scheme so that he could live comfortably in his own property.  For Octavio, it is very important to provide his family with a stable home so that they don't suffer from the inclemency of the weather.  For this reason, he has made some improvements to his house so that it meets the needs of every member of the family.  His current project is to finish making some finishing touches to the inside of his home to make it look better and to paint it.  For this, he needs to buy plaster and paint, and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay labor costs

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
When Diana moved to San Francisco from Mexico, she dreamed of opening her own jewelry shop as a way to earn a living. She was scared to go into business alone, “But then I realized: Times are changing and now women do have the opportunity to run their own businesses. I knew it would be hard but I knew I could do it,” recalls Diana. 

And Diana did not have to go it alone. Propelled by the help of Women’s Initiative (a San Francisco-based training center for women entrepreneurs) and MISBA (a network of small businesses in the Mission neighborhood), she launched a small jewelry and repair shop in San Francisco’s Mission District neighborhood. Diana affectionately named it “Diju,” after a combination of her name and her husband’s name, Juan. Diana’s friends and family gathered together and helped furnish her shop. Together they built countertops and cabinets out of beautiful, dark wood and filled the cabinets with delicate silver and beaded necklaces, rings and earrings. “I feel so grateful to have had so much help and support. I was never alone in this,” she beamed. 

Diju Jewelry gained recognition in the community and business flourished. “I feel so proud to own my own successful business outside of my home country.” By 2010, Diana’s business had grown to the point that she needed to purchase more merchandise. She knew she could increase her profits if she had more merchandise to sell, but she didn’t have the money to purchase the inventory up front—a plight common to many small businesses.

A loan officer from Opportunity Fund was venturing through the Mission, catching up with local shopkeepers and getting to know new local business owners. When she passed through Diju Jewelry, Diana explained her business’s needs and together they came to the conclusion that a microloan would do just the trick.  “Opportunity Fund made everything so easy. Anytime I was confused or had a question, I just asked my loan officer and she helped me so much,” said Diana. 

Diana repaid her first loan in no time and raised her FICO score from 633 to 654! When she applied for a second loan this fall, Opportunity Fund was delighted to continue building a relationship with her and approved her for another loan. With $5,000, Diana will buy a new security system and increase her inventory. 

The future of Diju Jewelry is bright. Diana hopes to attend an artisanal school and expand her expertise about jewelry design and repair. She also feels a strong desire to master her English skills. “If I could improve my English, I could sell much more jewelry… Maybe even to the President some day!” she laughs.

loans.use: to buy a security system.

loans.name: Byron Salomon

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, en una comunidad llamada San Rafael, habita Byron, de 30 años de edad, casado, agricultor, su nivel escolar es básico solo curso hasta sexto grado de primaria. El se dedica a sembrar café. Su padre fue el que le enseño a sembrar, preparar la tierra conforme fue pasando el tiempo, su padre le dio 2 manzanas de tierra para que sembrara , las cuales ha venido trabajando desde hace 4 años , tiene un año que se ha dedicado a sembrar café, pues antes sembraba hortaliza y granos básicos. Además el puso una pequeña pulpería la cual es atendida por su esposa, ambos trabajan y se apoyan mutuamente. 
El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para sembrar café. Con esta inversión podrá sacar adelante su siembra de café orgánico, ayudarse con los costos que este le genera. El desea lograr establecer una manzana más de siembra de café, exportarlo fuera de Nicaragua e invertir en su pulpería para salir adelante y lograr mejorar su hogar.
texts.en: 30-year-old Byron lives in Estelí department, in a community called San Rafael. He is married and works as a farmer. He has a basic level of education as he only studied up to the sixth year of elementary school. Byron grows coffee. It was his father who taught him how to sow and prepare the soil. Over time, his father gave him two manzanas of land (one manzana = 1.68 acres) on which to grow his crops. He has been working this land for four years now. He has been growing coffee for one year as he previously grew vegetables and basic grains. In addition, he has also set up a small grocery store which his wife looks after. They both work and support each other. Byron is requesting this loan to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure, and to pay laborers to sow his coffee. With this investment, he will be able to start sowing his organic coffee and help cover the costs that this generates. Byron would like to be able to sow an additional manzana of coffee which he would like to export outside of Nicaragua. He would also like to invest in his grocery store so that he can get ahead and manage to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure, and to pay laborers to sow his coffee

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 53 años, es una mujer alegre y muy responsable, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes, ella vive en su casa propia a lado de siete personas más, entre sus hijos y nietos. El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de comida, ella sale muy temprano al mercado a hacer las compras de los insumos necesarios para elaborar los deliciosos platos que la caracterizan como la mejor cocinera. Ella vende en la vereda de su casa, lleva recién trabajando cuatro meses con este negocio y le esta yendo regular,asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, quien esta siempre a su lado para apoyarla en lo que necesite. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre hay ventas, por ello es que lo considera rentable, gana casi la mitad de lo que invierte. Por tanto espera crecer a lado de su negocio ya que le gusta mucho cocinar y llegar a tener un restaurante en su casa. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, se siente satisfecha con el grupo que trabaja ya que son muy responsables y los problemas que tienen lo solucionan rápido y entre todos. Por otro lado agradece mucho el apoyo brindado por la institución ya que le es de mucha ayuda para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos para la elaboración de su comida y así pueda tener mayor variedad de platos que ofrecer.
texts.en:
53-year-old Sonia is a cheerful and very responsible woman.  She is a widow and has four children who are grown up and independent.  Sonia lives in her own home along with seven other people (children and grandchildren).  Her business is selling food.  She goes out very early in the morning to the market to buy the supplies that she needs to prepare the delicious dishes that mark her out as a great cook.  She sells her food from the sidewalk outside her home.  She has been working in this business for just four months and it is doing okay.  She has the support of her daughter who is always there to support her with anything she needs.

What Sonia enjoys about her work is that she is always making sales and, for this reason, she considers her work to be profitable.  She earns almost half of what she invests.  For this reason, she would like to grow in her business as she really enjoys cooking and she would like to eventually have a restaurant in her home.

This will be Sonia's sixth loan from MFP.  She is happy with the group in which she works as they are all very responsible and any problems that they  have are quickly resolved by everybody.  She is also very grateful for the support that she has received from the institution as it is very helpful to her in increasing her working capital.  Sonia will use the sum that she has requested to buy ingredients and supplies for making her food.  This will enable her to offer a wider variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing different dishes

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto de 31 años es casado y tiene 1 hijo su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar como lo son lavar, planchar, cocinar, atender a los niños etc., mientras el trabaja como taxista ruletero en la ciudad su trabajo consta de andar de calle en calle buscando pasajeros para trasladarlos al lugar que ellos le indiquen con esta actividad el tiene poco menos del año y es propietario del carro con el cual el trabaja. El y su esposa tienen 7 años viviendo en su domicilio, la casa en la que ellos viven fue una donación por parte del gobierno y cuando estas se las entregaron era solo un pie de casa Roberto ha ido haciéndole mejoras a su casa ya que el sabe que si algún día el llegara a faltar su familia tendrían un techo seguro. Ahora quiere construir un cuarto en la planta baja de su casa para extender la sala comedor y así tener mas espacio para esto quiere comprar material como lo es cemento, arena, varilla y pagar el albañil.
texts.en:
31-year-old Roberto is married and has one child.  His wife takes care of the household chores such as washing, ironing, cooking, looking after the children, etc. while he works as a taxi driver in town.  Roberto's job is to go from street to street looking for passengers.  He then transports them to wherever they want to go.  He has been working in this job for just under a year and he owns the car in which he works.

Roberto and his wife have been living in their home for seven years.  They received their house from the government and when they got it, it was very small and basic.  Roberto has been improving the house as, in this way, he knows that if some day he were to be parted from his family, they would have a safe home in which to live.  He would now like to build a room on the lower floor of his house in order to extend his living room / dining room and thereby have more space.  In order to do this, he would like to buy materials such as cement, sand and metal rods, and pay a builder.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis, un joven de 24 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Estelí, es casado, de oficio agricultor, siembra papas. En inicio sembrando hace 5 años, en la comunidad llamada la Tejera localizada en la afueras de Estelí, en ese entonces el estaba estudiando Ingeniería Agrónoma pero no puedo pues no tenia los recursos económicos para poder finalizar esa carrera, pero el con sus deseos de su superación siguió adelante hasta que logro estudiar contabilidad, trabajo como cobrador y luego paso al área de contabilidad don es auxiliar contable. Hoy en día además de trabajar como auxiliar contable, tiene unas siembras de papas en le Tejera, que por cual esta solicitando el préstamo  quiere sembrar 3 manzanas de papa, el desea que sacar una producción con muy buena rentabilidad y productividad que le permita poder tener ingresos para comprar su propio terreno de siembra, lograr el mismo producir la semilla y no comprarla y ser un productor prospero, capaz de ser auto sostenible y mejorar sus condiciones vida a su familia.
texts.en: Luis is a young man of 24 who is from the city of Estelí. He is married and works as a farmer, growing potatoes. He started growing crops five years ago in a community called La Tejera, which is located on the outskirts of Estelí. Back then, he was studying for a degree in agricultural engineering but he had to stop because he didn't have enough money to finish his course. However, he has a desire to improve himself and so he carried on and later managed to study accountancy. He worked as a collector and then started working in the field of accountancy where he is a junior accountant. Now, in addition to working as a junior accountant, he also grows potatoes in La Tejera. He is requesting this loan because he would like to sow 3 manzanas of land (one manzana = 1.68 acres) with potatoes. He would like his farming to be very profitable and productive and provide him with the income he needs to buy his own plot of farmland, produce his own seed instead of buying it, and become a prosperous farmer who is capable of being self-sustaining and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to sow three manzanas (just over 5 acres) with potatoes

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Ma. Guadalupe es divorciada tiene 2 hijos que  depende económicamente de ella, tiene 15 años trabajando como operadora en una maquiladora de la localidad laborando 10 horas diarias de lunes a viernes para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas de alimentación, vestido y calzado y educación de sus hijos.  La señora María Guadalupe vive en una casa de interés social que adquirió en Noviembre del 2007 desde entonces ella la habita y hasta el día de hoy aun se la siguen descontando vía nomina en su empleo ella requiere se le apoye para comprar protecciones e instalación de las misma en la casa que ella tiene. Para esto necesita pagar al herrero que le hará el trabajo de esta manera ella obtendrá mayor seguridad en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is divorced and she has 2 children who are financially dependent on her. She has been working at a manufacturing plant in the community for 15 years, working 10 hours per day from Monday to Friday. She works to satisfy the basic needs her children, including nutrition, clothing, shoes, and education.

Maria Guadalupe lives in a house provided by social housing that she acquired in November of 2007. She has been living here since then and to date she continues to be charged through payroll deduction from her employment. She needs help in purchasing protective structures and their installation on the house that she has. She needs to hire a welder to do the work. She will obtain a greater degree of security for her house.

loans.use: to purchase protective structures and construction materials

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es: Yessenia, de 23 años, es una mujer joven, alegre y sobre todo entusiasta a la hora de trabajar, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos aún.  Estudia en la universidad, vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y sus dos menores hermanos de 18 y 15 años. Ella junto a sus padres trabajan mucho para poder surgir y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Yessenia consiste en la tapicería de asientos y toldos de vehículos de dos y tres ruedas, tiene un local en su casa y ahí es donde funciona su negocio, lleva realizando este trabajo por un año aproximadamente, asimismo cuenta con la ayuda de su padre ya que la inversión es de ambos. Por otro lado, estudia  en una universidad de la ciudad y desea poder seguir adelante y surgir a lado de su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que como es un negocio familiar puede estar a lado de ellos, además el movimiento es a diario y le hace rotar mucho su dinero. Le esta yendo bien y espera poder mantenerlo por el momento hasta que se consolide y puedan ampliar implementando más equipos. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le va bien trabajando con el grupo, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para poder seguir con su inversión ya que de eso vive y estudia. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para tapicería, entre ellos agujas especiales, hilos, lonas y otros más que se necesita para hacer su trabajo.
texts.en: Yessenia is 23 years old and she is a young and happy woman who is always enthusiastic when it comes to work. She is single and she still does not have children. She is in university and she lives at home with her parents and her two younger siblings, aged 18 and 15. She and her parents work hard to keep moving forward and to have a better quality of life. Yessenia's work consists of upholstering the seats and awnings of two and three-wheeled carts. She has a space allocated in her house from where she manages her business. She has been in business for approximately one year. She is helped by her father, as it was a joint investment. She is also enrolled in the university in the city and she wants to keep moving forward and break forth with her family. Her sales are daily and it results in a frequent rotation of her investment. It is going well for her and she hopes to keep it up until she is able to expand by adding more equipment. This will be her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). It is going well with her group and she is very thankful for the opportunity given her to keep on going with her investment. This is how she is able to live and to go to school. With the funds she requests she will purchase upholstering materials, among them: special needles, threads, awnings, and other materials she needs to do her work.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, and fabrics.

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas las que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Luz tiene 47 años, es casada y su esposo labora fabricando cielos rasos, con el trabajo conyugal han realizado su casa propia.
 
Ella labora conjuntamente con su esposo en la fabricación de cielos rasos hace 22 años, trabajan de lunes a sábados y cuando tienen que entregar alguna obra hasta el domingo, sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio como cabuya, yeso, aluminio y pintura. 

Su  meta es engrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the communal bank Corazon de Maria. She lives in the Parish Del Valle (Cuenca). This is an area that is surrounded by mountains that give us beautiful scenery. The people are dedicated to commerce, livestock farming, and agriculture. Many work in the city in various types of work. They maintain their culture and the traditions of their villages.

Luz is 47 years old and she is married. Her husband works in constructing roofing. Through their combined work they have managed to have a house of their own.

She has been working together with her husband in constructing roofing for the past 22 years. They work from Monday to Saturday, and when they need to deliver a project they work even on Sundays, on an unfixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for the past 5 years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of materials for her business such as rope, plaster, aluminum sheeting, and paint.

Her goal is to expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase rope, plaster, aluminum sheeting, and paint.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora, ella solicito el crédito para cambiar las paredes de su casa ya  que  están construidas de lamina  y  desea hacerlas  de  ladrillos ya  que  la  temporada  de invierno se  acerca y ella se  preocupa   por el  bienestar  de  sus  hijos, quiere  protegerlos  de los  cambios  climáticos y de  las enfermedades que  esto puede  ocacionar, agradece el apoyo brindado  para la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Patricia is a very hardworking person. She requested a loan to renovate the walls of her house. They are currently made of aluminum sheeting and she wants to rebuild them from bricks. The winter season is approaching and she is concerned over the well-being of her children. She wants to protect them from the changes in climate and from illnesses that can result. She is thankful for the support provided in helping her realize her project.

loans.use: to rebuild her house walls with bricks.

loans.name: Claudia Ivonne

texts.es: Claudia es Soltera tiene 20 años y vive con su mamá en una casa de interés social desde hace 7 años, trabaja como operadora en una maquiladora de la ciudad, su mamá se dedica a la venta de tacos preparados en casa de diversas comidas y posteriormente sale a venderlos a los negocios de la localidad; la casa en la que ellas vive es muy pequeña  y Claudia quiere hacerle realidad su sueño a su mamá, el cual consta en ampliar la cocina y para ello requiere el apoyo para comprar material de construcción como cemento, arena y pagar el albañil.
texts.en: Claudia is single, 20 years old, and she has been living with her mother in social housing for the past 7 years. She works as an operator in a manufacturing plant in the city. Her mother sells home-made tacos that she later sells to the different businesses in the locality. The house in which they live is very small and Claudia wants to make her mother's dream a reality. Her project involves extending the kitchen. To accomplish this she needs to purchase construction material such as cement and sand and to hire a contractor.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to extend her kitchen.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Corazón de María, vive por la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas las que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Narcisa tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad  que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como carpintero en su propio taller, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Narcisa trabaja en la atención de una librería, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio tiempo. En su casa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y también a la cría y venta de cuyes.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de cuyes.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the communal bank Corazon de Maria. She lives near the Parish of Del Valle (Cuenca). This area is surrounded by mountains that give us beautiful scenery. The people are dedicated to commerce, livestock farming, and agriculture. Many set out to work in the city in a variety of businesses. They maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

Narcisa is 31 years old and she is married. She has conceived 2 children from her marriage, aged 11 and 9. They are both attending primary school in the city. Her husband works as a carpenter in his own shop. They don't have a house of their own so they live in her parents' house. They share the household expenses.

Narcisa works by managing a bookstore. She has had her business for 2 years and she works from Monday to Friday on a part time basis. At home she takes care of the children and she also raises and sells guinea pigs.

She has been with her communal bank for 2 years and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
L. Señora María es socia del banco comunal Corazón D. María, vive en L. ciudad D. Cuenca, esta ciudad  es D. clima frió, cuenta con una belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar D. sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen L. cultura y tradiciones D. sus pueblos.

L. Señora María tiene 29 años, está separada pero en su unión conyugal ha procreado 2 hijos D. 11 y 8 años D. edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita D. L. ciudad. Vive  con sus padres en una casa arrendada y comparten los gastos del hogar. 

Doña María se dedica a L. venta D. ropa D. bebé, trabaja los días D. feria y lleva en este negocio 11 años. El resto D. su tiempo lo dedica al cuidado D. su padre ya que tiene una discapacidad. 

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero D. su crédito lo va a invertir en L. comprar D. ropa D. bebé para incrementar mas su mercadería.
 
Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Corazon D. Maria. She lives in the city of Cuenca. It is a city of cold climate and it possesses an ecological and cultural beauty. The ample gastronomy captivates the palates of visitors. The community is kind, cordial and charismatic. They retain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Maria is 29 years old and she separated. But from her marriage she bore 2 children, now aged 11 and 8 years old. Her eldest son is in high school and her second daughter is in primary school in the city. She lives with her parent in a house rental and they share the household expenses.

Maria sells baby clothing and she works on market days. She has been in business for 11 years. She spends the remainder of her time taking care of her disabled father.

She is on her second loan, accessed through her communal bank. She was initially invited to join by a friend. She will invest the funds from the loan in the purchase of baby clothing to increase her merchandise. 

Her goal is to buy herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maida Lidia

texts.es: Maida Lidia es casada tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella tiene 2 años viviendo en su domicilio y se dedica a la venta de artículos de segunda mano como lo son ropa, calzado, juguetes y accesorios para dama. Su esposo cuenta con un pequeño negocio dedicado a la venta de accesorios para automóvil e instalación de estéreos y bocinas para carros. Maida es una persona muy emprendedora y es por ello que desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de segunda mano para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita el apoyo para compra de ropa de invierno como lo son pantalanes, chaquetas, sudaderas y tenis para así poder vender mas y su ingreso familiar aumente.
texts.en: Maida Lidia is married and she has 2 children who still depend on her financially. She has been living her house for the past 2 years and she sells second hand goods, such as clothing, shoes, toys, and ladies' accessories. Her husband has a small business selling automotive accessories and the also installs stereos and speakers in cars. Maida is a very enterprising woman who has been selling second hand goods for the past 8 years to help her husband with the household expenses. She requests support to purchase winter clothing such as pants, jackets, sweaters, and sneakers to increase her sales and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Jose  Mauro

texts.es: El Sr. José es un hombre muy emprendedor pues comenta que hace ya diez años empezó vendiendo los juguetes de sus hijos ya  que no los  utilizaban  por  que  con el paso del tiempo  fueron creciendo , gracias  a  esto el  se  dio cuenta  que  este  negocio  le  generaba  ingresos que le permitían sacar  adelante a  su  familia, es por  ello  que  necesita  de nuestro apoyo para   realizar  la compra  de mercancía  además  que   desea   iniciar la  venta  de  ropa  usada, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Jose is a very enterprising man. He tells us that it was ten years ago that he started out selling his kids' toys that they were no longer using because they were growing up. He realized that this business generated an income, enough to be able to support his family. But he now needs our help to purchase more merchandise. He wants to start selling used clothing. He is thankful for the support in helping him realize his project.

loans.use: to purchase toys and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Benvenida

texts.en:
Benvenida is a widow with six children. Her husband died three years ago. Benvenida strives hard to meet the family's daily needs. She presently lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She has an agricultural business, operating and managing her corn farm. She has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,460. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Benvenida joined GDMPC in 2010. She is now on her second loan cycle. In the future, Benvenida wants to purchase a motorcycle to be used in the village for "habal-habal" transportation to earn another income for the family. Now that her husband has passed away, she is both father and mother to her six children.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertilizer

loans.name: Chansan

texts.en: Chansan, 30 years old, sells groceries, earning $7 per day. Her husband is a farmer who sells palm products, earning $2 per day. The couple has three children: two are studying and one is only 3 years old. Each month, Chansan spends $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a plot of land for farming. The loan will help her family have more land to farm to get more rice to sell and support the family.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 29 years old, is a worker, earning $1.60 per day. She has two children: one works, earning $2 per day and one stays home. Each month, Channy spends $40 on food and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $300 to pay for the electricity service in her house. This loan will help her family to have electricity to use at home. When she can save enough money, Channy wants to repair her house.

loans.use: To pay for electricity

loans.name: 03.08.98 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Duyên has worked in agriculture, farming food, for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Duyên faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Duyên  is 50 years old and married, with 4 children. She  is the group leader of the 98 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Duyên lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Duyên's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Duyên  hopes to build a new house, have her business do well and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Yarn

texts.en: Yarn, 38 years old, is a farmer and animal feeder, earning $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning $5 per day. The couple has three children, all studying. Each month, Yarn spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She wants to feed animals to sell when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 36 years old, provides a motor taxi service, earning $10 per day. His wife is a farmer, earning $1 per day. The couple has three children: two are studying and one is a garment factory worker, earning $4 per day. Each month, Touch spends $25 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on rent, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Touch would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a new motorbike because his current one is old and needs a lot of repairs. He wants to buy a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) to provide service so that he can make more income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy, 32 years old, is a garment factory worker, earning $3.30 per day. Her husband provides electric services and earns $13 per day. The couple has two children: one is studying and one is too small to go to school. Each month, Rithy spends $83 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $40 on transportation and $50 on other expenses.

Rithy would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy electric equipment for her husband’s career. She wants to send all of her children to study in university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy electric equipment

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan, 29 years old, sells food and electronic products, earning $10 per day. Her husband repairs electronics, earning $3.30 per day. The couple has one child, 7 years old and in school. Each month, Nhan spends $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses.

Nhan would like to request a loan of $800 to buy electronic products to resell. She wants to extend her business to sell more electronic products because this business can bring in a good income and is less tiring than selling food.

loans.use: To buy electronic products to sell

loans.name: Alter

texts.en:
Alter, 46 years old, is married and has two children. He lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City. Alter provides motor transport services in his village, earning a monthly income of PHP 22,800. Alter has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase motorcycle repair materials.

Alter became a member of GDMPC this year. His plan for his and his family's future is to acquire another vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle repair materials

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 46 years old, is a farmer, earning $1 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairer, earning $5 per day. The couple has 3 children, all of whom work in a garment factory, each earning $2 per day. Each month, Than spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on rent, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Than would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy motorbike repair materials for her husband's career. The loan will help her husband to run his business well and to provide better service to his customers. Than's husband wants to extend his career when he can save enough money and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy motorbike repair materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia tiene 47años D. edad, está casada con el señor Andrés quien tiene 54 años, ambos oriundos D. la ciudad D. Tobatí, tienen 3 hijos, la edad D. ellos son  25, 19 y 10.  
Julia se dedica a la venta D.  Bebidas D. todo tipo, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros, tiene su local D. ventas en su domicilio y al costado una cancha D. voleibol. Ella es muy conocida en el barrio por su buena atención y cordialidad. Comenta que su local le genera muy buenos ingresos, en especial los fines D. semana que es cuando mas clientes tiene, por ello desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. bebidas, como ser cervezas, whiskys y demás para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 47 years old and married to Sr. Andrés, age 54. Both of them are natives of the city of Tobatí. They have three children (ages 25, 19, and 10).

Julia sells beverages of all types such as beer, sodas, wines, and other products. She has a store in her home, which is next to a volleyball court. Julia is well-known in her neighborhood for providing good service and her friendliness. She says that her store generates a good income, especially on the weekends when most of her customers visit. For this reason, she wants to continue investing her business.

The loan she requested will be used to buy beverages such as beer, whiskey, and other products so that she can restock her business and satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy beer, whiskey, wine, and other beverages.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem, 43 years old, sells vegetables, earning $8 per day. Her husband plants vegetables, earning $1 per day. The couple has five children: four are in school and one works in the garment factory, earning $3 per day. Each month, Rem spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Rem would like to request a loan of $700 to buy vegetables to sell. She wants to expand her vegetable store to sell more kinds of vegetables when she has enough money. Rem wants to support her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sinak

texts.en:
Sinak, 33 years old, buys and sells recycled items, earning $8 per day. Her two sisters live with her; they work in the factory, each earning $3 per day. Each month, Sinak spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Sinak would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy recycled items to resell. The loan will help her to have enough money to expand her new career. Sinak wants to have a stock that can keep all of the recycled items to sell.

loans.use: To buy recycled items to resell

loans.name: Ourk

texts.en:
Ourk, 48 years old, sells fish with her husband, each earning $5 per day. They have two children, both of whom work in the garment factory, each earning $3 per day. Every month, Ourk spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rental fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Ourk would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fish to sell. She wants to expand her career when she can earn a better income and be able to save enough money.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Khmeb

texts.en: Khmeb is 44 years old and provides a motor taxi service, earning $5 per day. His wife sells groceries at home and earns $2 per day. They have 3 children: two are studying and one works earning $3 per day. Every month, he has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a musical instrument for his son to join some relatives in providing a music service. The loan will help his son to have a real career and to support himself and his family in the future.

loans.use: To buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Sokros

texts.en: Sokros is 28 years old and has an embellishing shop where she earns $3 per day. Her husband is a worker earning $3 per day. They have two children: two years old and two months old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 electricity, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She wants to expand her embellishing shop and provide more services but she needs a long time to save the money to achieve her plan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 41 years old, is a construction worker with her husband. They each earn $3 per day. They have four children: two work earning $3 per day and the other two are still young. Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike to transport grass to sell to earn additional income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport grass to sell.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 49 years old, is a farmer with her husband and earns $3 per day. They have two children; both are working and they each earn $3 per day. Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work and for other uses in the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Sern

texts.en: Sern, 60 years old, is a village leader and a farmer earning $1 per day. His wife stays home. They have two children who both work earning $9 per day in total. Every month he has to spend $25 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for his children to travel to work. Most of the family expenses are paid for by his children. He wants his daughter to sell groceries at home so that she does not need to travel far from home to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to travel to work

loans.name: Dionisio Ramon

texts.es:
Dionisio tiene 51 años de edad, está casado con Lina de 53 años, viven en su casa propia. El es mecánico de motos hace más de treinta años y su señora es encargada de limpieza en una universidad, quien también aporta en los gastos del hogar, tienen dos hijos todos mayores de edad y profesionales independientes.
Dionisio es uno de los pioneros en la ciudad en el rubro de mecánica para motos, lo aprendió lo hizo en la capital en donde estuvo trabajando por cinco años y después habilitó para su propio taller, en donde trabaja con el su hermano.
Actualmente trabajan también con él un sobrino y un primo a quienes les enseña la profesión, cabe destacar que la mayoría de los mecánicos de moto de la ciudad  han pasado por su taller. Dionisio tiene clientela formada por la responsabilidad y la calidad de los trabajo que realiza. 
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una moto, lo cual lo ayudará a la hora de visitar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisio, 51, is married to Lina, 53; they live in their own house.  He’s been a motorcycle mechanic for over thirty years and his wife works in the cleaning crew of a university and also contributes to household expenses.  They have two adult children who are independent professionals.

Dionisio is one of his city’s pioneer motorcycle mechanics.  He learned this skill in the capital where he worked for five years and then set up his own repair shop where he works with his brother.  Currently a nephew and a cousin also work with him; he’s teaching them the profession.  

It’s worth pointing out that most of the city’s motorcycle mechanics have passed through his shop at one time or another.  Dionisio has a well-established clientele which has formed thanks to the responsibility and quality of the work he does.  He needs the loan to buy a motorcycle that will be of use to him when he has to go visit customers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim, 31 years old, is a tailor who earns $10 per day. She is a single mother with two children, 15 and 12 years old. Both are studying. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a new sewing machine for her business. She plans to expand her tailoring business and hire two or three tailors to work in her shop but she will need a long time to reach her goal because now she doesn’t have enough money.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old.  Nora sells fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately PHP 700 a day from these activities.

Nora is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to purchase different kinds of fish such as milk fish and tilapia to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: 03.08.99 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyến, age 32, runs a food stall business, selling meat. She is the group leader of the 99 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in the  Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She and her husband have two children. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years. Her primary business challenge is lack of sufficient capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase meat to offer for sale. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With the profits she expects from her loan, Mrs. Luyến hopes to make enough money to remodel her house, to cause her business to flourish, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat to offer for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 51 years old and married. She has four children. To generate an income, she sells fruits and vegetables. She buys at the public market and then sells to the people in her village. She offers the produce house-to-house because she doesn't have a stall in the market.
