Monica is now asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy tomatoes, cabbages and eggplant to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and boost her profits. In the future, she wants to keep making better sales for the improvement of their lives.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Somenea

texts.en:
Somenea, age 27, is a weaver. She earns $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns $3 per day. They have one child, five years old. Every month, she needs to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to pay for administration fees to work in Thailand. She wants to start a business raising animals at home so that she can earn additional income to help support the family.

loans.use: To pay for administration fees to work in Thailand so that she can start a new business

loans.name: 03.12.97 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen, age 40, works in agriculture, planting trees. She and her husband have three children. She is the group leader of the 97 Thiệu D.  solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in her business for six years. She cites her primary business hardship as lack of sufficient capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase landscaped tree seedlings to raise and sell. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, she hopes to remodel her house, to maintain a successful business, and to help her children find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase landscaped tree seedlings to raise and sell

loans.name: Toeun

texts.en: Toeun is a 65-year-old farmer. With her husband, they earn $4 per day. They have two children, one is studying and one is a construction worker who earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food and $20 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a hand tractor to transport firewood to sell. This loan will help her family to have a hand tractor that they can use for farming, to rent to the villagers, and to transport firewood to sell.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor to transport firewood to sell

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Sokhim, 34 years old, is a food seller, and she earns $5 per day. Her husband buys and sells recycled things and earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is only three years old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $18 on electricity, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $900 to buy karaoke material to start a business. She wants to extend her business and buy more karaoke material when she makes a good income from it.

loans.use: To buy karaoke material for her new business

loans.name: 03.07.101 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Minh  operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell. Minh is 56 years old, and she is married with three children. Minh  is the group leader of the 101 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich, aged 41 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a fisherman who earns $4.86 per day. The couple have four children; two are studying, and two are working, each earning $4 per day. Every month, Pich has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, and $22 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a plot of land to enlarge her house. She wants to take out a new loan to repair her house after finishing this loan.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to enlarge her house

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
Jro Nyoman lives in Melaya, West Bali. Though Jro Nyoman often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Jro Nyoman is the head of the Sari Kencana group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s fourth loan with MUK.  With the Rp.1,000,000 that Jro Nyoman receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

In the photograph, Jro Nyoman holds the orange book.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: 03.07.100 Thiệu Long Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chương Lê works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

Chương  is 60 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the group leader of the 100 Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. She lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She does not have any dependents.

This is Chương's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. With her business profit, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike and land of her own. She also hopes for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Yer

texts.en: Yer, aged 48 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. She is a single mother with two children; one is studying, and one is working in the garment factory also earning $3 per day. Every month, Yer has to spend $60 on food and $11 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy dirt as fill for her house to prevent it from flooding. The loan will help her family to avoid flooding.

loans.use: To buy dirt as fill for her house to prevent it from flooding

loans.name: Ner

texts.en:
Ner, age 55, is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $3 per day. They have three children: one is studying and other two are working in a factory, each earning $3 per day. Every month, Ner has to spend $70 on food and $12 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $700 in order to buy a motorbike for her son to use for traveling to and from work, as well as to provide transportation for the family. She also wants to buy a stock of rice to sell when a good price is available.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to use for traveling to and from work, as well as to provide transportation for the family

loans.name: 03.12.102.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. Hiền is 29 years old and she is married with one child. Hiền is the group leader of the 102.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of five members.  She lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiền  has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to buy land of her own, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make Pempek (Indonesian snack food) to sell

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 39 años, está casado, tiene dos hijos, los cuales aun son pequeños y dependen de el y de su señora, vive en casa propia con su esposa Epifania. Es carpintero, comenta que aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó por más de 10 años.
Tiene su propia carpintería sobre una ruta muy transitada, camino a Quiindy desde hace mas de 5 años. Decidió dedicarse al rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia en el ámbito y a esta le acompaña la necesidad de dar ingreso a su familia. Es un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable. Los vecinos le tienen un aprecio por los valores mencionados.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de maderas, tablas y otros para seguir activando su carpinteria.
texts.en:
Esteban, 39, is married and has two children who are still little and depend on him and his wife.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Epifania.  He’s a carpenter.  He comments that he learned the occupation form his father who he worked with for over ten years.

He has had his own carpentry shop located on a very busy route, the road to Quiindy, for over five years.  He decided to go into this line of work because he had experience in the area and he needed to provide family income.  He’s a hardworking, honest and responsible man.  His neighbors hold him in high regard because of the aforementioned values.  He needs the loan to buy wood, lumber and others to continue stocking his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy wood and lumber.

loans.name: 03.3.04 Quảng Hưng Tp Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gấm, age 33, has a food stall business, selling candy and cake. She is the group leader of the 4 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoá city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She and her husband have two children. She has been engaged in her business for five years. Her primary business challenge is lack of sufficient capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy and cake to offer for sale. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
 
With her business profits, Mrs. Gấm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and eventually to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase candy and cake to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San is 51-years old and the loving mother of seven children. She was married but her husband passed away many years ago. Therefore, she is diligent and patient, raising her children alone in Siem Reap province. Nowadays she owns a grocery store selling rice, meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) and drinks. She has been involved in this business since 2008. From this business, she typically yields a profit of $6 US per day for financial solvency. 

Two of her children also help support the family by working in different jobs and places. Her daughter is a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh and her son is a motor-taxi driver in the community. Recently her son’s business is not going well because his old motorcycle often breaks down. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. San is seeking a loan of $1,100 from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy a new motorcycle for her son. This is her second loan with Kiva and, with the previous loan, Mrs. Son repaid punctually and has paid off already. In the future, Mrs. Son wants to send her small children to join a class in a local school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to support her son's business.

loans.name: 02.02.07 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiệp works in agriculture- farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sales.

Hiệp is 61 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a seven member group, the 07 Đông Hải solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiệp has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiệp has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hiệp faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 27, is a humble villager in Siem Reap province. She has lived there since she was with her parents. She is a local farmer cultivating vegetable crops. She is married and has three children, all of them are single and living together with her and her husband. 

Through her farming business, Mao is able to earn an average of US$2 each day.  She is concerned that her low income cannot covers all the household expenses. She said that she needs her own farmland for growing rice crops. If she can grow rice herself, the whole family will not need to buy rice from the local market for daily food. 

Thus,  Mao has requested some funds from HKL and Kiva in the sum of $1,100 to buy farmland to grow rice. She hopes that this loan will help her family increase their income and get a comfortable living. For the future, she will send and support her three children to finish high school at minimum.

loans.use: buy farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Edgar Alfredo

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 30 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres ya que es hijo único. Tiene un  taller en el que se dedica a la chapería y pintura hace mas de seis años en el barrio San Jose, cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para realizar la reparación de los autos.
Cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes ya que se le califica como un buen chapista de la zona, porque es responsable a la hora de recibir el trabajo y así como a la hora de entregar los vehículos terminados.
Él empezó como ayudante con su padre el taller del mismo, luego de varios años habilitó su propio taller para independizarse y poder crecer como profesional como lo es ahora. El solicita el préstamo para la compra de pinturas debido a que tiene mucho trabajo y necesita de insumos para llevarlos a cabo. Agradece a la Fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
Edgar, 30, is married and has a son.  He lives in his parents’ house since he’s an only son.  He has had an auto body and paint shop for over six years in the San José neighborhood.  He has the necessary tools to repair cars.

He has a good number of customers because he’s known for being a good car body repairman in the zone; he’s responsible when he takes on a job as well as when he delivers finished repaired vehicles.

He started out as a helper in his father’s shop.  After several years he set up his own shop to become independent and be able to grow as a professional as he’s now done.  

He’s asking for the loan to buy paint because he has a lot of work and needs supplies to get it done.  He thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they give him.

loans.use: to buy paint to use in his auto shop.

loans.name: Sittinona

texts.en:
This is Sittinona, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Angeles, a Jeepney (small bus) operator, and mother to their three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sittinona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sittinona hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Pedro Jr.

texts.en:
Pedro is 47 years old and is married. He has had a business selling hogs for 2 years. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional feed for the hogs intended for sale.

Pedro has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for hogs intended for sale

loans.name: Florentina Esmilce

texts.es:
La Señora Florentina está casada, tiene 2 hijos, ella es de profesión modista. Vive en su propia casa. Es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ella nos comenta que gracias a los créditos recibidos de la institución  ha podido ir creciendo en su  Micro Empresa.
Comenta que trabaja arduamente para darle un mejor porvenir a sus hijos y familiares, ya que desea darles un mejor estilo de vida, sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que atravesar. Dice que tiene muchos trabajos pendientes y que le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos, es por eso que solicita una vez más un crédito a la Fundación para la compra de telas, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Florentina is married and has two children; she’s a dressmaker by profession.  She lives in her own house.  She’s a recurrent Fundación Paraguaya client.  She tells us that thanks to the loans she’s gotten from the institution she’s been able to grow in her micro business.

She comments that she works hard to provide a better future for her children and family since she wants to give them a better life style without the privations she had to go through.  She says that she has quite a few pending jobs and she’d like to be able to fulfill them and this is why she’s asking the Fundación for a loan to buy fabric that will make it possible for her to fill her pending customer orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing shop.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (in the photo) is 36 years old. She and her husband, Sroeun, who is 35 years old, live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. Two are in school, and the third is still young.

Sopheap is a garment worker, while her husband is a mason and a fisherman. Sopheap is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to get to work. The one they have now is old and breaks down very often.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Benita Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Benita tiene 34 años de edad, está casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Carlos y viven en su propia casa que está situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Benita es modista, tiene su propio taller en su domicilio y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, tiene varios clientes de la zona para quienes realiza trabajos de costura de todo tipo. Su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería por lo tanto también aporta al hogar. Gracias a que ambos son personas trabajadoras ellos pueden mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y cubrir todos los gastos que requiere la casa.
La señora ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de insumos para su taller como ser telas, hilos, agujas y demás, los cuales son insumos necesarios para el taller de costura.
texts.en:
Benita, 34, has been married to Carlos for a long time; they live in their own house located in the city of Encarnación.

Benita is a dressmaker; she has her own home-based sewing shop and has been in this occupation for many years.  She has various customers in the area that she does all kinds of sewing jobs for.  Her husband works as a bricklayer so he also contributes to household expenses.  Thanks to their both being working people they are able to support their home, educate their children and cover necessary household expenses.

She has requested the loan to buy supplies for her shop like fabric, thread, needles and others which are the necessary supplies in a sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 27 years old. She is married with 1 child.
She has a store that sells fish and dried fish products. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional products to sell.
Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Manju

texts.en: Manju is 35 years-old. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 11. In 2004, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Manju plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margans. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
This is Arminda, 56. She is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is now a widow with two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arminda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arminda hopes to have another store in their community and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Enomie

texts.en:
Enomie is 50 years old. She is a widow with four children.
 
Enomie has a shop that sells vegetables, onions, garlic and other spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional vegetables and spices. 

Enomie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Enomie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to be sold wholesale and retail.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old. She is married with one child.

Imelda  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Imelda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks and other items for the store.

loans.name: Mirta Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirta tiene 25 años de edad, esta acompañada con el Sr. Ruben de 31 años de edad, ellos tienen 1 hija, llamada Elvira de 2 años de edad.
Doña Mirta posee junto con su marido una carpintería en su domicilio, realizan cajones para exportación, se dedica a este rubro hace 5 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2005; comenzó con un capital que obtuvo con la ayuda de sus familiares, ya que en su familia todos se dedican a este rubro. Ella comenta que siempre tiene muchos trabajos con que cumpllir, por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima, como ser maderas, rollos y así satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Ms. Mirta is 25 years old and is the partner of Mr. Ruben, 31 years old.  They have 1 daughter, Elvira who is 2 years old.  Ms. Mirta owns, along with her husband, a home carpentry business.  They make boxes for export and have been in this field for 5 years, approximately from 2005.  It started with capital obtained with the help of their families, as her family is engaged in this field.  She says that she always has many jobs which they fulfill and, therefore sought credit for the purchase of raw materials, such as wood, rolls and thus able to meet the orders of their clients.

loans.use: To purchase wood and rolls.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 31 years old. She is married with four children. Evelyn has a stall where she displays her Balot (fertilized duck embryos boiled and eaten in the shell) and penoys (unfertilized boiled duck eggs) to sell. Research states that boiled duck eggs serve as a natural food supplement since they are rich in protein and other food minerals. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional eggs to process and sell. Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional duck eggs as a natural food supplement to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 54 years old. She is married with three children. 

Vicenta raises hogs which she then sells. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional feeds for the hogs. 

Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for the hogs, which are intended for selling.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim is 26 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is the leader of this group, which consists of four members.  Lim, Sin and Uch are fishery workers in the same work place, and (the other) Sin is a seller of mixed products. In order to ask for some funds from Kiva, they have joined together for a group loan, with different purposes in using this fund.
 
Lim is a previous client of HKL and Kiva and is an active borrower who made her repayments. Lim has two children who depend on her income and care. From her business, she usually earns around US$3 each day to apply toward the family’s needs. However, the main income is from her husband,  who works for a company and offers motor-taxi services in his free time. 

Lim has noticed that her husband’s motorcycle is too old and often breaks down, so it will not be comfortable for his customers. Therefore, she decided to ask for some funds from Kiva to add to her saved money in order to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband. In the future, she wishes to expand her existing business and make a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 28 years old. She is married with three children.

Argie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Argie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,  Argie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional snacks and basic goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old. She is married. 

Cresencia raises hogs and sells them. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP)  to buy additional feeds for the hogs. 

Cresencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cresencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for hogs that are intended for selling.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years of age, married and has seven children. With the large household size, the couple has been doing their best to sustain the needs of their family. 

Elvie has been running her hog raising business for two years, and her husband is in charge in tending their rice fields. Aside from her hog raising business, she is also involved in buying and selling vegetables. She has been selling her vegetables on a house-to-house basis.

Elvie would like to ask for additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to be used in buying feeds and vitamins for her pigs, and vegetables for her vending activity.  She hopes that she can get the loan amount she requested to increase her sales and have greater income. Through providing the vitamins and feeds to her piglets, she will be able to offer them at a higher price. In this way, she can support her children in their studies and improve their standard way of living.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins & vegetables to resell

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 11. In 2001, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buys raw materials for her business. In the future, Nura plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 51-year-old married woman with three children two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past two years, she and her husband have run a food stall to cover all the family living expenses. They sell beef noodles to people in their community. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and better quality food to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and better quality food to serve

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Made and the other members of the Putri Sari group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize their income. Ni Made hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Made will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as breeding.  With her profits, she will help support her family by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer.  Ultimately, Ni Made hopes that the increased income will enable her to save for the family's future.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 34-year-old married woman with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a cigarette factory. 

Thuy supports her family by running a food stall in front of her house. She started this business a year ago and sells pork noodles to her clients. She would like to get a loan to repair her stall and buy some new furniture, bowls and chopsticks and better quality meat to make noodle soup.

She hopes that will increase her income and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her food stall, and buy new furniture and better quality meat

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old. She is married with one child.

Rosemarie has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Crescencio Jr.

texts.en:
Crescencio is 27 years old. He is married. 

Crescencio has a motorcycle unit that serves as a public transport vehicle in their village. He uses it to transport the people in his village. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy motorcycle parts for the proper maintenance of the motorcycle unit.
 
Crescencio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Crescencio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en:
Quoc is 37 and married with a son. He lives with his family in Ho Minh City. His wife earns money by cooking meals for people in their community. 

For the past nine years, Quoc has supported his family by selling candies to many small general stores near his home. This gives him a regular income to cover his family's expenses and his child's education fees. 

He would like to get a loan to buy a greater quantity and quality of candies from wholesalers to sell. He hopes that this will enable him to attract and serve more customers.

Quoc hopes that he will increase his income and help improve him family's living conditions through the loan.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and better quality of candies to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 51 years old. She is married with one child.

Carmelita has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making longganisa

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
Chanh is a 54-year-old married man. He lives with two children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For 16 years, he and his wife have operated a food stall to sell food, beverages and fruit juice for peopL. in their community.

Chanh would like a loan to purchase many kinds of fruits to make different juices and a greater range of cakes to sell. He hopes this will enabL. him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers.

He also hopes that through his loan he will be abL. to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To buy fruit and cakes to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 26 years old. She is married with two children. Lorena has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.

Lan has run a general store in front of her house for 20 years. She sells instant food, basic groceries and personal items for people in her community.

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more beverages, confectionery, and shampoo. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages, confectionery, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 43 years old. She is married with four children. 

Julieta has a shop where she sells vegetables and spices like onions and garlic. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy additional vegetables and spices as additional stocks for the store. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 58 years old, is widowed and has two daughters. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City.

She supports her family with the income that she earns from her general store in front of her door. She intends to use her loan to buy more kinds of products such as green tea, sugar, milk and spices to sell for her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell such as green tea, sugar, milk and spices.

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jonabel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jonabel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jonabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old. She is married with one child.

Lolita has a mini pharmacy that sells medicines and other food supplements like vitamins. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to develop the pharmacy and buy additional stocks of medicines and other food supplements to sell.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To develop and purchase addtional medicines to sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Oliva, 63, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Fidel, a vendor. She is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Oliva operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells Balut (Duck egg) and fish balls for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Oliva hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plaintains, carrots, onions. tomatoes, squash, cabbage, and bananas in wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flowers & materials for decorations

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang is 53 years old and married. She has two sons and one daughter and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. Lang earns money by selling women's clothes in a small market. She started this business fifteen years ago.

Lang requires a loan to purchase many kinds of clothes in bulk to sell for the special cultural occasions that occur in Vietnam at the end of the year. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enable her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of clothes in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяне 39 лет, вдова и воспитывает троих детей.  В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2003 году Татьяна начала свой бизнес в животноводстве.  Начав основание своего хозяйства с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день оно насчитывает 4 головы коров, 4 телки и 2 нетели и приносит Татьяне около 15,000 сом ежемесячно от продажи молочных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Татьяна обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на ремонт дома и на увеличение поголовья в будущем.
texts.en: Tatyana is 39 years old, a widow and has three children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Tatyana started her animal husbandry in 2003.  Having started her business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS), her business now contains four heads of cows, four heifers and two calves and yields Tatyana about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Tatyana requested a loan in the sum of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to purchase bulls.  She plans to use the profits from this loan to make repairs to her house and to increase livestock quantity in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
This is Felicidad, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a photographer, and is mother to their four children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Felicidad operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells cooked viand (food) for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Felicidad hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is 45 years old and is married. He has three children (one son and two daughters) and lives with them and his wife in Ho Chi M. City.

He and his wife earn an income by running a general store at their house. Chau intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery from his store.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 32 years old. He is married.

Nelson is engaged in raising hogs, which he sells. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional feed for his hogs, which he intends to sell.

Nelson has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nelson hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for the hogs

loans.name: Janita

texts.en: Janita is 56 years old. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages; she has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Janita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina  is  28 years old. She is married with five children. She has a stall that display her Ready to wear items like jeans, shirts, and more for both sex. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy additional items to sell like shoes, slippers,and blouses. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business which eventually could help the family needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear items like jeans and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 33 years old and has a fish selling business in Talibon, Bohol. This business has been running for two years. She has three children; the oldest is eight years old. She works hard to sustain her children's education and save for their future.

Ma. Lourdes has requested this loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Ma. Lourdes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam lives in Ho Chi Minh City where he lives with his wife and two children. Tam has a small shop in front of his house to sell tools and equipment for fishing. He started this business over five years ago. 

Tam intends to expand his business by taking a loan to buy a greater range of fishing equipment to meet his customers' needs. With this additional investment, he hopes that he will be abL. to generate a greater income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of fishing equipment to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Mỹ Lệ's Group

texts.en:
Mỹ Lệ is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  Mỹ Lệ is the group leader of a four member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông nhóm 03.


Mỹ Lệ is married and has one infant. To making a living, Mỹ Lệ owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Mỹ Lệ has been engaged in this business for over five years, and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Mỹ Lệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mỹ Lệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5152000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6944000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mỹ Lệ from SEDA.  Mỹ Lệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ninh is a 38-year-old male who is requesting a 5152000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock and buying food for pigs.


2.  Chi is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 6944000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock pigs and chickens.


3.  Chắt is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 6944000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business production of tables and chairs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Macilinda

texts.en: Macilinda is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. Macilinda has been selling fish for 10 years. Macilinda sells fresh and dried fish to her community. She earns about 4000 PHP per month with her business. Macilinda plans to use her loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 51 years old and married. She has a stall that sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell. Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 46 years old and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She is married with two children. Her husband is a worker in a paper production factory.

To earn a living, Lien has a general store selling basic household products, cakes, candies, beverages, spices, and instant food. She has a requested a loan to increase the range and quantity of these goods to stock her store.

Lien hopes that the loan will help her to increase the turnover of her store and enable her to set aside savings for her children's education as well as for her family expenses.

loans.use: To buy more products (cakes, candies, and beverages) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en: Roman is 57 years old. He is married with five children. Roman has a shop that sells canned goods, other food items, and cooking necessities. He has had this business for 21 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other cooking necessities.  Roman has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roman hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodity goods like canned goods,cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other cooking necessities.

loans.name: Monfory

texts.es: Manfory, tiene la edad de 26 años, está en unión libre y vive con su esposo y 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende comprar con el crédito los insumos para la asistencia de la siembra de maíz y frijol. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo, por lo cual ella realizo la siembra para generar ganancias de este terreno. Ella tiene como meta aumentar la producción de cosecha con esta asistencia y así aumentar las ganancias para su bienestar familiar y poder darle a su esposo la ayuda extra para salir adelante con las responsabilidades del hogar. También piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y quiere poder darles a sus hijos el estudio en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
26-year old Manfory lives with her husband and two children, the most important people in her life. 

With the money from the loan she plans to buy supplies to help with her maize and bean crops. She has good land which she uses to grow crops and earn money. Manfory’s goal is to increase production so the extra money she earns can be used to support her family and help her husband pay the household expenses.

She is also thinking about her children’s future and wants to be able to provide them with a good education. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she has not had any other loans from state banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is offering her good credit facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to grow maize and beans

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a farmer who raises his family in a village. At his age of 46, he has three school-aged children who are now in secondary and tertiary level. Sometimes, he and his wife have difficulty providing some of their family's needs due to the high cost of school fees and transportation. But through the help of their parents, they are able to provide for their needs.  

Alfredo aims to improve his rice farming business and increase the yields and income to support the education of his children and satisfy their basic needs.  He is requesting for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farming business.  He and his wife mentioned that this loan will help them make an improvement in their business to achieve their goals. They are hoping that someday they will become financially stable and give their children a bright future.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 21 год. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями и сестрами. Он занимается торговлей музыкальных дисков. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения DVD дисков и DVD.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 21 years old, single and lives together with his parents and sisters.  He is involved in selling music disks.  Ismoil has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of DVD disks.

loans.use: to purchase DVD disks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 51 years old and married. She has a stall to bake and sell snacks like rice cakes in her village. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional improvised oven for baking and ingredients to make rice cakes. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients of bebengka or rice cakes, and additional improvised oven for more orders.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school.  She has been selling fruit for the last three years to make a living.   She describes her business as busy and profitable since her customers are passersby and people living in that area. Mary has employed two people to help her manage the business.  In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. 

Mary is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruit for resale.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai is a 37-year-old married man with a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past five years, Khai has been supporting his family by making iron doors. He also has been running a small general store to supplement his income. Now he plans to take a loan to buy a greater range and quantity of common products such as foods and beverage to increase the stock of his store. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to offer a greater range of products to attract new customers and better meet the needs of existing customers. He hopes that this will enable him to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses. In the future he hopes to save more money to improve his family's living conditions and reinvest in his current business.

loans.use: to buy a greater range of basic goods such as food and beverages to stock his general store.

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a coppersmith.

Do earns a living by sewing clothes at her house. She has worked in this profession for over six years. Do would like to take a loan to buy a new sewing machine, which will help her to produce a larger quantity and better quality of clothes. 

Do hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase her income. She hopes that this will enable her to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy hair chemicals and seats

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband lives with her and supports the family by woking as a bricklayer.

Thuy runs a general store to earn a living. She sells spices, candy, cigarettes, lighters, shampoo and toothpaste. She has done this for three years. 

Thuy is asking for a loan to buy a greater range of food and general goods to stock her store and better meet the needs of her customers. She hopes the loan will help her to increase her income and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of food and general goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old. She is married with two children aged 15 and 3. In 1998, she established her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. 

Rita has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy supplies for her business. In the future, Rita plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  

She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailoring stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional fabric and sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is married and blessed with one child. He runs a retail shop to make a living.  He has been in the business for one year.  He is also employed. He has employed one person to help him run the business. Andrew has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, salt and cooking fat for resale.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt and cooking fat

loans.name: Khenh

texts.en:
Khenh is 48 years old and married with four children. Khenh and her husband run a general store, as they have for the last five years. 

Khenh plans to use the loan to stock her store with a greater range and quantity of products (in particular food and basic household goods) in preparation for the increased demand that occurs at the end of the year.

Khenh hopes that through this loan her income will increase and help her to improve her family's living conditions and send all her children to school.

loans.use: to stock her general store with a greater range and quantity of products.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An lives with her children, two sons and one daughter, in Ho Chi Minh city. She and her husband have a small shop where they make candles to sell to retailers in small markets and shops. She started this business seven years ago. 

An would like to borrow some money to buy materials to increase her production of candles. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to expand her business, increase its turnover and generate a higher income. She hopes that this will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to increase her production of candles.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a businessman who operates a retail shop.  He has been in the business for six years and has employed two people.  He also supplies eggs to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.

Samuel hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future so that he can become financially stable.  He has requested for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and eggs.

loans.use: buy maize flour and eggs

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en:
Hoi lives with her husband and three daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband helps her to make artificial flowers to sell. Hoi started this business seven years ago. 

Hoi would like a loan to buy better quality materials that will help her to make higher quality artifical flowers and enable her to attract more customers. With this investment, she hopes to earn a higher income and be in a position to save to reinvest in her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to make artificial flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 39 and lives with her two sons and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. Hanh earns a living by sewing clothes. She began this job seven years ago.

She would like to expand her business by taking a loan to purchase materials to increase her production of clothing.

Hanh hopes that the loan will help her to expand her business to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to afford the school fees for her sons.

loans.use: To buy materials to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano said, "Being a farmer is a challenging profession, it requires more patience and sacrifices to have a plentiful harvest".  

Mariano has been a farmer for more than 30 years, planting and harvesting rice for sale. At his age of 51, he manages and supports his family and educates his only child. Sometimes they experience financial difficulty, especially when they have low production of rice, but through hard work they are able look for other sources of income in order to meet their needs.

Due to the high cost of commodities, Mariano wants to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor cost required in planting rice. He mentioned that he will use this loan in the improvement of his rice farming business to increase his yield and income for this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a married man with one minor child. He lives in a house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expense is food for his family. For the past four years, Rama has operated a retail shop and his potential clients are his neighbors. His major business challenge is poor sales due to the lack of enough customers. Rama decided to join Yehu because it helps low income earners by giving loans.

Rama is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for his shop. In the future, he dreams of building a rental house.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора жительница города Вахдат. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится заграницей. Сама Рухсора работает в ателье. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и разных костюмов. В этой области она четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки и покупки тканей. Он хочет у себя дома шить национальные платья для продажи.
texts.en: Rukhsora lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 29 years old, married and has tow children.  Her husband is abroad.  Rukhsora works at a sewing salon.  She is involved in sewing national dresses and various suits.  She has been in this business for four years.  Rukhsora is requesting this loan for the purchase of sewing machine and fabrics.  She wants to start sewing national dresses for sale at home.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos que son su prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar cuero para la fabricación de productos como fajas, bultos y demas utencilios. Don Freddy cuenta con la experiencia de varios años de trabajo en esto y cuenta con la clientela ya establecida, ademas con algunos trabajos pendientes por lo cual necesita material de trabajo. El quiere darles a sus clientes un mejor resultado con mejores acabados y utilizar materiales de buena calidad para su crecimiento con el proyecto. El quiere generar el máximo de ganancias para el bienestar de su esposa e hijos y obtener ganancias para tiempos duros en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
46-year old Freddy is married and lives with his wife and two children who are the most important people in his life.

With the loan money he plans to buy leather to make items such as belts, bags etc. He has been doing this work for several years and has an established customer base. He has several orders pending and needs the material for these orders. Freddy wishes to provide his customers with the best product possible, well-finished and from good-quality leather, so that his business will flourish and he will be able to provide for the wellbeing of his family. He also wishes to set aside some money for hard times in the future.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he has not had any other loans from state banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is offering him good credit facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his leather workshop

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, tiene la edad de 60 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y 1 hijo que son su prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar  fertilizantes  para la asistencia del frijol y maíz. Don Gilberto realizo la siembra de un terreno con el que contaba  y actualmente estos cultivos sembrados necesitan fertilizantes para tener mayores fuerzas para producir más cantidad y calidad a la hora de cosechar.  El quiere con esta asistencia que le hará, obtener el máximo de rendimiento para así al venderlo al mercado de la localidad generar los ingresos esperados para salir adelante con el crédito y las responsabilidades del hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
60-year old Gilberto is married and lives with his wife and son who are the most important people in his life.

With the loan he plans to buy fertilizer for his bean and maize crops. He has planted his fields and now needs fertilizer to make the plants grow well so he has a very good harvest. Then he will earn good money when he sells the produce in the local market and be able to make his repayments and pay for household expenses.

This is Gilberto’s first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he has not had any other loans from state banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is offering him good credit facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 33-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a nearby industrial zone. For the past three years, Anh has run a business making floor mops. She uses the income from her business to cover all her family's living expenses and her children's education fees. 

Anh’s business is going smoothly and she is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of raw materials to increase her production of mops. She hopes that her loan will increase her income, help to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make mops

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 45-year-old married father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuong runs a small general store where he sells electrical products such as fans, lights, clocks, and household appliances to people in his community. He has been in this business for ten years. 

Phuong is requesting a loan to increase the quantity and variety of the electric products and household appliances that he sells from his store. He hopes that his loan will enable him to attract new customers and better serve his existing customers. Phuong also hopes that he will increase his income and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase household electrical products and appliances

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Minh City. Her husband works for an electricity company.  In 2008, Chi opened a beauty shop in her house to serve people in her community. Her business has gone well and helps her to cover family expenses as well as the education fees of her children. 

Chi is requesting a loan to buy good quality cosmetic and beauty products to attract new customers and better meet her existing customers' needs. She hopes that her loan will increase her income and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 36, married, and has two school-aged children. He owns and manages a rice farming business to earn income and save for the sake of his family. Being a responsible father, he aims to become financially stable in order to satisfy his family's needs and educate his children. Although sometimes they encounter hardships and difficulties in life, they still have the strong determination to become successful someday, for they believe that it is their stepping stone toward success. 

In this regard, Roman patiently manages his rice farming business and wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost required in transplanting rice. He hopes that this loan will help a lot to increase his yield and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy fertilizers/pesticides & pay labor cost

loans.name: Nu

texts.en:
Nu, 49, is the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. Together with her husband and children, she lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Nu earns an income raising chickens and fish at her house. She began this business five years ago.

Nu is requesting a loan T. buy animal feed and more livestock T. raise and sell. She hopes that, through her loan, she will be able T. increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and chickens and fish to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products in order to expand product assortment

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Chung is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For three years she has operated a general store to sell household appliances, children's toys, confectionery and personal use items.

She would like a loan to purchase more of these products in bulk to stock in her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances, children's toys, confectionery and personal use items to stock in her general store.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa, 53, years old and lives in Molatuhan, Lopez, Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.
 
Josefa has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
 
Josefa has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 28-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ngoc and her husband run a business making soft rice noodles. Ngoc would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing rice in bulk. 

She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to make soft noodles.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is single. 

Rosalinda has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store. 

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 41-year-old married woman with a daughter. She lives with her famiL. in Ho Minh City.  

In 2007, Anh and her husband bought a sugarcane squeezing machine to make sugar-cane juice to sell from their stall. The business has been going smoothL. and helps them to be able to cover their basic famiL. expenses. 

Anh would like to get a loan to repair her stall and buy some new furniture and beverages for selling. She hopes that this will attract new customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will increase her income and be able to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To repair her stall and buy some new furniture and beverages.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 35 years old and is married. She has 2 daughters and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Anh and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a general store at their house. Anh intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of foods to sell from her general store, such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of foods to sell, such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 22, single, and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In 2009, she opened a shop to provide clothes and accessories for renting for parties, special occasions, plays and dancing performances.

Yen would like a loan to buy fabric and materials to make more clothes for renting. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her and her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes for renting.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 46 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. She has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Rosario has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 31 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is married with 2 children. She has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to have a large income from her business in order to help provide their daily needs. Lyn is a hardworking mother and a loving wife. She takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to use as additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Bohir

texts.ru: Бохир молодой и энергичный парень. Он оптимистичный парень с надеждой на хорошее будущее своей семьи. У него жена и двое детей.
