Он занимается купля продажей продовольственных товаров в центральном рынке города. Более 7 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Он хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие. Он хочет ремонтировать свой дом и мечтает жить в красивом доме. Бохир хотел бы получить займ в размере 7000 Сомони для осуществления своей мечты. Он заранее благодарен всем, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Bohir is a young and energetic young man.  He is an optimistic young man, who has a hope for a better future for his family.  He has a wife and two children.  Bohir is involved in buying and selling food products at the town's central market.  He has been in this business for over 7 years.  Bohir wants to improve his living conditions.  He wants to make repairs to his house and dreams of living in a beautiful house.  Bohir wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 7,000 Somoni in order to fulfil his dream.  He thanks everyone, who is supporting him, in advance.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for house repairs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 50 years of age, married and has been blessed with three children. She has been a high school teacher for almost 20 years. Imelda's eldest child is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) while the two children left are still studying. She would like to support them until they finish college level,  so the couple work hard to sustain all their needs.

Imelda has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. She is grateful because she is able to meet her work and obligation to her raised piglets. She has been raising two pigs for fattening and plans to buy three more piglets, but her fund is not enough.  So, she is requesting for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy piglets and feed. This amount would really help her improve her profit because if she provides her raised hogs with enough vitamins and feeds, she can also sell them at a greater price.  Imelda has been doing her best to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 2 сына. Она имеет 1,5 гектара посевной земли для выращивания риса и овощей. А также она занимается откармливанием скота. В данный момент она имеет 4 голов крупного рогатого скота. В этом бизнесе помогает ей её муж и сыновья. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом и для этого она запрашивает займ в размере 8000 Сомони. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbat is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is married and has two sons.  She owns 1.5 hectares of sowable land for growing rice and vegetables.  She is also involved in fattening up livestock.  Currently, she has four heads of cattle.  Her husband and sons help her in this business.  Muhabbat wants to make repairs to her house and is requesting a loan in the sum of 8000 Somoni for this purpose.  She thanks all of you in advance for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repairs

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 42 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 20 and 16.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Kalamkas

texts.ru: Каламкас 54 года, вдова  и воспитывает двух детей. В 1991 году Каламкас начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Каламкас использовала стартовую сумму в 9,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство с численностью в 5 голов коров и 1 лошади.  Благодаря ежемесячной прибыли в сумме 7,500 сом (KGS) Каламкас покрывает ежедневные расходы своей семьи и откладывает деньги на обучение для своих детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каламкас обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Каламкас планирует заготовить корма  и сено для скота на зиму.
texts.en: Kalamkas is 54 years old, a widow and is raising two children.  She started her business of breeding livestock and reselling agricultural products in 1991.  Kalamkas used a starting a capital of 9,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and was able to develop her business to contain five heads of cattle and one horse.  Thanks to her monthly profit of 7,500 som (KGS), she covers daily family expenses and saves money for her children's education.  In order to further develop her business, Kalamkas requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  In the near future, with the help of earnings from the loan, Kalamkas plans to prepare livestock feed and hay for the winter.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Radika

texts.en:
Radhika is 37 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 17 and 15.  In 2002, she established her cow's milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Radhika plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia has operated a business of butchery in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. She is 42 years old, married to Samuel, and they have four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her sixth loan. She paid all of her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep and cattle.

In future, Teresia hopes to expand the business and become the best business woman in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Serah Wambui

texts.en:
Sarah has practiced farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 40 years old, married to Stephen Karanja, and they have four children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fifth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In future, Sarah hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beads for making jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Astamaya

texts.en:
Astamaya is 50 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 25 and 20.  In 2001, she established her furniture making business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and lumber.  In the future, Astamaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and lumber.

loans.name: Bhelrey

texts.en:
Bhelrey is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Bhelrey has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas. Bhelrey has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. 

In the future, Bhelrey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of green and yellow bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Berdiyor

texts.ru: Бердиер занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции. У него большая семья – жена и четверо детей. Выращивание сельхозпродукции  работа трудоемкая, но доходная. От продажи урожая он получает хорошие доходы. Часть продукции он продает, а часть сохраняет для продажи зимой или  ранее весной по более высоким ценам. Бердиер хотел бы получить займ с помощью которого хочет построить помещение для хранения картофеля. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Berdiyor is involved in growing agricultural products.  He has a large family - a wife and four children.  Growing agricultural products is a hard, but profitable job.  Berdiyor earns a good income from the sales of his harvest.  He sells a portion of the overall product and saves some for sales in the winter or early spring at higher prices.  Berdiyor wants to obtain a loan, with the help of which he wants to build a space for storing potatoes.  He hopes that the creditors will support him.

loans.use: to build a space for storing potatoes

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Krishna Kumari is 42 years old. She is married and has 5 children, ages 21, 17, 15, 13 and 6. In 2001, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, Krishna Kumari supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. 

In the future, Krishna Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 35 years old and single. For the past 11 years, he has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. Stephen was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be his first loan.  

Stephen is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he hopes to engage in a more diversified dairy farming business in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old and is widowed with two children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Emma has run a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

Emma is requesting a 15,000 PHHP loan to buy more merchandise to sell. In the future she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old and married to Anita. The couple has one child. For the past three years, Richard has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this is his first loan. 

Richard is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he hopes to add more dairy cows and increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and is married with a child. She lives in Bolibol,Oroquieta City. Marilou has a clothing business and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP monthly. She has been a member of PMPC for one month.

Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has for the last five years earned a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 24 years old and has earned a living for the last 11 years by running a rental business in the town of Njambini. She is married and has two children. Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is now applying for her first loan. She plans to use the loan to renovate the  houses which she rents out. In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business by building larger houses.

loans.use: To renovate rental houses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 52 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has three children and earns about PHP 3,000 month by running a business where she sells snacks. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy ingredients to make more snacks to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lunke

texts.en: Lunke is 38 years old and has for the last 10 years earned a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his second loan. He repaid his first loan fully and on time, and plans to use this new one to buy more sheep to raise. His goal for the future is to increase his income by buying land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to raise.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат молодой предприниматель, заботливый сын и хороший семьянин. Источником его дохода является предоставление услуги такси населению. Он в семье является единственным кормильцем. Его жена домохозяйка, а родители на пенсии и он помогает им. Недавно у Фурката родился сын и он решил продать свой старый автомобиль и купить новую и таким образом улучшить условие своего бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу поддержку в получении кредита и заранее благодарить вас всех за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Furkat is a young entrepreneur, a caring son and a good family man.  Providing a taxi service to residents is his source of income.  Furkat is the sole provider for his family.  His wife is a homemaker, and parents are retired, and he helps them.  Furkat recently had a son, and he decided to sell his old car and buy a new one and, thus, improve his business conditions.  He hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan and thanks all of you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been working in the transport industry in Njabini town for the last  nine years. He is 35 years old, married to Elizabeth and they have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to service his pick-up. 

In future, Peter hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market in Njabini town.

loans.use: To service his pick-up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Chonibek

texts.ru: Чонибек проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он уже четыре года предоставляет услугу. Развозит людей по маршруту Вахдат-Оби шурак. Целью получения кредита является приобретение запасных частей для автомашины.
texts.en: Chonibek lives in the Vahdat district.  He is 31 years old, married and has two children.  He has been providing a service for four years.  Chonibek transports people along the Vahdat-Obi route.  The goal of this loan is to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 43 years old and is a married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Ma. Gina's husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Gina has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. She sells items like soft drinks, rice, corn and daily use products like soap and shampoo. Each month, Ma. Gina earns 15,000 PHP with her sari-sari store business. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, soap, rice and corn. Ma. Gina hopes to improve her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, soap, rice and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Nani Maya

texts.en:
Nani Maya is 44 years old, married and has three children aged 22, 18 and 16.  In 1997, she went into business as a vegetable farmer. She works seven days a week, five hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Her goal for the future is to improve her family's living conditions, and she extends sincerest thanks to Kiva lenders for their support.

Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers can buy greater amounts of seed and fertilizer which they use to grow cash crops to sell in their local market. These sales allow households to move beyond subsistence farming by generating much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is 25 years old. She is married and has one child, age six. In 2006, she established her tea shop. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Urmila plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked, while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 32 years old, sells vegetables. She earns 7.50 USD per day. She has one child who is one year old. Chenda lives with her parents. Every month, she has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 5 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to the market to sell. She wants to buy a small store in the market to sell vegetables; now she sells on the ground because doesn’t have enough money to pay for a store.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to the market

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Edna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and gasoline per liter. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and gasoline. Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and gasoline

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman who has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Jocelyn has a sari-sari store (general store) in Talibon, Bohol. She sells various items like noodles, canned goods, and vegetables. Jocelyn also cooks delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. She also raises pigs and chickens in her backyard. Jocelyn does all these activities to support her family, especially her children's education. She requested a loan to buy piglets and more items to sell in her store, such as canned goods and vegetables. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loans.use: to buy piglets and items to sell in her store, such as canned goods and vegetables

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is willing to work hard every single day in his corn farm business because he wants to give his family a good quality of life.

Danilo is 43 years old and lives with his family in the village of Maligaya, Cauayan city, Isabela. He hopes to maintain his farm business to be able to send his children to school and to give them a good quality of life.

At this time, Danilo aims to improve his corn farm business, but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farm business. Danilo hopes to maintain his farm business to secure his family's future.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and corn seedlings

loans.name: Neermala

texts.en: Neermala is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 6. In 2001, she established her tea shop business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Neermala plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials for her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is  35 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She sells shoes and handbags in Mtopanga, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last year. 

This marks Leah’s second time borrowing to finance her business which is doing well. With this loan she plans to add more stock of shoes and handbags to her business inventory. 


The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be ploughed back for gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy stock of shoes and handbags for sale.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 22 and 20.  In 2001, she established  her furniture business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and timbers for her business.  In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buys wood and timbers.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 29 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 6.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets and store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's "kurta surwal" and men's "daura surwal".  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth, other materials, or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 21 years.  She is 59 years old, married to Kimwe, and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In future, Esther hopes to expand her farming and increase her income in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, e.g., manure, seedlings, and  insecticides.

loans.name: Rodolita

texts.en:
Rodolita is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rodolita has a shop that sells "longganisa" or home-made sausage. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making "longganisa".

Rodolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making "longganisa" (sausage).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and wheat seeds

loans.name: Jong

texts.en:
Jong, 48 years old, plants vegetables to sell with his wife and earns $6 per day. They have four children: three are studying and one more is working and earns $3 per day. Every month, he has to spend $70 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to pay for his children's school fees and buy other school materials for them. He wants to help all of his children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and other school materials.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 34 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 12.  In 2002, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's 'kurta surwal' and men's 'daura surwal'.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertiliser.

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 8.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Rabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's 'kurta surwal' and men's 'daura surwal'.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 43-year-old single woman, living and working in Ain. Saada opened a  grocery store three years ago to secure her living and to prove to her neighbors that a single woman can make her own living through a small business, that by her enthusiasm and hard work she can turn to a very important business that can provide her with life’s necessities, in  order not to ask for others' help since the government doesn’t take any interest in elderly people. So, Saada is thinking about her future life, and how she has to make her own living. 

That’s why she requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to increase her shop’s merchandise with the necessary autumn-winter products highly requested during these seasons, since transportation in these two seasons becomes hard, so most villagers prefer to buy from a nearby grocery shop than heading to a faraway mall. This helps in improving her business during these season and it’s almost the same during the summer season since most of the citizens come to spend the summer season in their beloved village.

Saada hopes to expand her business more and more in the future. She hopes to keep her shop updated with all newly released products.

loans.use: To expand her shop’s merchandise.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years.  He is 29 years old, married to Wambui, and they have one school-going child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this is his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In future, Stephen hopes to expand his farm and improve his farming methods and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is 37 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 19, 16 and 9.  In 2001, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Nakali plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a "pasal", is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Ya, 56 years old, sells beans and yams earning $5 per day. Her husband is a farmer earning $1 per day. They have three children; all are working in the garment factory and each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on rental fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy cattle for resale. The loan will help her to buy two cattle that can transport beans and yams to sell, and she will sell those cattle when there is a good price.

loans.use: To buy two cattle to transport beans and yams to sell.

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 17 and 14.  In 1998, she established  her vegetable farm business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy footwear, blankets and clothes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Catherine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Catherine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Catherine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 59-year-old married lady. She runs a green grocery in Jomvu, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last six years. This is Jackline’s second time borrowing to finance her business, which is doing well. With this loan, she plans to add to her stock of vegetables and fruits for her business. The anticipated profits that will be generated from the loan will be plowed back into the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful businessperson.

loans.use: add more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep is a 47-year-old hardworking woman from Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She was married but divorced her husband many years ago. She lives with three single children. 

To earn a living, Tep is involved in the business of selling breakfast food including pork porridge and Chinese noodle in her community. She generally earns about US$3 per day from her business. Her two children also help support the family by working in various jobs.

As shown in the photo, Tep’s house is built on the water, therefore it’s really hard to live during the rainy season. She wants to build a new house higher than the water level, but she doesn’t have enough money to do this. So she decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to build a new house that can provide her family with a comfortable living.  For her prospects, she’ll expand her selling business and maximize her profit.

loans.use: build a new house

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 39 years old, married to Njuguna, and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing clients and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In future, Florence hopes to expand her business as well as improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 43-year-old married man, father of two beautiful children, and they represent his whole life. Imad is a hard-working man: he works in construction, and he is a good builder. Most of his customers are nearby villagers, in addition to contractors and builders who highly recommend him. 

Imad is a man with a very good reputation. In addition to taking care of his own family, Imad works hard to help his other family members in improving their living especially his brothers. That’s why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, to help his brother with his wedding in addition to buying new improved tools necessary for his own business.

Imad is very proud of himself. He describes himself as "the friend indeed", since he replies to others' requests as much as he can, because he hates to know that someone needs help and he can do nothing. 

He hopes that one day he can help a big part of his community through opening a big construction company and providing a lot of business for them.

loans.use: To buy new improved extra tools for his business and to help his brother with his wedding

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquietq City. She is married with three children. 

Teresita has business buying and selling Ready-To-Wear clothing and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 39 years old and married with  seven children. She runs a tailoring business in Jomvu, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last ten years. 

This marks Zainabu's  third time borrowing to finance her business which is doing well. With this loan she plans to purchase more cloth materials, buttons, zips, scissors and thread for her business. 



The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be ploughed back for gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth materials, buttons, zips, scissors and thread.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Vilma has a shop where she buys & sells firewood. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of firewood.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of firewood.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim, 50 years old, is a pig feeder who earns $5 per day. Her husband sells palm products and also earns $5 per day. There are no children staying with them. Every month, Nim has to spend $45 on food and $20 on transportation. She wants to feed more pigs with modern techniques so that she can earn more income. Besides feeding pigs, she also makes palm sugar to sell with her husband.

Nim would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он артист. Кроме того он играет на разных музыкальных инструментах. Сафарали в основном поет на свадьбах. В этой области он семь лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения музыкального инструмента (цифровой пульт).
texts.en: Safarali lives in the Dangara district.  He is 25 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Safarali is a performer.  Besides this, he plays various musical instruments.  Safarali primarily sings at weddings.  He has been in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a musical instrument (digital console).

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 51 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married and has four children.
 
Thelma has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has operated a business in the transport industry in Njabini for the last five years. He is 29 years old and married to Catherine. They have one child. 

His primary venture is the motorcycle business and he plans to venture into farming. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid for all his previous loans well and on time. He plans to use the loan to buy a cow, as well as in his transport business. 

In the future, Moses hopes to buy a matatu (minibus) to boost his business.

loans.use: To support his transport business and buy a cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 21 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling soap and cooking oil in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to help her purchase more goods for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soap, rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 35-year-old lady. She sells charcoal and firewood in Bamburi, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last three years. 

This marks Debora’s third loan to finance her business, which is doing well. She plans to purchase more firewood and charcoal with this loan. The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be reinvested for the gradual expansion of her business and the repayment of the loan. 

Debora’s dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy, age 48, who is a resident of GMA, Cavite City in the Philippines. She is a single mother to her three children, two of whom are already working while one is still staying at home. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Dorcy operates a tailoring business. She mainly tailors curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home accessories. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she also sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dorcy hopes her business grows, and she dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a 51-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband runs a junk shop. Martina owns and manages a sari-sari store business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells shampoo, soap, vinegar, soy sauce and other kinds of products. Martina says that the store has been helpful to her family's daily needs. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and biscuits. Martina hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and biscuits.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en: Hector is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children. Hector has a shop that sells fish, including sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell. Hector has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Hector hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve her document preparation and copy services office

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 61 years old and married. He owns a bakery, which he has run since 1993. He is well known in the region for his delicious Manakish, a  popular Levantine pastry consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat.

Salah is a hardworking man with a very good reputation. He is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a bigger oven and large quantities of necessary raw materials such as flour, salt, oil, thyme, and cheese.

Salah works hard to keep his products affordable to everyone in his region. He hopes to improve his business in the future by either opening a new branch or adding items to his menu.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Khoeun, 39 years old, is a farmer earning $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $5 per day. They have four children, three are studying and one more is working in a factory earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy cow to raise for farming and sell its baby. She plans to repair her house and would like to sell groceries in front of the house.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise for farming and sell its baby.

loans.name: Rowell

texts.en:
Rowell is 28 years old and still single. He is a helpful son whose priority in life is to have a stable source of income in order to help his parents.  Rowell is engaged in a hog raising business.  He has been in this type of business for four years.

Rowell wanted to expand his business by buying additional piglets to raise.  Since he has insufficient funds, Rowell is asking for financial support amounting PHP 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for maintenance.

In the future, Rowell will have his own family but he will first develop his business. His profit from the business will serve as the financial support in forming his own future family.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for the flea market.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 33-year-old married man, father of four children. Three years ago, Mahmoud opened a grocery store, hoping to improve his family’s social and financial situation. He used to work in construction and specialized in pasting tiles, but unfortunately he dealt with bad constructors that made his financial situation very bad, which made him turn to a more requested product for human beings which is food. 

Mahmoud is a hard-working man; he is working hard to improve his newly established business, through a first-time loan he applied for from Al Majmoua, to purchase new merchandise for his business requested by most of his customers. These products will help in increasing his income and attracting new customers.

Mahmoud hopes to make necessary changes to his shop, especially to his walls, shelves and many necessary decorations in the future.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is 56 years old. She sells musical instruments with her husband earning $8 per day. They have four children; one is studying and the other three are working in a factory each earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $144 on food, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy musical instruments to sell. The couple doesn’t want to change their career because they have been selling instruments since 2000 and this career can make good income and is not so tiring.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments to sell.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: 50-year-old Ophelia earns a living through farming. She is married and has four children. Ophelia primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has been in this business for five years now. Ophelia requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have another source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, 50 years old, is a sweets seller who earns $3.50 per day. Her husband is a soldier and earns $1 per day. They have one child, a five-year-old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to bU. wood to repair their house. She doesn't want to change her career of selling sweets because this career can make good income for her family.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her house

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is 28 years old and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. She is married and has seven children. 

Joanna has a fish vending business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Joanna has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33, married, and a mother of two children. She runs a tailoring business in Jomvu, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last five years. 

This is her second loan to finance her business which is doing well. With this loan she plans to purchase more cloth, buttons, zips, scissors and threads for her business. 

The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be reinvested for the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful businesslady.

loans.use: purchase more cloth, buttons, zippers, scissors, and threads

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 55 years old. He sells food and groceries with his wife at home and earns $11 per day. They have three children, two are helping Sopheap to sell food and one more is working in a factory, earning $3.50 per day. 

Every month, he has to spend $100 on food, $40 on electricity, and $25 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more grocery goods to sell in his store. He plans to extend the grocery store to sell more goods so that he can make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 43 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She runs a food kiosk in Kiwandani, Kilifi. Her business has been in operation for the last two years. 

This marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business which is doing well. With this loan she plans to purchase vegetables and fruits, charcoal, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal for her business. 

The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be reinvested for the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful businesslady.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits, charcoal, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 66 years old,  widowed, and has five adult children. She runs a tailoring business, where she makes clothes and provides general clothing alterations to the people in her community. She also makes curtains and bed covers. Each month, Elsa nets  4,000 PHP from her business. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cloths, threads, and other tailoring materials. Elsa hopes for her business and living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, threads, and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 40  years old, is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband provides motor taxi service earning $3 per day. They have one child and she is working in the factory earning $2 per day.  Every month, Srey has to spend $80 on food, $14 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to complete the money she has to buy a van for her husband to use to transport garment factory workers to work so that he can make other income.

loans.use: To buy a van for her husband to use to transport garment factory workers to work.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Carlita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, bread & snacks like rice cakes. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Carlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Carlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tea leaves, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom, 44 years old, is a farmer earning $2 per day. Her husband is a soldier earning $5 per day. They have three children; two are studying and one is working in a company earning $2 per day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 on electricity, and $14 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work. She wants to support her children to study at least until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work.

loans.name: Nakri

texts.en: Nakri, 40 years old, is a farmer earning $2 per day. Her husband is a chief of construction workers earning $7 per day. They have two children, and both are studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work. Nakri wants to buy peanuts to boil and sell in Phnom Penh city because she saw her villagers do it and can make good income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work.

loans.name: Lurcille

texts.en:
Lurcille is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lurcille has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Lurcille has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lurcille hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Because of his determination to improve his family's living situation, Eddie does everything to attain a good quality of life. He has devoted himself full-time to his corn farming business for over 20 years and earned approximately PHP 70,000 with his last crop. 

Eddie is 41 years old, married and has six school-aged children. He aims to improve his corn farming business, but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his corn farming business. Eddie hopes to maintain his farm business for the future of his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and corn seedlings

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 30 years old, a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school.  She has a business selling tomatoes and onions in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more onions for sale. The profits of this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase  more onions for sale.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Amarjargal is 47 years old and lives with her two sons in her apartment in Baganur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband died five years ago. Her elder son has just graduated from college and her  younger son goes to college. She started her business in 2004 by renting a small workshop to run her tailoring business. She is certified and has got excellent skills. She is well-known for her skill in the neighborhood. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "I have a vision to expand my business and increase my income." She is requesting 1,000,000 to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 28 years old and married to Anne. They are blessed with two children six years and two years old. He has a business rearing pigs and he has been in business for six years and right now his monthly income is KES 14,000.

He is taking out a loan of KES. 20,000 which he intends to use to buy piglets for resale. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to repay the loan and to expand his business. 

This is his first loan. His hopes and dreams are to have a permanent home and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Pearun

texts.en: Pearun, 31 years old, is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband is a chief of construction workers earning $3 per day. They have three children; two are studying and one more still too small to send to school. Every month, Pearun has to spend $30 on food, $2 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work. She plans to repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work.

loans.name: New Creation Group

texts.en:
Trinity is a young lady aged 20. She is single  and she looks after her aging parents. She lives in Gweru and she has been operating a flea market business for three years. She is mainly specialising in selling generators, blankets and shoes. she also has income from a part-time job with the Forestry Commission.

She is applying for a loan of $400 which she wants to use to add a variety of goods such as electrical goods: televisions and DVDs and other household goods in order to increase her revenue base.

With additional income generated,  she intends to buy a stand and build a house on it so that her parents will be able to stay with her. Her future plan is to have a shop in Gweru.

loans.use: to buy shoes, televisions and DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To  buy chicken feed and day-old chicks.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 31-year-old married man, owner of a bookshop since July 2010. He is new in this business and is working hard to improve it. Hassan used to work at a medicine factory, but he insisted on taking the step forward to run his own business. He opened this bookshop with excitement and hope, the hope that he will succeed and won’t regret this step.

 Hassan is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy a color photocopy machine, very important and highly requested in his business, and to increase his business products with special cardboard, painting brushes, pens and many other student-requested materials to reach a level where everything is available.

Hassan hopes that his bookshop will be the number one in the region; it only needs patience and hard work, as he states.

loans.use: To buy a new improved color photocopy machine and other supplies.
